Reviews.Title: If you want a "cheap and cheerful" waterproof camera, this one is great
Reviews.Author: Eric Schurr
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a simple point-and-shoot that you can take underwater, this camera is great.Let me begin by explaining that I am an avid photographer;  I have over $10,000 in high end DSLR equipment and lenses.  I have over 20,000 photos in my collection.  I know something about photography.I recently went on a sailing vacation with my family and wanted a simple digital camera to take in the water. I wasn't looking for something high-end because all i really wanted to do was shoot pics of my kids snorkeling and scuba diving.  I didn't want a disposable because they aren't digital, you usually have to wind them which is a real pain in the water, and they shoot poor pictures.  My wife bought me a $500 top-of-the-line underwater point-and-shoot Panasonic Lumix but I took it back because it was overkill.  It was waterproof to 40 feet, had an altimeter, etc --  I didn't need all that.  I found this Kodak camera and it was perfect.  It worked great -- we took on jet skis, on snorkeling trips, and down to 11 feet underwater scuba diving.  It never had an issue -- it started up quickly, operated simply and reliably, and the photos are just fine. Frankly, the videos are even better -- I was surprised at good they are!  Of course, the photos don't compare to my $2,000 Nikon DSLR, but I wasn't expecting them to.  I just wanted a camera that could capture some of the memories of the water fun on our sailing trip, and this did it.

Reviews.Title: Performed Flawlessly Underwater during 8 Day Maui Trip
Reviews.Author: W. Ball

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3LLQNA74UATXcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3LLQNA74UATXcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:44 MinsThis video was recorded as I snorkeled over a reef just off Kaanapali Beach, a few hundred yards north of our hotel (Honua Kai)- not the nicest reef by far, but this video should demonstrate the camera's surprisingly good capabilities, especially considering the low price. It was late afternoon and the water was a bit murky, and I was surprised how well the video came out. I have uploaded the raw avi file (66.9 MB; 44 seconds). This camera shoots VGA (640x480). Amazon processing reduced the resolution and quality, although it still looks fairly faithful to what I uploaded. Although I read reports of this camera failing rapidly underwater, ours did not present any problems after spending many hours underwater. It appears just about all the underwater cameras have about a 10-20 per cent failure rate based on rates in reviews here on Amazon. So, I decided not to risk $200-300 on a more expensive underwater camera, as they seemed no more reliable. The camera is fixed focus but seems to have enough depth of field to present sharp pictures. Note that the fixed focus offers an advantage with snapshots - shutter delay is VERY short.

Reviews.Title: nice camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: willie "roadie"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: Kodak's bankruptcy and exit from the digital camera business probably means that these cameras will be gone forever! I have the updated C135 in pre-order, but I'm not holding my breath. Amazon says it's 'unavailable,' but my account's order status has the C135 shipping in April. Who knows? All I know is that I'm glad I own a backup C123 in the box. The C135 is supposed to have digital stabilization, as opposed to no image stabilization in the C123 - but the C123 still takes great pics for its intended purpose.although it's more orange than red, i like my new c123... i carefully read every review, and although i can understand why some folks are disappointed, i am more than happy with this camera after playing with it, taking indoor, outdoor, and yes, even close-up shots!the controls are fairly intuitive, but i found that i had to set up the camera before it would take acceptable pictures (specifically, the 'sharp' selection under 'Sharpness' on the Capture menu; you may also want to manually select an ISO if you're going to be in the same lighting conditions for your picture session - see below)this camera works with my version of iPhoto on an older iMac, so i'm grateful - the kodak setup was fairly easy: plug in the camera, turn it on, install the resulting kodak.pkg from the Desktop, etc. ... i use 'Other Application' for the 'Computer Connection' item under the Setup menu...UPDATE: i have since found that there is no reason to use any Kodak software with my C123 and iPhoto, since iPhoto recognizes the C123 and imports pictures with no problems - and especially since i can (if i wish) send iPhoto pics straight to facebook if desired (something i rarely do)this camera's firmware is deceptively sophisticated, but honestly, these were all the initial settings i used...you *will* have to hold this camera steady! it does NOT have 'shake reduction' featured in most higher-end cameras...that said, anyone who knows photography knows that it's not the camera that makes the best pictures, but the photographer's eye (and to a degree, technique)i was a bit apprehensive about the lack of macro shots, but tried a 24" flash pic of some stuff on my desk - the picture came out perfectly sharp and acceptable, considering this is an inexpensive camerai next tried to take pictures indoors, with no flash, use the digital zoom about a third out... first, i tried the 'Auto' ISO mode; next, i set the camera to ISO 80... carefully bracing the camera, i squeezed off one shot each of a stack of books about 20 feet away in the living room...the results were as i expected: the ISO 80 picture was noticeably 'sharper'... so there is a some manual control available to the picture taker...i have no intention of going snorkeling with this camera, but wanted something that will be impervious to dust, dirt, or sand at the beach - in this regard, this little kodak will fit the bill perfectly... it's compact, uses AAs, has simple controls, tripod socket, and accepts an SD or SDHC card (although it did not like my 16GB Adata, but worked fine w/a 4GB microSDHC in an SDHC carrier taken straight from my Canon A570is and stuck in - even the Canon's pictures showed up under the C123's preview! w00t!)five stars for this camera for me - i look forward to an improved model or firmware... i also recommend going to kodak's web site to get the 'extended c123 user guide' - there are more hints and tips in the manual

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Teachermom
Reviews.Content: We recently purchased this camera for our Disney Cruise.  Our seven year old son was scheduled to snorkle with stingrays on Castaway Cay and we wanted to capture that experience.  We were able to take photos and video of him with the stingrays, some of it underwater.  The camera took clear pictures and video.  The only drawback was it is hard to see the screen (so you know what you are photographing) and there is no viewfinder but that problem was easily outweighed by the price.  We are very pleased with our purchase!

Reviews.Title: performs exactly as I expected, great for the pool!
Reviews.Author: Jynna

} } } Length:: 0:16 MinsHave only had this a couple of weeks but this camera is turning out to be great for the pool.A great price for a camera I can re-use and not have to worry about getting wet.Takes great pics in/under the water and you can also record videos (no zoom when in video mode).When turning on it is ready to take pictures very quickly.So far it has not eaten batteries, which is good because it does not appear to turn off automatically.Has other modes if you want to use the camera for more than taking pictures in the water but we have not really tried them out.ETA:Soon, I am going to attempt to upload a video taken in our pool. Also, wanted to add one great thing about this camera - we left it out side overnight and it rained. It was really a relief to know that my camera didnt get ruined simply because I forgot to bring it in after swimming!Kids are having a great time using this camera, so much so I may have to go ahead and pick up a 2nd one! It is really holding up to being roughly handled.added a very short clip of my dog. my son uses the camera 1st above the water then underneath and then above again. I have also noticed that when in video mode, the camera is picking up sound underwater! it's pretty cool, I wasn't expecting that.

Reviews.Title: Extreme Surprised!!
Reviews.Author: TashaPhD
Reviews.Content: I was truly blown away by the picture quality!  I just printed some of the pictures and they look way better than I anticipated from a waterproof camera - insanely inexpensive at that.  I kept the camera submerged for long periods of time and I never noticed any sort of leakage.  My vacation would not have been complete without it...serious!Only drawback is the speed at which you can take multiple pictures in repetition.  The screen takes a second to process the photo so you have to wait a few seconds to take another picture.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable value
Reviews.Author: Herb
Reviews.Content: I purchased this last minute from another retailer for a trip to the Cayman Islands where I knew we would be doing extensive snorkeling. In the past, I have rented underwater cameras while there or used disposable cameras and had the photos developed. I couldn't believe the quality of the pictures considering the price of the camera.I agree with some of the other reviewers in that it is difficult to see the screen when it is bright out. I found that setting the LCD brightness to maximum helped to relieve this but I still had to be at the correct angle to see it clearly. Like all compact UW cameras, the flash is fairly ineffective due to back-scatter unless the water is crystal clear or the subject is within a foot or so of the camera.Regardless, i can't recommend this highly enough. While some of the adjustments are limited, from an underwater camera standpoint, this is a deal that can't be beat. I think that it compares favorably with the low end Fuji camera at about half the price. I think one of the best things is that it uses AA batteries and sips them at that. I was averaging about 140 shots per day (50% with flash) with camera on and ready to shoot (read screen on and active) for at least a 3 to 4 hours hours a day and two alkaline AA batteries would last about 2 days. I will test with NiMH and update the review later. I was also able to exceed the depth limitation and still take pictures but YMMV (I took several pictures at around 15 ft.).Most of the modes work reasonably well for a cheap Point and Shoot camera. Obviously, it is not a DSLR (or even advanced P&S;) but still highly serviceable. My only complaint in this area is that in UW mode the camera caused a greenish cast on most all pictures. It would be nice to be able to set white balance manually to avoid this but it was a simple fix with Photoshop Elements (I would imagine that it is simple with other photo editors, too).If you are planning a vacation where you will be taking underwater photos in shallow water, buy one of these. Basically, you can buy this camera for the cost of 2 disposable 35mm UW cameras and photo processing fees and you will be able to use the camera again and again.Update:One other issue/nice to have is close focus (I think that other reviewers may have mentioned this). Once you are closer than about 12" focus becomes iffy. Some times it works, some times it doesn't. It would be nice to have a dedicated macro mode but I am still exceedingly happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Frustrated!
Reviews.Author: 2cms
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for a trip to Cabo.  It took some good pictures on my fishing trip but water penetrated the body in 2 feet of water later.  I have never written a review on Amazon but was moved to do so by my experience with this camera. I was able to access the pictures from my card after drying it but the camera is now worthless. This camera may be okay if you treat it as "water resistant" but I would not submerge it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our honeymoon to Hawaii intending on abusing it in the ocean, and did just that. We used the camera for underwater pictures, video, and even for a lot of normal pictures out and about. Having given the camera a hard drive, here is my honest feed back:Cost - This camera is a great price in comparison to other underwater digital cameras, which you really have to want to invest in. We already have a number of cameras, and specifically got this just for water photos. If you want a camera for the rest of your life that may take pictures in and out of water, you might want to consider investing is something a little higher in quality, but for getting a majority of your underwater shots, invest in this camera over disposables. Trust me, it's worth it!Underwater picture quality - We took a lot of video and pictures while snorkeling, and the pictures for the most part turned out amazing. Don't get me wrong, some are dark and some are blurry... but most of the pictures, and especially the videos actually turned out really nice. One important point, the lense is fixed. Therefore, the lense does not move in and out when zooming. I noticed that the more you zoom, the less quality the picture is. Just something to keep in mind.Water-proofing - We did not have a single problem with this. We took the camera in the ocean, a waterfall, and in the pool, and not once did we have water get into the camera. Take care of the camera and make sure the doors/seals are closed, and this camera will handle the water well.Finally, one last point is on the lense fogging. This DOES happen when getting in and out of water (mostly with temperature changes). The fastest way I found to defog the lense is turn it off, and then place the lense in direct sunlight. The fogging will disappear in a few minutes.I know this is too long, but in summary - The camera is a great choice for someone that wants much higher quality than disposable cameras, wants to take underwater pictures, and has another camera for the rest of your high quality day-to-day pictures (aka not in the water). If you want an all around high quality camera for in and out of water, maybe looking into getting a more expensive waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Shania
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 15 year old son who is taking a 2 week hiking trip.  He hasn't actually taken the trip yet, but he's been playing around with the camera (we both have, actually) at home to get comfortable with its features and abilities.  Considering the price, I am actually quite impressed.  Aside from the price, there are two reasons I choose this camera.  First, it is waterproof (to 10 feet)and could therefore withstand getting dropped in a puddle or rained on. The waterproof feature just takes that type of worry out of the equation.  My son is also a competitive swimmer, so I fully expect he will at some point also enjoy it in the pool with his friends.  The second reason for choosing this camera was the "easy share" of the pictures.  You set up emails or a facebook account in advance, then as you take the pictures you choose where you will share them (email, facebook).  To actually share them, you will need to plug into a computer, but then it will automatically and quickly send those pictures to wherever you have designated.  (Hint:  you need to designate an email to send from and a yahoo or gmail account are the easiest to use to set up... techies may know more, but this worked best for me).  The biggest suprise was the pictures themselves.  The quality is actually not bad.  Professional photographers and photo enthusiasts of course would not be satisfied, but for a 15 year old boy or me, this works pretty good.  Settings for lighting, etc. are available and are pretty simple to use.  Video is good in good lighting.  Lighting is probably the key to all, but we haven't had any problems so far with any light (assuming use of the flash in poor lighting).  Things that I would like to see would be the ability to associate with more than one facebook account at a time and a view finder so that you could see what you were doing in bright sunlight, but these are minor disadvantages.  Given the price, this is really a very nice camera and will serve our purposes very well.

Reviews.Title: fun camera -
Reviews.Author: Picture Happy
Reviews.Content: Fun camera - we bought it in May and it is now July and water is starting to seep into the camera with each use. After each use we remove the batteries and the card to let it dry out, the good news it that it does continue to work even with the water entering the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Mike "Mike"
Reviews.Content: OK, it's not perfect but for $70 and waterproof what do you expect?  The zoom is digital, so the closer you zoom the grainier the picture gets - so I don't use it.  As a point-and-shoot without using the zoom it takes good pictures.  I took it on a canoe trip down the Shenandoah river - it performed with no problems.  If you're looking for a camera with a zoom, this is not it.  If you're looking for an inexpensive waterproof camera to weather a canoe/raft trip this will do fine.

Reviews.Title: An awesome little camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Phil Goldberg

} // ]]> var cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81sAn-8M6HS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCpreplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCpreplayImageId'); if (cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCpreplay) { cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCpreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81sAn-8M6HS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81sAn-8M6HS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2MD04UN0YRTDCcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:11 MinsI was looking for an inexpensive small waterproof camera for my recent trip to the Caribbean especially to capture snorkling with the sting rays in Great Turk (see video). I was considering getting a waterproof case for my "good" camera but didn't want to risk ANY leakages thus ruining the entire camera.I bought this for $61 w/Free shipping from Amazon and got it quickly, tried it in my pool 1st and worked great. It felt weird putting it in water at first since it looks like a land digital camera. It was fantastic and easy to use. As a matter of fact I started to use it on land on vacation as well because the pictures were all sharp and clear. There are land and water settings for video as well as special "scenes" which I tried and found to work great as well. I bought a long lanyard to hang it off of my neck while snorkeling (the wrist strap is not practical).The only negative thing which was not a factor for disliking this camera was that it is a little hard to see the screen and controls when underwater, but if you take a few minutes to familiarize yourself with the settings it is not that big of a deal. Aim the camera to what you want to take pictures of.. it's digital so shoot a lot! The color may shift a bit if sun glare gets in lense, not often though. I bought an inexpensive cloth case at a local store to protect the lense which does not have a cover.People.. if the camera leaks at all, it means it is defective and just return it for another one! Do test it BEFORE you actually need it to see how it works. I've shown many people all my photos and videos at work and wished I could get some commission for how many were purchased because of that. This camera totally met all of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert Williams
Reviews.Content: I received this camera the other day.  I have taken several indoor photos with flash.. not bad (be sure to use the redeye preflash).  I have taken a number of deliberately varied outdoor photos, shade, sun, telephoto, flash fill.  The results were pretty darn good and very sharp in all cases within it's specifications.  It doesn't focus on "real close stuff".  I have not tested it for "ruggedness".  I have not used it under water.No.  It is not a Canon 7D or equivalent Nikon.  It is a $69 rugged waterproof small camera.  It seems to be exactly what it says it is and takes good photos for the price.  And I'm going to use it in places I won't take my Canon dSLR or my Canon G7.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 4 days
Reviews.Author: rcwillia
Reviews.Content: It only worked for four days.  We purchased this camera to take pictures of our 18 month old son and his first trip to the beach.  We used it in the ocean and pool.  It was always attached to my wrist while in the water.  We didn't use it to go snorkeling or diving to great depths.  We used it to take pictures while playing in the water.  The four days it worked it produced great pictures and videos but while in the pool one day I picked it up to take a picture of my son and it wouldn't turn on.  Upon further inspection we found there was water in the battery case.  The battery case was never opened so I have no idea how this happened other than poor quality.  Luckily the water didn't effect our memory card and we were able to salvage that, but the camera no longer works and I am returning it.

Reviews.Title: For the price, it's twice as nice
Reviews.Author: N. Oldani
Reviews.Content: I have now had this camera for three months now.  We use it every time we are at the pool, have taken it to the lake, and on a float trip.  I have not experienced the lack of "waterproofness" that a couple of reviews did.  This camera is great for the price.  We used to use disposable waterproof cameras and that gets expensive fast so we decided to give this a shot.  Love it.  It has already paid for itself.  There is "fog" every so often, but that is actually water drops on the lens (at least in our case).  The video is great too, considering we never had it in the water before!  All in all, this camera should NOT replace your other cameras.  Take it for what it is... a fun addition to summer and water.  And in this day and age, it is super easy to return a broken product, so even with the couple complaints, it is still worth buying... in MY opinion ;)

Reviews.Title: A very fun little camera with a few drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Becki Robins "Mother of Four"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after spending what seemed like hours researching options for underwater photography. I have a fairly expensive Nikon DSLR and another less expensive Nikon DSLR, which is the one I usually take with me to the beach or the pool. Still, even with the less expensive camera I have to be very careful to keep sand out of it, and I can't get in the water or very close to my subjects if they are in the water.I originally planned to buy an underwater housing for my less expensive camera, but I was more than a little bothered by the fact that there wasn't a single product available that didn't have one or more reviews claiming that the housing had completely failed and ruined an expensive camera. Furthermore, when this happens the company that makes the housing usually pays for a replacement of the housing, not the camera. I wasn't willing to take this kind of risk even with my less expensive camera, which would still cost upwards of $500 to replace.Then I found this little camera on Amazon.com. I really liked the idea of a cheap camera that could go underwater. If this one failed (and it sounds like about 20% of all underwater cameras, regardless of the price, do eventually develop leaks) I was out $67, and unless it failed right away it would still pay for itself, since a few underwater disposables are roughly equal to the price of this camera.I am mostly happy with my purchase. It's so much fun to be able to go out in the water with my kids and take pictures of them underwater, or splashing around and having a good time. I would never be able to get pictures like this with either of my other cameras. Even with an underwater housing, I think I would be too scared to really let go and go all the way underwater with it. With this camera I don't worry. I just go out and shoot. I can even swim with it in my hand (mine came with a floating wristband--I wouldn't recommend doing this if you don't have one because the camera doesn't float).There are three issues that made me downgrade the camera from a five star to a four star, at least two of which have been mentioned by other reviewers.1) The screen is really hard to see in bright light, and there's no viewfinder, so sometimes it's hard to know what you're shooting at.2) The shutter is slow. I'd say it takes a full two seconds from the time you press the button to the time the photo is actually captured. So you may miss some action unless you shoot about two seconds before something happens, which obviously isn't always possible.3) (And I'm surprised I haven't read any other reviews complaining about this) The camera really tends to blow out highlights, especially when you are in the water on a bright day. I actually sent my first EasyShare Sport back to Amazon.com because the problem was so bad that I couldn't get a good picture of someone just standing in my driveway after 2pm on a sunny day. The second one is much better, but the highlights are still blown in about 65% of my water shots, which is kind of annoying. I think the reflection off the water is the main culprit, so I'm not sure that much can be done although next time I will try using the exposure compensation feature when I go in the water on a bright day.In every other situation, thought, the camera works great. I got some fantastic pictures of my kids underwater at the indoor pool. Outdoor "dry" shots are pretty good, too. The overall photo quality is not awesome, but unless you're looking for blue ribbons or you print a lot of images at 8x10 or greater, I don't think you're really going to notice. And don't forget that without this camera (or one like it) you wouldn't have these underwater/in water photos at all, so a few blown highlights are really not a big deal compared to missing all those great shots altogether.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Water Camera FAILED
Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: Purchased this less than one month ago to take snorkeling in Mexico. We got it into the water, less than 3-feet, the camera would not operate. Once we exited the water, we found the camera was infiltrated by water. The screen viewer had water as did the battery and SD card compartment. SPEND more money and get a better camera!

Reviews.Title: It was SPLASHTASTIC = (
Reviews.Author: SweetLea

} cv_moW3DDX62EUUpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_moW3DDX62EUUpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91lXstXiE4S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moW3DDX62EUUcurrentClick) { return cv_moW3DDX62EUUcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:12 MinsI didn't want to wait to get this camera & found one at a Walmart near by me. I paid $85.00 for both the camera & sd card. I took my 2yr old son & his 2yr old best friend swimming yesterday & today. The camera takes great pictures under the water as well as out of the water. It also takes awesome videos. I wish I would have gotten this camera sooner! It's that great! The price is unbeatable! Don't spend more money on a camera & get this one. (original review 2011)Update 2012: My camera randomly stopped working outside or at the pool (under water), but it will work inside. Totally defeating the purpose of its use for at the pool. I will still buy another when pool weather returns & hope its just a fluke. Then again I did use my camera almost every single day during the summer at the pool, waterpark, & beach. It had worked great for the past 2 summers before it died on our way to the beach :(Update 2013: I ordered this exact model again at the end of June & received it the day before 4th of July. I took roughly 400 pictures & videos. I went out of town for family vacation & came home to upload all the pictures/videos & it would not upload!. I love this lil camara, but soon realized that I received model 135 (the newest model) & not model 123 (the one that I had ordered). Amazon is wonderful & said that they would refund my money. I still have no idea how to get my pictures/videos off my sd card. All my summer memories :( BEWARE that KODAK no longer offers the program to transfer your pictures/videos as it was has. This program is suppose to be built into the camera.

Reviews.Title: Totally Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Ilene M "Ilene M"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few months ago and finally got around to uploading the photos I took...and the picture quality is TERRIBLE...I can't believe this is a 12mp camera.  We purchased it when our 4 yr old Olympus waterproof died.  We didn't want to get an expensive replacement @ this time (as we have 2 Nikon SLR digitals and just needed something to carry around for everyday use), but we should have bit the bullet and stuck with the Olympus.  We took pictures at a water park (outside no flash) and some of the pictures were dark and those that weren't had drops of water on the lense, so that created a spot. (this never happened with our olympus and we used it in the water many times).  The pictures we took inside w/the flash were grainy and every person in the pictures had red eye.I wouldn't recommend this camera to anyone who's interested in picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Wards off water like a sponge!
Reviews.Author: Gil Leon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for trip to Hawaii where we planned multiple snorkel outings.  Although I read many negative reviews of the C123's water resistance, I disregarded the reviews and purchased it mainly because it was a Kodak and I trusted the branding.  We visited this beautiful cove on Maui with the most incredible coral reefs.  There were big puffer fish, eels, turtles, schools of yellow tangs and others with unbelievable shapes and colors.  And here we were with a camera that wouldn't power up after a few moments in the water.  On the plus side it does hold water like a sponge... in fact the viewer still had water in it when I shipped it back to Amazon.  Don't take a chance with this camera... after the C123 failed we purchased a Fujifilm XP at Costco in Kona.  The XP worked in and out of the water without leaking and took decent pictures.

Reviews.Title: water problems
Reviews.Author: disappointed
Reviews.Content: I had read the posted reviews that stated that a few customers did have a problem with the camera and its underwater functions.  Leakage had ben reported.  I purchased the camera anyway since we have had Kodak cameras before and we liked their performance.  We used the camera once in a 5 foot pool and took several underwater shots.  That evening, the camera would not turn on.  When I opened the battery compartment, there was moisture on one of the batteries.  The compartment had been shut properly.  I returned the product for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Expected a Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: All Psyched Up
Reviews.Content: Since this camera has received such good reviews, I expected a quality camera and was excited to use it on a family cruise vacation.  The camera was absolutely not waterproof, the camera even destroyed a $40 SD card.  Unfortunately, my cruise was outside the 30 day return policy.  So now I have no pictures, an additional loss of a brand new SD card, the requirement of paying for return shipping (which I have to figure out since the camera reamins full of water and is leaking), but I will only receive a partial refund at best.  So beware...

Reviews.Title: Poor Design for a Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: LQDestruction
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, this is a decent camera and its possible I had a bad unit.  I feel there's nothing particularly wrong with this camera except the fact that they claim its waterproof.  I bought this for my 9 year old son.  Both he and I were able to take some decent pictures.  But when we got into the water, it didn't even last 1 day in a 6ft pool.  I handled the camera most of the time and the underwater pictures where pretty good.  I put the camera away for a few hours and when I took it out again...DEAD.  No power and there was visible water inside the screen.  When I opened the battery compartment...wet.  For the money I was not too upset and it was also within 30 days of purchase so I returned it (Gotta love Amazon!)When inspecting the camera (I work with a bunch of mechanical engineers so it was inevitable that I was going try to find out what went wrong), I feel it is pretty poorly designed.  Especially the battery compartment.  There are two locking mechanisms, one to cover the batteries/SD card and one to cover the entire battery compartment.  In theory this is a good idea, however when the first mechanism is locked, a small sliver of the battery compartment is visible.  When closing the 2nd locking mechanism (the one for the entire battery compartment) there is a small gap (nothing visible) however there is also a black rubber gasket which I assumed would keep the water out.  I guess I assumed wrong.Overall, I would say that Kodak should advertise this camera as water RESISTANT because I took some great shots in the pool waterfall and great videos down the waterslide, but I think when I fully submerged the camera to take the underwater videos I signed its death warrant.  It would be good in the rain or possibly for some near surface shots.  If you take a chance on this camera I would not submerge it for longer than a few seconds.I hope this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: Not water proof
Reviews.Author: J. Walhs "jw"
Reviews.Content: My daughter desperately wanted an inexpensive waterproof camera. This seemed like the perfect camera. I purchased one from Amazon and the first time she used it in the pool, it filled with water and quickly died. I thought that maybe there was something she did not do correctly so we exchanged it for a new one. This time, I ensured that all doors were closed per the instructions. Within a few minutes having it in a four foot pool, it filled with water and died.This camera is water resistant, not water proof to 10'. This means that if you accidentally get it wet in the rain or spill water on it, the camera should be ok. It is likely great for an inexpensive outdoors camera. However, in general, I do not believe it can go under the water, even for a foot or two.

Reviews.Title: Already had to send it back to Kodak for repairs!
Reviews.Author: sillygirl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera 10 days ago for a trip to the Caribbean. I wanted to take pics in the ocean and pool, and not worry about getting sand/water in regular digital camera.  The camera worked fine for 6 days, but then completely stopped working! It says it is waterproof for up to 3 meters..but I didn't even have it underwater 3 feet! The buttons stopped functioning (flash/zoom/camera mode etc), and the only thing it does now is power on/off. As another reviewer mentioned, my lens got foggy underwater too, but I made sure the battery compartment door was sealed tight! It is definitely faulty mechanics behind this one.Of course I threw out the packaging and misplaced the receipt before I left for the trip so I don't even think I can return it to the store I purchased it from. I called Kodak today, and now I have to send it in for "possible repairs". Honestly, spend some extra money and buy a different brand that will at least last longer than this piece of junk! While it served it's purpose for my trip, I was probably better off buying a $10 disposable underwater camera instead

Reviews.Title: much better than i thought
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: The pic quality is much better than I thought. I bought the blue one, it is so cute. I carry it all day. it is easy to use and it has different color formats.The disadvantage is that it does not have cap for lense (not a zoom lense), so it is easy for dust rest on the lense.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Echo
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas. It had generally positive reviews. I took some test photos and it was easy to use. Then, I used it for the first time under water, on a vacation in the Philippines it leaked...no vacation photos! Trying to go through Kodak for customer service has been the worst. Spent at least a couple of hours via Internet trying to get them to even tell me where to send it for repair/replacement. After all that frustration, I read the info they sent me about the repair. I will only get a "refurbished" product as a replacement! I think the whole thing is pretty crappy.  Buyer Beware!

Reviews.Title: Better Than I Expected
Reviews.Author: Donald F. Schulze "Sundowner"
Reviews.Content: My initial reaction to this camera was not very good, having used it on a trip to the local waterpark, the lens started to fog up after a couple dozen pictures. But since we still had it under warranty, I decided to give it another shot. The documentation that Kodak gives you with the camera is severely lacking, so I STRONGLY suggest going to their website and check for the online documentation. That solved our problem immediately...we  weren't sliding the orange (inside) battery cover over completely.This past Sunday we went again (we have season passes, hence the purchase of a waterproof camera), I took 190 pictures before the batteries finally died down, and each one came out very good. I was actually impressed with quality. Yesterday we took it again, another 163 pictures, 99.5% of them were great (my wife wasn't too fond of the closeup of her lips, LOL. But we've been having a lot of fun with our new toy, including underwater shots of our two daughters ages 6 and 7. For the money you can't go wrong. Just be certain that both battery covers are securely closed, and let the camera dry completely before opening it up (I let ours dry overnight to be sure).

Reviews.Title: White Water Rafting Trip Purchase A-OK!
Reviews.Author: K. Berlyn "kbmalibu"
Reviews.Content: "Photos came out better than expected!"Going on a 2 day White Water Rafting trip in a week and wanted to snap some photos on the raft.After researching my options;1) Buying a waterproof 35 mm disposable 1 time use 27 pics $9.95 on Amazon2) Buying a $179 waterproof Housing for my (Canon s95 $400)3) Buying a waterproof camera for $69 unlimited usage, w/ floating wristlet.I opted for number 3.  I can shoot as many photos & video clips as I like.  If it gets broken or lost in the rapids, who cares!  If I bought a waterproof housing for $180 then lost that and my $400 camera, everyone would regret going on the trip with me later that day.After reading reviews and watching some sample videos in the reviews and on Youtube, I thought this camera would do the trick. I knew this wouldn't be equal to my S95, but just want something that can bring back some memories.TEST SHOTS...I just did some test shots and video in the house and yard, and it really isn't that bad.  The colors are a little off in some instances, (looking pale or greenish) but I could adjust in photoshop if its something I want to frame.  The photos aren't super crisp, but they do the job better than expected.  It is a fixed lens, which means you have no moving zoom (you do have a digital zoom, that I will never use, as you loose quality.)  You do have to hold the camera still and make sure your subject is not moving, or you will have blurring.  I plan to take shots when we aren't flying down the rapid, so it should be fine.  Will do video when in motion.Will try and upload some of my test shots of my yard, dog, palm trees, lavender etc.  And will do an update after the trip.

Reviews.Title: Didn't last long
Reviews.Author: Little Red Imp "I.Y.A.A.Y.A.S"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moEIJC0LMNBID4', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moEIJC0LMNBID4loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moEIJC0LMNBID4currentClick) { return cv_moEIJC0LMNBID4currentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:09 MinsThis camera is an okay camera but it didn't last too long. I took it with me to go cage diving in South Africa. It took some okay shots but since it took so long to actually take the picture, many of my photos were off center. Since I never figured out how to make a great white shark stay still, getting the picture taken quickly would have been very helpful. After about 10 shots and the short video that I added, the camera died. I opened the camera up once back on the boat and found water on my SD card and batteries. I was able to save the card but the camera no longer works. This is disappointing as it was supposed be for under water. I was never more than 8 feet under water. I have added a few pictures as well. The haze you see in both photos and video was created by the chum in the water.

Reviews.Title: Looking for a better camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Martz "Phoenix"
Reviews.Content: It is a very small compact,light camera.The wrist band gives you the added security of knowing your camera can be found in the water.I was not happy about having to change the modes all the time and they are not easy too read in bright sunlight.The most annoying thing of all and why I did not notice is there is no view finder.So you pretty much aim and hopefully what you wanted in a picture is in the screen.You can not see if it is.Underwater is even worse.So you pretty much are playing Kodak Roulette.The video quality is not very good either.Lots of lavender,pink and blue hues.If you like lavender it's OK I guess.I like true color.I might as well forgo the color and shoot in black and white.The price was great.Next time I will save another $100 and buy a Sony or Canon.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Underwater Camera WORKED GREAT
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in May 2011 and just returned from a trip to Mexico where we put it to the test.  (I had also purchased a DICAPAC underwater case for a sony camera)  The KODAK model was so easy to use.  While snorkeling, it was easy to switch back and forth from photo to video and we have great photos  and videos of fish and turtles from this camera. The videos also have sound, which I did not expect.  There is also an underwater mode, and again, it is easy to switch between modes.  My kids dove down 15 feet with the camera and everything is intact.  You might want a stronger lanyard or an neckstrap if you are snorkeling.  I much prefer the waterproof camera to the waterbag. With the bag, seeing the viewfinder was IMPOSSIBLE, so I was shooting blind.  I got some good shots this way, but it is hard to use the bag and regular camera underwater, and it is virtually IMPOSSIBLE to switch  between video and camera modes using the dicapac bag.  I had to pay 79 for this model; now the price has dropped to about 60.  for this price, I think it does a great job.

Reviews.Title: Great summer camera for kids
Reviews.Author: Maria Miglioretti
Reviews.Content: Our daughter turned 8 in May and asked for a waterproof camera. My mother originally bought her a $250 Nikon but I took it back since I don't think that is appropriate for a child that young. We bought this one instead. She loves the aqua color, and the black grip on the front makes it really easy for her to hold, especially with wet hands.The first one we got broke the first time she used it in the pool. We sent it back and got another one, and she has used it several times with no problems. It is a great little camera for a child. The image quality isn't too bad either.Our biggest complaint is that there isn't a viewer window, and when it is sunny outside, it is really hard to see with the LCD screen... I know that helps keeps costs low, but when you are primarily using this camera for outdoors, that is an issue. Second, it doesn't have a rechargeable battery... again, a cost saving measure for the manufacturer. But I know we will be going through a lot of batteries since she tends to leave it on the whole time we're at the pool.I would also recommend you buy a floating strap. The camera does not float. We spent less than $10 and got a big yellow one by Chums that is both fun and functional. She loves to wear it around her wrist and show it off like a bracelet to her friends.... and it makes the camera float which will be great when we go to the ocean in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Holly Watt
Reviews.Content: Bought this product for a float trip that we do every year. I was tired of worrying about my good camera on the river.  I couldn't beat the price especially for something I may only use once a year.I really like that the camera comes with it's own "life jacket", it makes it easy to put around your wrist, and makes sure it floats if dropped in the water.  The picture quality was good, except that the lense would get water on it and would make my pictures cloudy. I unfortunately did not notice this until after I had downloaded the pictures the first day... a simple fix though, I just made sure that I wiped the lense off before I used it and it did fine the 2nd day.The camera also does not take very good "macro" pictures as it does not have this function so trying to take close shots of flowers or such yields fuzzy pictures.  The only other downside is that in bright sunlight it is hard to see the viewfinder to take a picture... not a huge deal as you can use the eyepiece, but was kind of a downside.Overall for 2 days on a river and almost 200 pictures later, the camera fit my purpose and I ended up with shots that I might not have otherwise gotten had I not had a waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: product malfunction
Reviews.Author: maria jose
Reviews.Content: Since I started using this product, the batteries do not last even an hour when they are discharged. I thought the problem was the batteries but to replace them with new ones the problem persists, what can i do ?

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your Money!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Bennett
Reviews.Content: This camera lasted less than 30 seconds in the water. PLEASE do not waste money on this camera. A zip lock baggie would have been more waterproof. My son saved allowance money to purchase this as a gift for his sister, and he was disappointed that it was such a failure. The pictures she took on dry land, were corrupted the moment she entered the tidepool with the camera. Shame!

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera for its Price Range!
Reviews.Author: onlymee121
Reviews.Content: We have tried using the Kodak EasyShare Sport C123 (Red) (New Model) camera both in and out of water. One thing I noticed immediately is that it burns battery power fast. I was able to make around 20-30 shots when the power became low. As a workaround (because I have heard about this issue before), I bought 4 rechargeable batteries and brought them with me every time.It works great, except that it can be tricky to alter the options to maximize its photo-capturing potential. During night-time, even when there are bright lights, you still get photos that have lots of noise (average camera users should be able to understand this). The truth is that 12MP does not matter at all. Some say the photos are "pixelated" (or shows large pixels), but those are not pixels, those are noises. Anyhow, with a good picture editor, you can manage to reduce the noise, but that only means there is a need for post-processing of pictures taken during the night (or late in the afternoon or wherever the light is not as bright as the sun).It works underwater -- yes. There is no time-limit to it, only depth limit. As long as you won't be using this camera for diving, just for swimming or snorkeling, it would work great. My suggestion is that you try both the underwater photo-capturing option and the auto-settings (not underwater). Sometimes one takes better pictures than the other option. There is no way to alter the lighting or other options when in video mode, though. Just one setting (which does not fit all!)However, I have one problem with this camera. The small black sliding compartment lock under the camera (for batteries) has been stuck because of sand. We frequent beaches and the sand managed to stick to the sliding lock, making it hard for us to open the battery compartment. After we were able to remove the sand, we noticed that the metal (or spring or whatever) of the compartment door itself has some rust (this part is beneath the black rubber of the compartment door). Sea water must have penetrated. This made it hard for me to open the battery compartment door ever since.But still, the camera is still working. It still works great underwater. No water penetrates. If you want to view some of our pictures, you can check my blog at lagunapinas.com. I still use it and I definitely still love it.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: I have a dive camera that is good but too much trouble for day-to-day pool and kayak use.  I really wanted the Olympus TG-810 but didn't want another $400 camera.  Picked this up on a trial basis just based on price.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Took a bunch of pics in and around the pool and the quality was great.  It's really slow to recycle between shots but all pics were in focus and the colors wonderful.  Love that it has an auto white balance setting for underwater and I don't have to mess with filters.  Will be perfect for kayaking and snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: Broke right away
Reviews.Author: Alissa
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews that the camera stopped working short after purchase, I hesitated, but bought the camera anyways.  After the recepient recieved this gift, it stopped working in less than 2 weeks and that was ONLY from being used in a pool, no more than 6 feet deep.  I am very dissapointed with this camera and with Kodak.  I would not recommend getting this, it has just turned into a hassle.

Reviews.Title: Took a chance, but it leaks.
Reviews.Author: Tom 3456
Reviews.Content: Was looking for an underwater digital camera that worked in, say, less than 10 feet of water... so didn't want to buy any sort of scuba diving camera.  This camera got good reviews regarding its operation and the pictures, etc....and so given the price, I figured I'd give it a shot. I usually buy items on Amazon using the customer reviews.  Seems to be the best way to REALLY tell how a product is.  This was no different.  After reading the 5 and 4 star reviews, it seemed like a good buy.  EXCEPT, that nearly ALL of the 1-star reviews was because the thing leaked...and leaked in far less water than the advertised depth... and quickly.  Given the total reviews and given the total 1-star reviews, I estimated that I had about a 4 out of 5 chance that I'd get a unit that didn't leak...and if that was the case...it would be a good buy (20% of the total reviews were 1-star, and every one of the many I read of the 1-star reviews, was because it leaked).And so in the end, I wasn't so lucky.  Used it in a 4ft pool (so no way the depth was exceeded).  I'm an Engineer for the Navy (Submarines), and I'm very aware how/why things leak.  I'm a designer of underwater electronics.  I checked this thing out fully prior to immersion in water.  Everything was as it should be (with respect to the seals that the user has access to).  But it leaked in about 15 minutes of use.Looking at its construction, while the battery compartment has a rubber cover, the rubber cover doesn't extend to a seam where the front assembly meets the battery compartment.  This, in my opinion, is the likely water path.  And it looks to be a DESIGN issue.  I'm sure they have something in there as a water-block, but it doesn't look like it to me.In my somewhat expert opinion about an item designed to operate underwater, I believe the design is flawed, and you will have about a 20% or more likelihood that the item will leak if used underwater, and probably a much higher likelihood if used underwater often.My guess is it's probably ok to buy if you want to use it in the rain, etc.  But as an underwater camera, don't bother with this one.

Reviews.Title: Great, versatile, waterproof camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Frederick J. Haab
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it's not a professional quality camera - but it's got good resolution and takes some great pictures.  I got this for my wife for our first cruise; we'd signed up to go snorkeling so I got her this camera for her birthday.  She used it both for land and sea pictures, but handed it off to me when we were in the water.  Some of the pictures did come out a bit blurry, but most of them turned out really well - sharp and accurate colors.  The video worked great, too.  I took it down maybe ten feet, max, and had no leaking problems and, in fact, no issues at all.  It's an amazing price for waterproof camera with these specs, in my opinion, I'm really glad I got it for my wife, and she's quite happy with it.Minus one star only because it's not perfect; some of the pictures were blurry and/or off color, the vast majority came out just fine, though.

Reviews.Title: AN AMAZING CAMERA!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Elly "mother of 2"
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that I'm an extremely picky person when it comes to cameras. I love taking great pictures and over the years I had many cameras. I purchased and returned so many cameras I lost count. I hate when you buy a camera and the reviews are OUTSTANDING and then you take it for a ride in different occasions and environments only to be disappointed by the end results. So with that said I, I was looking for a water camera and after reading many reviews I decided to buy this camera from my nearest Walmart. I thought, here is going to be another camera with great reviews that's going to go back in few weeks. I WAS SO AMAZED OF THE QUALITY OF THE PICTURES, I WENT BACK A WEEK LATER AND PURCHASED ANOTHER ONE JUST IN CASE IF ANYTHING EVER HAPPENED TO THE FIRST,I WANTED TO MAY SURE I WILL HAVE ONE MORE AS A BACK UP:):):) I HAD NEVER DONE THAT BEFORE WITH ANY OTHER CAMERA, EVER! Now,keep in mind that I'm not easily impressed when it comes to cameras, but this one blew my mind. Let's be clear, this is NOT a great camera for all occasions and I didn't intend to use as such from the beginning, but for a water camera THIS CAMERA IS THE BEST, HANDS DOWN! I LOVE IT!!! The colors are vibrant, quality it's outstanding + the price it's awesome. I had it for the past 3 summers and I captured so many great moments of my kids at the pool, recorded many videos,and so far I had not one problem with this camera. Few things I would like to mention:1. when you review your video on the camera the sound DOES NOT WORK, ONLY WHEN YOU VIEW IT ON YOUR COMPUTER OR OTHER DEVICE YOU CAN HEAR THE SOUND.2. the screen it's a bit small but believe me you'll love how the pictures look on a bigger screen.2. I love the idea or rechargeable batteries, I bought few extra batteries and a charger and have them with me at all times.3. make sure you take out the batteries when you don't use the camera for long periods of time.IF YOU'RE HESITANT ABOUT PURCHASING THIS CAMERA, TAKE IT FROM A PICKY PERSON: YOU'LL LOVE IT, AND IF YOU HAVE KIDS YOU'LL LOVE IT EVEN MORE. I WAS STOPPED SO MANY TIMES AND ASKED ABOUT IT. NOT ONLY THAT I WAS IMPRESSED, BUT MY FRIENDS WERE IMPRESSED TOO, THEY ALL THANKED ME FOR CAPTURING SUCH GREAT MOMENTS ON CAMERA... SINCE I WAS THE ONLY ONE WITH THE CAMERA IN THE WATER :) I'LL TRY TO SEE IF I CAN UPLOAD SOME PICTURES.P.S. few month ago my everyday point-and-shoot camera broke and I started searching for another camera to replace my broken one. I purchased two cameras that I'm trying out right now, bought and returned 3 others so far...IF THAT'S NOT A PICKY PERSON, I DON'T KNOW WHAT OTHER WORD WILL DESCRIBE ME BETTER. So far I think I found a winner: PANASONIC DMC-ZS19! (I BOUGHT THE ZS19 AND ZS20 AND SO FAR IT LOOKS LIKE ZS 19 IS BETTER, I MIGHT WRITE A REVIEW ON THAT TOO) I JUST MENTIONED ALL THIS TO SHOW YOU THAT I DON'T JUST BUY ANY CAMERA UNLESS I TEST IT MYSELF. HOPE THIS HELPS :)

Reviews.Title: Broke and was water logged after 1 use!
Reviews.Author: James H Norton III
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera! We took it to a water park and tried to take pictures of my kids swimming underwater.  Water got trapped inside the camera.  You could squish the viewing screen. All compartments were tightly sealed. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: Cheap little camera is a win in the tropics.
Reviews.Author: J. E. Welsh "E."
Reviews.Content: This is a tough little camera with enough features to adequately record your events.  We bought this just for a trip to British Virgin Islands where we knew we would be snorkeling and hiking a lot.  The photo quality is adequate especially considering the price.  We also took along our old Canon elph 6mp which I think creates a better quality photo, even though this one is claiming 12mp.  Any zooming on a good size computer screen will show pixelation.It is rugged.  We had total freedom when hiking around The Baths where it was bumped into rocks and was tossed between group members.  I never worried about it.It never leaked a drop and takes the same good quality pictures today, even after multiple excursions 25ft down to reefs, drops onto rocks, and swinging from a hiking bag.I was surprised to see how the freedom from protecting the camera showed up in our photos and videos.  Waves crashing into The Baths in Virgin Gorda were caught mid flight and up close.  A sting ray spotted from the beach is caught when I run into the surf and dunk the camera down for an underwater shot of him.  I would not even think of carrying my other camera for a wading session in the surf.  We spotted a nurse shark while snorkeling and take a shot.I briefly missed having advanced shutter control when longer exposure was needed once.Keep your expectations relevant to the price and features and you won't be disappointed.It zooms but not very well.  I believe it is an all digital zoom.The H2O functions seemed to add too much yellow for the water colors in BVI.  We used it on Auto most of the time and it always recognized faces when present.  Underwater video was really a treat when we discovered the odd sounds you can pick up on the recordings.We needed a bigger memory card.  Be sure to get a good sized card, because you will take this camera everywhere and therefore take a lot of pictures and videos.We had some trouble seeing the screen in bright situations, again you kinda get what you pay for.Overall we were satisfied that photo quality was adequate for recording our vacation and posting to social sites.  Just being free from worry about carrying a high dollar item allowed us to more completely record our memories when we otherwise would not have.  So even if you decide to go big on the budget and get a high dollar camera, pickup one of these lug everywhere anyway.  I bet it gets more use.

Reviews.Title: died within four month
Reviews.Author: Z. Yang
Reviews.Content: I read quite some reviews before I bought it. The seal is far from perfect so I decided to put on more protection for the batteries and memory card.The camera worked well for almost four month. Until recently, it died after a trip to Virgin Island. Some moisture got into the lens and the camera would not power up.I called Kodak. They give me a reference number for repairment. But as a customer, I have to pay for the one-way shipping to Illinois since this is stated in the warranty.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Berries
Reviews.Content: I bought this item for my soon to be 5 year old because he's become quite the photographer and I didnt want him ruining my good digital camera.  The kids cameras out there are crap and this is absolutely perfect for kids!  It can really take the rough and tumble kids will get it. Plus, it really is waterproof!!! I assumed right away that when I put it under water bubble would appear to show me that water is leaking into the camer and this did not happen!  I am very pleased with this item and my son loves it!  The only thing is that you cant take close ups, but this was expected with the type of limited zoom this camera has, so its perfect for what I expected it to be!

Reviews.Title: Fail with a capital F
Reviews.Author: Sad mommy
Reviews.Content: I have never reviewed an item before, but needed to warn you against this product. I didn't read reviews before I bought two of these bc I have had two Kodak cameras before and loved them! But after 5 minutes in 2 feet of water both cameras leaked. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: Worked great on vacation
Reviews.Author: Emily Fillman
Reviews.Content: This little camera was way cheaper than the alternatives and worked just fine for us! We got underwater shots while snorkeling in the Caribbean and never had a problem. Not amazing, pro quality but def worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Everyone needs one of these!
Reviews.Author: Jean Marion
Reviews.Content: I am amazed with this little camera! It takes awesome pictures and video! Works perfectly underwater or above and the video is so much fun! Half the pictures taken on vacation were of the kids being silly underwater. Super easy to transfer pictures to the computer, and to a digital photo frame. I can't say enough about this camera. Buy one today! It does not come with a rechargable battery, but I bought 4 AA rechargables and never ran low on battery. Uses 2 AA and I kept 2 charged to rotate out.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working the first time we used it
Reviews.Author: Whocares
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our snorkeling trip to Hawaii.  We were able to take about a dozen pictures and a few minutes of video but then it abruptly stopped working.  We followed the usage instructions to a T but it didn't help any.  After it stopped working, we immediately removed the memory card and the images were good and the video quality was pretty good.  We were bummed that we weren't able to use it the rest of our trip and missed out on some awesome photo opportunities. We've sent the camera to Kodak as requested by the company and haven't heard anything, but hopefully we'll be able to get this resolved.One thing that I don't think is mentioned in the description of this camera is that it doesn't include a memory card, so you have to purchase your own.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time or money
Reviews.Author: dhirst
Reviews.Content: I got one of these for my vacation, As a result I have no photographs at all.I followed the instruction on making sure that battery enclosure was closed correctly and off I went into the water.One click later the LCD displayed lines and the trigger would not fire. The lens just fogged up and by the time I got the dry land the batteries were soaked.I recommend getting something that does not take regular batteries (something you have to recharge) All in all this product left me with a bad taste in my mouth.Avoid this one at all cost

Reviews.Title: Do not recommend
Reviews.Author: S. Krummrei
Reviews.Content: We used the camera for snorkeling while in the Caribbean. It's advertised as good to 10 feet; we never went below 5 feet.  The battery compartment filled with water after only 6 photos. The camera now doesn't work at all.  There are better underwater digitals on the market.  We definitely don't recommend this one. Very disappointing to miss so many great photo opportunities.  Buyer beware

Reviews.Title: Took on water!
Reviews.Author: C. Baldwin "almost a senior"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago and used it to snorkel on one trip, 2 times.  It took decent pictures I guess, I have no comparison experience.  This past December I took the camera snorkeling again and within minutes underwater it took on water and is ruined, as was the disc with pictures---I had used the camera for land shots earlier in the day.  This is extrememly disappointing.  I am hoping to get some sort of rebate from Kodak.  It is now a few days later and after many emails to Kodak I was given a phone number to call and told too bad the warranty had expired and I would get nothing.  I said I thought it was awfully sad that what was once a great American company would not stand behind a product used 3 times.  I'll never buy anything kodak!

Reviews.Title: Not good for salt water
Reviews.Author: jokesBYjen "Deal Finder Extraordinaire"
Reviews.Content: Ended up returning this camera.  Be aware that when  using it in salt water, once that water dries up it leaves an awful film all over the lens of the camera, thus making any subsequent photos blurry and grainy.  I don't know how they could remedy this, but I didn't really think about that when I was using it and a lot of photos turned out awful because of this (photos taken on the beach, NOT while underwater where the salt would have been washed off).

Reviews.Title: Broken after my first use
Reviews.Author: walain
Reviews.Content: I used it when I snorkeled, but the water came in the first time I used. I missed a lot of good pics!!!!

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: I bought this in July 2011 for a tubing trip.  We used it one other time at the lake.  The pictures were POOR quality.  We used it this July 4, 2012 and it filled up with water and will no longer work.  I had made sure it was locked and closed properly.  WASTE of MONEY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Worst Buy Ever.
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera July last year to take on my trip to Cancun. First day on the beach we went to take some photos out on the water, the camera was exposed to minimal water and ceased to function after 15 minutes. After we returned from the beach the inner lens began to fog up. Let the camera sit over night with battery door open and it still did not turn on. Had planned to take many pictures during our various water activities but was a total loss. Luckily I had brought my SLR and got some decent pics of scenery. Returned home and called Amazon. They exchanged the product without question and we had a new unit. Used the camera for the first time since last year's incident and SAME STORY. This time we had brought it into a pool with us and within the first 15 minutes it ceased to function at all. Lens had fogged and camera was useless. Of course when we contacted Amazon they could only offer us a partial refund because the one year warranty had expired. They also offered to have the camera repaired by the manufacturer at no cost which was generous of them. However, it does not matter at this point as I am in the process of looking at other underwater cameras to replace this one for another trip coming up. Buyers beware, if you're looking to be active in water do not purchase this product!!!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY this CAMERA
Reviews.Author: gz
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my daughter this past Christmas. The first time she used the product underwater this summer the camera filled with water and stopped working.

Reviews.Title: horrible camera
Reviews.Author: vin
Reviews.Content: First day of our vacation, we got it wet and it hasn't worked since. There water all in the screen. I ended up buying disposable cameras for our vacation.  I don't recemend this camera to anyone. I returned it for money back.

Reviews.Title: Broke on 1st day
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our trip to Aruba.  We took 3 underwater pictures and then the camera broke... it kept scrolling through the pictures and would not take any more.  Wish there was a "0" star rating.  If you're going on vacation and want to take pictures underwater, either go high end or buy the cheap disposables they have at the hotel / convenience store.

Reviews.Title: Crappy product!
Reviews.Author: W. Ragg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for daughter for a trip to the Carribean. The first time it went in the water it was ruined! It is NOT WATERPROOF! Do not buy this camera! I have two other waterproof cameras and they work just fine! And since i bought it for her for Christmas, Amazon wont take it back, i have to deal with the manufacturer, which is a joke because you cant get ahold of them. Do yourself a favor and find a different product. I recomend the olympus waterproof/shockproof camera, its awesome.

Reviews.Title: Water proof - Umm Yeah NO!
Reviews.Author: Molly Schaefer "Mom of 1 Great Son"
Reviews.Content: We got the camera for our 8 yr old.  When I got it at first I liked it.  It was a simple camera for him to use and learn with.  Until yesterday........he took it with him to a swimming party.  First time it had hit the water, it quit working.  We opened it all up to see if was the batteries to find water!  In the area that was supposed to be water proof!!!!  Looking at it again this morning, and there is water under the screen....guess it is going to the trash!  Hate to say it but very upset on this buy....STAY AWAY from this camera - unless you keep it out of the water!

Reviews.Title: Works great, really is waterproof, but no optical zoom
Reviews.Author: Jemmie Wang

} } } Length:: 0:17 MinsI bought this camera for a family vacation to Florida that included snorkeling and other water activities, and the camera did everything it promised. Attached is a video of a jellyfish I took while snorkeling in Key West. The day was overcast so lighting was low - it's not the camera's fault.The only "negative" is the camera does not have optical zoom. It has digital zoom, but digital zoom is, in my opinion, worthless. But if it had optical zoom, is waterproof to 10 feet, and is 12MP, it wouldn't be under $70, would it?

Reviews.Title: Very glad I got this instead of a disposable waterproof camera!
Reviews.Author: bluebug83
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased two disposable waterproof cameras to take along snorkeling on our trip to Hawaii. But I then decided to check and see if there were any digital alternatives for an underwater camera.  An underwater housing for my Canon G11 cost roughly $180 and wasn't guaranteed to not leak, which wasn't worth it to me.  Then I found the Kodak C123 Sport.  After the cost of the two disposable cameras and film development, the Kodak didn't cost a whole lot more, so I decided to buy it and try it out.Before we left on vacation, I played around with the camera, taking pictures and videos (and playing them back) with it submerged in a bowl or sink of water for an hour or two at a time.  It performed great, and I never had any problems with leakage.  So I returned the two disposable cameras I had bought, and packed the Kodak C123 in my suitcase.The camera performed great on our vacation in Hawaii.  Pictures were certainly comparable to, if not better, than anything a disposable would take.  This camera also takes video with sound.  I had a lot of fun with the camera, and took videos of snorkeling around the reef, boogie boarding, wave crashing on to shore over the camera, etc.  As with my home tests, I never had a problem with the camera leaking or shorting out from the water.  While talking to another couple on one of our snorkeling trips, I showed them my camera, and they said they wished they would have known about it and bought something like that instead of a disposable camera.  We never took it any deeper than about 10 feet, its advertised limit.I found battery life to be much better than indicated in other reviews - I didn't have to change the first set of batteries after, by my rough estimate, 5 or so hours of on-and-off use (frequent cycles of turning the camera on to take pictures or a video and play them back, then shutting it off for a few minutes, then turning it back on again when we saw something else interesting, etc).The camera has a few manual settings available - such as manual ISO adjustment (as well as an auto ISO mode), underwater vs. standard mode, and various scenes tailored to shooting above ground.  I found some pictures taken above water in the sunlight to be too bright and washed out, but that may have been due to me not using the correct setting.  I noticed at one of our snorkel locations that I seemed to get better underwater results using "auto" mode instead of "underwater" (and the opposite at a different snorkel location), so I would recommend trying both modes and seeing what works best.Photo quality is certainly not on par with that of my Canon G11 - nor did I expect it to be - but it is a great camera for the price point, especially due to its underwater capability. I think that 12 megapixels is too large an image size for this camera, especially since it only has digital zoom due to the ability to use it underwater.  I wouldn't recommend using the digital zoom too much since the image loses quality very quickly, especially at a 12 megapixel resolution.Overall, this is an excellent camera for its price point if you are looking for a digital alternative to a disposable underwater camera.  If you are a serious photographer or a scuba diver, you might be better suited to buying an underwater housing for a higher quality camera.

Reviews.Title: A very good value...
Reviews.Author: M. A. Cavanah
