} } } Length:: 0:45 MinsThis is the first time I've owned a so-called "underwater" camera. We bought it for a cruise we were going on wherein we knew there would be lots of fun in the water. It performed better than expected. We almost lost about three times; once at the bottom of the Meso-american reef in Costa Maya, MX (salt water). Although I had attached a float to it, it proved to be a little heavier than the float when we dropped it while snorkeling in about 15-20 feet of water. Our guide went back and found it... everything still worked! We also dropped it while cave-tubing in Belize (very cold fresh water)... finally found it again. Everything was fine.I had read of some who had purchased this camera saying it didn't pass the water-proof test.. and all I can figure is they must have done something wrong. With all it went through on our trip, flying colors. I've attached a clip showing some of its work in Costa Maya. Although the video looks a little "green-heavy" we all remember that part of the water had a bit of a greenish cast to it. Later in Cozumel the water was a bit clearer and it reproduced better. I would recommend this camera as an economical alternative to the higher end water cameras.

Reviews.Title: Kodak C123 Sport 12 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Rizor
Reviews.Content: When looking for an underwater camera to take with me to Cancun I had done a lot of pricing. This seemed like one of only a handful that was priced under the $100 mark. The Kodak C123 camera takes great photos underwater, but on land it did not seem to display the same quality. We went to a show down south of Cancun where everyone was dressed in traditional costume, the pictures did not turn out so great. But if you are looking for a camera to take with you skin diving, the picture quality underwater is real good and the colors vibrant and clear. I primarily bought this camera for underwater pictures thus the five star rating since it delivered in full. But I would recommend taking another camera for picture taking on land.

Reviews.Title: Good for whole family.
Reviews.Author: S. Colucci
Reviews.Content: We wanted a camera that took decent pix but was safe for the kids to use at a price point that wouldn't rock our world if it was broken.  So far so good.  Kids love it and it's durable.  The only negative is the lack of optical zoom but that's a you get what you pay for issue.

Reviews.Title: okay for kids, but not so waterproof
Reviews.Author: mintonthepillow
Reviews.Content: Used this on a vacation trip, and my 12 year old son had fun taking pictures and videos (he was working on a "documentary" of our trip) until he took it in the pool.  We had been careful to make sure the battery/card slot was sealed, but about 5 minutes into taking it underwater (nice underwater video, but you can hear water rushing in in the background) both the lens and the battery compartment filled with water.  Not sure if just some of these cameras are defective or it's a design flaw, but we were quite disappointed!  Sending it back as we speak.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations and does exactly what it's supposed to
Reviews.Author: dee_417
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically because I was going to a resort in the Dominican Republic. I planned to go scuba diving and spend my days at the beach and in the pool so I figured I'd get an underwater camera. It worked perfectly fine in the ocean as well as in the pool.I first thought that this camera was going to be huge, but when I received it, it was just slightly thicker than your average point and shoot, but it's not even a problem. It fits right in my hand (I have small hands) and the capture button is large, so don't worry about missing it! It's also heavier than your average camera, so when it's around your wrist, do NOT let go of it because it will sink to the bottom fairly quick.There are settings for underwater and out of water pictures. I don't particularly like to use the flash when it's underwater because there are a bunch of white circles in the photo. The quality of the photos exceeded my expectations. Even though it says 12 megapixels, I still expected it to be crappy because it was so cheap. I was wrong! If you're in shallow pool water (3-4 feet) than there will be a slight blue tint. If you're in deeper water, the tint will be a light green. Again, it definitely wasn't a problem for me. If it is, you can easily change it on Photoshop within 2 minutes. In ocean water, if it isn't crystal clear, it might be a slight green color, but it's still clear. The images aren't blurry unless your drastically moving while taking the photo.The video camera also works great. It includes sound as well, which I wasn't expecting.TIP: Other reviews mention that it was hard to see the display. I had this problem too, but I finally figured it out. Under the settings menu, you can change its brightness. Just put it on automatic (or the highest level, but it wastes batteries) and you're good to go! I haven't had a problem with the display since I've changed the settings.I had so much fun with this camera and when my cousins and other family members asked how much I got it for, they were really surprised. It does its job and I guess the only negative thing I have to say about it is that it takes about half a second to take the picture for some reason. Maybe it's just my camera.If you're looking for an underwater camera, I'd definitely recommend this one! It's cheap and it's a lot safer than buying that plastic bag to stick your camera that's worth a couple hundred dollars (I'm assuming) in. I bought that bag too, and after testing it, I was way too skeptical of using it. Anyways, other cameras are priced so much higher. I don't know why this is so cheap, but definitely take advantage of it! It's perfect for vacations or use in your pool or whatever else. I'd recommend also bringing another camera for out of water use, though.

Reviews.Title: Kid proof and great value for the money
Reviews.Author: J. Carrigan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son who is 8.  He is not very easy on electronics.  This camera has taken alot of abuse but still takes pretty good photos.  He went snorkeling, in the pool, hiking and has dropped it many times.  Although there are lots of scratch marks, this camera still works.  If you are looking for very high quality pictures this is not the camera for you.  If you want a basic camera that can stand up to abuse and takes decent pictures most of the time then this is for you.  This has many modes and even takes black and white photos.  The only complaint is that the screen can't be seen when in the water so you have no idea what you are taking a picture of.  Overall though, it has been a very good investment over other cameras marketed for kids.  Not many cameras can do what this one can, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: Wanted Yellow
Reviews.Author: Nathan Bedford "Thanny"
Reviews.Content: but only could get it in Red. Took video and pictures on the beach. Really good shots. My daughter wants it now. She has not told me but you can just see it in the way she moves.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it
Reviews.Author: ELENA
Reviews.Content: this product is outdated the software is not longer available to download pictures,  I had to returned, fortunately I realize this before my vacation otherwise I will have not memory of them

Reviews.Title: Adequate for a cheaper camera
Reviews.Author: Tabbi
Reviews.Content: This camera took decent pictures.  Not great, not bad.  The LCD is hard to see while underwater and not sure what pictures are being taken while using the camera.  My camera kept saying the memory card wasn't in the camera when it was actually installed correctly.  I had this happen on about 1/4 of my snorkel trips.  Frustrating to get in the water and then find out your camera doesn't work.  I also had a problem with the latch and the camera flooded after about the 10th time to use it.  I ended up throwing it away already and only ordered it in May.

Reviews.Title: Stops working quickly
Reviews.Author: Brooke K.
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to be able to take it in the water to get some shots that I might not get otherwise. I never used it underwater or intended to take pictures underwater. I've used it for taking pictures while kayaking and on a vacation to the Bahamas. It was never submerged under water but did float along beside me while I was snorkeling. The first few times I used it I had trouble knowing if it was on in the bright sunlight. After a few uses it would often not turn on the first time I pushed the button but a few tries and it would turn on. Just last weekend my husband and I took a trip to Miami. I took well over two hundred pictures with this camera. Everything seemed normal and it worked fine, allowing me to snap the photos. It wasn't used in the water during this trip. When I got home I went to upload them to find that there were no pictures on the memory card. My husband took a look and he sees some rust in the memory card slot. We think that water must have seeped in at some point and shorted out the memory card reader. Whatever happened it gave no indication that it wasn't recording the photos to the memory card and I lost all of my pictures from Miami, which makes me sad and angry. This camera is a complete waste of money. I wish I could return it but too much time has passed. I've only had it for a about four months. This camera was never fully submerged, so I highly doubt that it's waterproof at all, it doesn't even seem to be very water resistant. Save your money and save yourself some heartache, this camera is going into the garbage where it belongs.

Reviews.Title: Works well, just might wipe all your photos accidently.
Reviews.Author: Abe The Babe
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take with me on my honeymoon in Cancun. I took it everywhere for 10 nights. I took it snorkeling, I took it to the beach, I took it to the Grand cenote, I even took it zip lining into the water at XPLOR. Pictures are not amazing quality but they are more than enough for memories and it was great knowing I didn't have to worry about it getting wet and being underwater.Even though the processor is slow and it take a couple of seconds to start the camera, load pictures, etc. I would have given it 5 stars because it's such a great value for the price. However, we're sitting at the swim up bar on the last day of our honeymoon looking at the pictures and my wife asks me to delete one of them. So I press delete, it asks me if I want to delete just this picture or all of them. Obviously, I select the option that deletes this picture only and press enter. Then it says, are you sure you want to delete all your pictures? Now at this point I'm having a mild heart attack and I make sure to select NO and I hit enter. AND IT STARTS DELETING ALL THE PICTURES. I felt incredibly bad for about 2 hours because I thought I had lost over 300 pictures of my honeymoon. Now I'm tech savvy enough to know not to take any more pictures or all hope will be lost. I cross the street to radio shack and buy a card reader and download file recovery software and I was able to get 99% of my pictures back. Disaster averted, but an unnecessary experience.In conclusion, buy the camera, it works. Just DON'T try to do anything on the actual camera except take pictures and change settings. When you transfer all the images to your computer, then you can decide which ones to keep.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Charles L Page
Reviews.Content: Snorkeled for 4 days straight and this camera did a good job. Screen could be brighter.  2 AA Batteries lasted all 4 days and over 150 pictures.

Reviews.Title: camera  review
Reviews.Author: R. A. ELDER "biker"
Reviews.Content: These are great little ,very waterproof cameras  that take high quality pictures.I bought several of these cameras and give them to family and friends

Reviews.Title: Received this camera a week before our dream vacation to Hawaii...it did a great job!!!
Reviews.Author: Pollyanna Neumann
Reviews.Content: I took it snorkeling and it made amazing videos and pictures. So clear. Very easy to handle. I just pointed and shot amazing video as I swam in the pacific ocean with beautiful fish everywhere.  Now when watching video back on the camera you can't hear the video but once you put it on a computer or whatever, the sound is great. Very happy with this product. Had it in sand, water, and it worked amazing everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Best Waterproof Camera for the Price!!!
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: This camera is absolutely amazing. I was a little skeptical at first when I saw this but we purchased it for our honeymoon in St. Lucia and it worked perfectly. It is so portable and easy to keep up with. I actually ended up taking most of my pictures with this camera and left my nice large camera in the room.  Great underwater pictures while snorkeling. You cannot go wrong with this camera. I highly reccomend it. Make sure you purchase the Chums Waterproof Camera Float Strap to go along with it because this camera does not float and with the strap you can throw it in the water and it floats.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: Janet Taylor
Reviews.Content: love the color, took it on a snorkeling trip in the Carribean and worked great. nice comfortable size, stayed dry on 3 snorkeling excursions, great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Alison Chadwell
Reviews.Content: I looked at reviews of the $200 range camera and got about the same feedback on them as on this one; about a 50/50 chance that it holds up.  We took this camera on vacation to Aruba snorking 3 times and it worked perfectly.  Every once in a while it got a little foggy but cleared up within seconds.  I would recommend leaving it on auto mode instead of switching to underwater.  The flash doesn't work if it's in underwater mode and the pictures came out much crisper with the flash on.  I'd rate the video on it at about 75-80%.  Considering I was floating in the ocean, it was fantastic!  Absolutely would recommend buying this product!

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: lortz
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moGVMMQBGBADJA', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moGVMMQBGBADJAloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } } } Length:: 0:18 MinsI bought this camera because the cost of buying a waterproof case for my nice camera was similar, plus the risk of losing my good camera wasn't worth it to me. The navigation is a little clunky, but overall, it takes pretty darn good photos, wet and dry. Also, it transitions between water and air very well (which you can see in the video).I've used this camera at the beach, in the water, snorkeling, swimming in cenotes, and generally wet/sandy situations. I've used it submerged about 10 times within the last month and so far it's as good as new.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a great price!!!!
Reviews.Author: MARIA FERNANDA BREDICE
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last minute for my Disney Cruise trip since we were going to swim with stingrays. I was a little concerned by some reviews but overall most reviews were good.  I can assure you that this is an excellent camera for underwater. Specially snorkel. I took some awesome pictures and the best videos ever!!!  I will highly recommend this camera to any of my friends.  Don't hesitate, go for it!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kiwi afloat
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera a week before a family trip to the Great Barrier Reef in Australia in February.  We must have researched dozens of 'warerproof' compact cameras and none stood out, at least in the <$150 field. Many reviews barely advised using some cameras even in the rain ! This camera received mixed reviews but we took a chance. We have to say this camera worked really well. It produced excellent still 'dry' shots and videos. Tor underwater shots it didcreally well also. The one trick learnedcwas that the default setting is for 'out of the water' photos, so our first 'beneath the waves' shots were a little grainy. After figuring this out we were off and diving, admittedly no greater depths than 3 - 5 metres. One other pointer (not White !!) is to watch the backlight, especially just below the surface. Only other slight annoyance was the sound of the zoom being quite pronounced on the underwater videos. Wished it was a little quieter but the video quality was excellent andcwe took more than 10 mins at a time. Battery life is reasonable. Overall a nice multi-use camera to complement our main vacation camera. Just used it in Sth Africa and excellent photos of scenery and wildlife.

Reviews.Title: Great Carmera
Reviews.Author: Bay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this camera for our trip to Turks and Caicos; it took amazing pictures in and out of water. The images were sharp and extreme clear; even in motion the photos turned out beautiful. The only advice I would suggest is once you take the camera out of the water check the lens to make sure there is not moisture on it. A few photos had a burly image from a water drop on the lens.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera, but can't dowload pics.
Reviews.Author: mybaredog
Reviews.Content: Bought this just before our trip to the Caribbean.  Worked great above and below the water.  I saw many other people had them.  But when I got home the horror began.  It would not connect via the USB to download the software.  Kodak says it is no longer available as a download. I tried to download the Share Button App.  This does download but the App does not start when you connect the camera as it says it should.  With a call to Kodak support, they told me the ONLY thing left was I had to buy a card reader.

Reviews.Title: Good with limitations
Reviews.Author: John Russell
Reviews.Content: For the price this camera works quite well but can also work very poorly if not used correctly.My wife used this camera on 2 snorkeling outings in Belize. I didn't look at the camera or read the manual before the trip because I didn't think it would be worth the trouble. After seeing the pictures from our first day I was impressed. Decided that I could improve on the pics. Found that the mode she used was auto and not H2O and showed her how to use the zoom.The second outing produce awful pictures. They were green. So very green. Many pictures were not clear anymore now either.Back home now and looked at camera specs. No optical zoom. All zoom is digital. So don't use zoom. If you want to zoom do so on your computer using crop and leave camera unzoomed.So if you,1)use auto2)don't zoomIf you do this you will get some very nice underwater pictures.Camera did not leak.Set of batteries lasted each day out.

Reviews.Title: Quit working
Reviews.Author: Tasha
Reviews.Content: We gave this camera to our 16 year old dd for christmas. Nine months later she has used it between 10-15 times and only 5 times in water.  It quit working after the last time she took it to the pool.  We've tried brand new batteries and it won't even turn on.  :(

Reviews.Title: Full Year of Use - Absolutely Love It
Reviews.Author: Lisa Shea "be the change you wish to see in t...
Reviews.Content: I've used my Kodak EasyShare Sport Camera Review for a full year now. So my review isn't a "first time user" review with first impressions. I have been using this camera solidly for a year. I have seen it in a variety of conditions. Here is my review of it.First, the basics. The camera is about the size of an average digital camera / smart phone, about the size of a pack of cigarettes. It is reasonably light, and has a rubber bumper on its front to keep the lens from getting too damaged by putting it down face-down accidentally. It is a 12mp camera and takes a standard SD memory card. It has a video mode and zoom.I love to kayak, so I am constantly taking this camera out with me in the water. I actively take photos underwater, to get shots of interesting seaweed and fish. It has NEVER had any problem, in all these months, with being underwater. There is a two-layer system of protection for the two AA batteries and memory card. So you close up one plastic flap, and once that is closed you seal the outer plastic flap. Once both are sealed, you're set. Yes, it can be a bit tricky to get the inner orange flap to seal, but of course it's worth it to pay attention to doing that properly. If you let water into the insides of the camera, it undoubtedly stops working.The camera does NOT FLOAT. I purchased a third party float for the camera since, being in a kayak, it's a reasonable assumption that things in the kayak might end up in the water. So if you're looking to use this camera in active water situations, I highly recommend getting a float for it.The camera is a bit slow in taking photos. I get spoiled with my many other digital cameras, that I can point, shoot, and go right on to the next picture. Here there's a good 2 second delay before it gets the picture into memory. I don't mind, the camera is fairly inexpensive for being an underwater camera. If I have to be patient, that is fine.Sometimes in a bright sun-on-lake situation, or in a dark underwater situation, the screen display doesn't give you a clear view of what you're trying to take a photo of. I guess the display isn't bright enough, or not anti-glare enough, or something. So in certain circumstances I have to point and guess.There is screwhole at the base for mounting this onto a tripod. I suppose you might need one if you were shooting Niagara Falls photos and didn't want to worry about the camera being destroyed by the spray.The camera comes with software, but while I tried it out a few times, I find it much easier just to dump the memory card contents onto my hard drive and work with them in PhotoShop.I have taken this camera all over the place and it's been a trooper. I don't tend to handle my equipment gently. The camera has held up to the abuse.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Janice P. Stevenson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a cruise. Once on the ship, I realized I had forgot my "good" Canon camera, so this one was all I had with me to use all the time.  To my amazement, it worked pretty darn good on all the pictures that I took.  I opted to use lithium batteries so that I would not have to open the camera up in case I was near water at the time and I never had to change the batteries and I took over 271 pics, many with flash.  Just make sure you close the battery door properly.  Glad I own it!

Reviews.Title: Not exactly waterproof
Reviews.Author: PoolGirl "PoolGirl"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for me and my husbands frist trip to the Caribbean.  I bought it about 3 months before. Reading the other reviews I wanted to test if it was truly waterproof so I left it in a bucket of water for about 5 hours and everything was fine.  Picture quality is what I expected and I was pleased with the test pictures I had taken.  Go on the trip and first time we used it was snorkeling, so it was in maybe 12 inches of water.  We get back on the boat and the camera is as dead as can be, it had leaked.  All the pictures we had taken thus far on our trip were gone, the memory card got salt water on it and is useless.  I don't know if maybe it is not supposed to be used in salt water or what happened since it seemed to be waterproof when I tested it.  Wouldn't trust it again, if I had to do it over I would have bought an expensive waterproof case for my regular camera or gone with the old school waterproof disposables.  Of course this all happens more than 30 days after I purchased it and dont know if its worth it to try to deal with Kodak directly, since I don't even want the same camera.  One huge tip - when you close the battery and memorary card slot there are two "doors" to close, I figured this out before hand so I know it wasn't because we didnt fully close it.

Reviews.Title: Problem underwater
Reviews.Author: Vítor Seibert
Reviews.Content: For the first time that I use this camera underwater, the camera stopped working and was filled with water. I'm very disappointed with this product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome quality to price ratio
Reviews.Author: Mad Tinker
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a wet, wild, and windy fishing trip to Wyoming and it worked great. I wasn't afraid to lay the camera down in the shallow water while I struggled to get a fish in position for a quick picture. The camera took a real beating in my chest pack and jacket with only some minor scratches on the rear screen. The pictures all came out great; I used a variety of AUTO/SCENE configurations. FWIW, the temperature varied from 20F to 50F with no impact on mechanical performance. The only reason it's not a 5 star review is that the videos came out a bit 'rosy'.  The river pictures of a spey rod casting 'clinic' came out barely okay, but my videos of the recent Mars Science Lab launch were very color skewed.  The vids were beyond simple correction with available tools and I'm still stinging from that.

Reviews.Title: Horrible item; broke after 5 minutes, water leaking.
Reviews.Author: James Dylan "Classic Punk"
Reviews.Content: I bought this several months ago in preparation for my vacation to the Philippines, and due to the time that passed, I am unable to return it for a refund, so I'm out $100. Anyway, I took it to the lake we visited, and within 5 minutes the pictures were foggy and unviewable, and I noticed condensation in the lens. It looked like it had a cataract; the entire lens was white. That evening, I opened up the battery case and water had gotten inside. Now, 3 weeks later, I'm back home and looking at the camera, the entire display screen on the back is peeling and brown under the film. Sure, maybe I got a lemon camera, but maybe not. All I know is it's a total piece of crap, useless after 5 minutes, and although it didn't "ruin" my vacaiton, I bought it and brought it to that specific lake because of certain underwater formations that were there, and I wanted to document them. I didn't get one decent picture with this stupid Kodak camera, and it's no surprise that they're going out of business.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: Dollar Bank "Keith Adkins"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes poor quality pictures. The lighting is terrible and the battery life is poor.Would not recommend this product to my enemy.

Reviews.Title: The camera is not for water
Reviews.Author: Federico Morales Serrano "FMS"
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in poor condition, it worked the first time in dry, but when water entering the water comes to the lens, screen and back off and not turned over, I think it's only for a small splash, nothing to recommend.Federico M.S.Kodak EasyShare Sport C123 (Gray  New Model)

Reviews.Title: Oh my goodness- it's awesome!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: So, I admit I bought the camera with limited expectations, but wanted something for my 8 year old as a starting camera that if it broke, wouldn't be the end of the world. The fact that it was waterproof was also a big selling point since we do a lot of trips to the tide pools on the pacific coast.So far, way too much fun with a camera. It has taken the beatings of a 5 year old and 8 year old. It has been in the sand, waves, pool, and around town. We are being careful to not break it - but seriously, again - as careful as two kids can be. I was thinking the picture quality would be so-so - and so far, really pleased with the quality. The video we have only used underwater to catch fish and crabs scooting around, but are amazed at how clear it came out. Just really happy with this little thing - and so is my son - who is documenting every minute of his life on film. It is very small and compact - good for my pockets or my sons little hands.Pros:durablenice quality photos, even with a cheap little camerawaterproofincredibly easy to use - the fact there are limited options is a good thingeasy to interface and upload on the computerCons:man, it eats batteries!there is no real zoom on this camera, just pretend it doesn't exist, and take the picture the way you see thembe sure you buy some memory card for this, as it does not come with a chip and can only take about 5 pictures on internal storage. the 4 mb we bought can store around 1700 pictures.Happy camera hunting!

Reviews.Title: waste of money
Reviews.Author: Persephone
Reviews.Content: This camera is very difficult to operate. You have to insert your email address on it, and the keyboard is so tiny that its impossible. I did not receive a user guide, so I am returning this. You do get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: Its ok for the price
Reviews.Author: Lisa Fernander
Reviews.Content: This camera is ok for the price. The quality is just well for everyday pool pictures or even at the beach. I do have one thing to tell you about this camera. I took it to Typhoon Lagoon and was so ready to take lots of pics. I was upset because the camera does not have a nice amount of internal space. I was able to take about 5 or 6 pics with the internal space and had forgotten to bring my memory card which really sucked because I missed out on great moments. So don't forget your memory card. Otherwise its a pretty descent camera.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed at the price I wanted!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jena
Reviews.Content: I went ahead and bought this camera because of the LOW price compared to other waterproof cameras and GOOD reviews. I am totally satisfied with the purchase. I tested the camera out in the kids bath tub water at first and all worked well. Pix came out great. A couple of weeks later we took it to the Caribbean and used it as our main point and shoot camera and waterproof camera while snorkeling.Some pictures came out better than others, I don't know what caused the difference, possibly movement? None of the pictures were ever horrible, like I had experienced with the throw away type of waterproof cameras. And I must add that some of the pictures were simply amazing!The only negative thing I would note, is that it does not have a viewfinder (but I don't think any/many waterproof cameras have this). So it was difficult to see what you were taking a picture of in the bright sun, BUT at this price and with such an overall Great camera, I would overlook that any day!If you want to save money, but what a good reliable, compact, user friendly, cute, convenient camera ~ Buy This One!

Reviews.Title: High quality, easy to use, and worth buying
Reviews.Author: etrinity
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo3MSQEQDEOGCNM', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo3MSQEQDEOGCNMloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo3MSQEQDEOGCNMpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo3MSQEQDEOGCNMpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81bxK4%2B43HS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3MSQEQDEOGCNMcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3MSQEQDEOGCNMcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:22 MinsI purchased this camera in order to take video and pictures of fish at our local swimming hole. I took it to a depth of roughly 7 feet and it held up fine. It is easy to use, choosing what video or picture quality is as simple as hitting a button to the selection you want and touching the OK button. What I was amazed with is the sounds it picks up under the water, the quality is impressive. I will recommend this camera to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Good cam for price.
Reviews.Author: ronstarr64
Reviews.Content: I normally use a DSLR for most of my pictures. Was looking for a waterproof secondary camera that wasn't expensive. This camera takes very good pictures from wide angle to the halfway point of zoom. Any further & it starts to pixilate. Video is only good at wide angle. Starts to blur if you zoom in.  While the camera records sound with the video, there is no sound when playing back in the camera. Plays & sounds fine when loaded on computer.There is no halfway push on the shutter button. Press the button, & it takes pic. There is a 2 second delay while showing picture before being ready for next shot. If you press shutter again while looking at current pic, it resets faster for next shot.  Burst mode is ok for this price camera, however, you can't see the pics when you press the shutter button. Must go to playback mode to see.Underwater mode works well in pools & clear ocean water, but not in my green water lake. Water clears quickly from lens when you bring it above water, allowing you to continue with video, or pics.Overall, this is a fun camera that does what it claims for a low price, & I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof camera much more than expected
Reviews.Author: CWorm
Reviews.Content: I bought this right before a family reunion in (with one day of the reunion being in an indoor water part).  I bought the disposable cameras for the rest of the family. I purchased this camera for a super low price, expecting a low quality camera...boy was I in for a shock!  I have used this camera now for about 5 months and still love it!  I was really put off by the fact that it takes batteries, but it really is not too bad when it comes to the batteries.I have 3 children and I love taking pics of them.  I have the soccer mom Cannon special that I use to take most of my pics.  I wanted a decent pocket camera to take to places like the amusement park and the pool with the family.  This camera takes great pics for the price.  The biggest seller to me was that it has a flash (which the disposable water cameras do not).  There were maybe 2 pics per disposable water camera that were developed...all of my pics were awesome.The video feature is great.  I have even submitted two of the videos to America's funniest home videos, because they were in good enough quality and in places I wouldnt dream of bringing my video camers (like going down a waterslide).  I have sold people on this camera, just by showing the pics and video where ever I go. - One side note...get the additional floatation device.  It is big and clunky, but when you have your camera slip off of your wrist, it floats and is bright orange and easy to find!

Reviews.Title: fun waterproof camera from Kodak
Reviews.Author: Lillian Brown
Reviews.Content: I wanted a waterproof camera just to play around with in the pool with my grandchildren, but did not want to spend a fortune on what was to be a 'toy' for me.  I wasn't expecting too much from a relatively inexpensive camera such as this, just fun photos.  I was very surprised by what I got!  The picture quality is great and the video is awesome, both above and below the water.  Now bear in mind it will not replace my regular camera for special photos or special occasions, but we have already had a lot of laughs with this camera and the fun things the kids do underwater.  I don't even use the underwater setting (I tried it, and it gave the pictures a yellow-green tint).  The regular setting works fine underwater, and allows you to transition from the surface to underwater with no change.  For a fun camera you can use in and around the water without worry, I would (and already have) recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Water Proof & kid Proof
Reviews.Author: Kilmarlic
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend loves to sail. I thought the perfect Father's Day Gift would be a waterproof camera he could take on the boat with him. He's had the camera for nearly a month now and honestly he never goes anywhere without it. He's taken pictures while sailing. He's taken pictures while riding the waverunner. He's used it deep sea fishing. This weekend he got to use it underwater in the pool. Great quality pictures. Simple to use. Can I mention that the price was unbelievable????? I also bought him a floating strap and a hard sided case to use with it. Until this past weekend, I had no idea that it also had video capability - leave that to the 11 year old to show us how to use that handy function.Being able to read other reviews was helpful in choosing this particular camera but I really wasn't prepared for this little gizmo to be the "Best Present Ever". Knowing I can log in and shop Amazon 24 hours a day and trust the results is quickly becoming my favorite way to shop.

Reviews.Title: Best vacation camera, ever!
Reviews.Author: Dan S. Druge
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. I bout this for a trip to Kauai with my wife. It worked great in every activity we did. We took it snorkeling, in the rain, on a inner tube tour. It didn't matter where went, or what we did, this camera performed. Capturing every moment wonderfully. I added a large capacity SD card and had to download pictures on our last full day (400 pictures and about 20 minutes of video).I had one problem that was operator error. I failed to ensure the battery door was fully closed after downloading pictures. The camera failed during a morning snorkel. I simply dried it out in the room over breakfast and restarted it. Still working great.This camera is small enough to put in your pocket and goes great all day. Snorkeling at Poipu to the rim of Waimea Canyon and everything in between, this camera is ready for it.

Reviews.Title: Good fun at a good price
Reviews.Author: Judith
Reviews.Content: Kodak came up with an inexpensive waterproof camera that takes a pretty good quality picture.  I had wanted a waterproof camera but wasn't sure how much I would actually use it, so I didn't want to pay a fortune for one.  Kodak solved that problem for me.  I've used it a lot in the pool with some fun and interesting results.  My only con is the body of the camera has already started to lose some of its paint, so what started off as a very pretty camera now looks like a pretty beaten up camera.  This occurred in the first 24 hours of owning it and I'm not rough with my cameras at all.  Other than that, I'm happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Outdoor Camera
Reviews.Author: Dawna ONeal "TTownGal"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera specifically for a trip to the Bahamas knowing we would be in the water a good part of the time.  The camera is great for outdoor activity.  It operated well in and out of the water and the in-water pictures were much better than I expected them to be.  The pictures taken out of the water were as good a quality as my regular super shot camera.  No problem with the camera being water tight.  It can be difficult to see the viewer underwater.  I never figured out if it was lack of lighting or what, but like most camera viewers when outside, you just can't see the view.  The camera did pick up the color of the beautiful Bahama water.....the color quality of the pictures is great.  The lens fogged up one day.....never could figure out why or what the problem was.  I did have trouble converting the video extension to a readable format and had to search google to find the right extension conversion.  I didn't see anything in the directions that came with the camera.  Love the red color.  Camera is the perfect size for a beach bag or purse.  Glad I purchased the camera.  Good quality for a small price.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Bugsy
Reviews.Content: For the money this is a really neat little camera.  I honestly was not expecting much, but I've used it everyday for a week and I'm loving it.  I bought this camera for my FL vacation.  I took it on a float trip down the river, and have used it in the pool.  It is pretty fast for a point and shoot. Real simple buttons and functions.  The screen is hard to see in bright sunlight, but most all LCD screens are. It does have a lillte zoom power, gets blurry if you go too far. I'm really impressed with the picture color and quality.  The video is neat, clear and has sound! We are going to the ocean in a couple days. Will see how it does there.  I have not taken it very deep in the water yet, only about 2-3 ft so far. I have had no problems.  If you do a lot of video it will eat up batteries.  It runs off two AA's.  But over all I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, for the price
Reviews.Author: TruWinna88
