logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2TNX6X24EA8OcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2TNX6X24EA8OcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:06 MinsConsidering the other options, if you are not able to pay $300 for a waterproof camera, this is the next best thing. I didn't use the "share" function (I don't really see the necessity) but here's my impression of what I did use:Pros:The picture quality is fairly good, unzoomed video quality is good, and it does take pictures underwater without self-destructing. The scene lighting options are versatile and effective, and it is easy to figure out how to use.Cons:The camera is only waterproof up to about 10 feet, so it is best used as more of a water-resistant camera than a full on ocean recording device. It also sinks, so make sure you don't drop it in too deep of water. Battery life is fairly short, make sure you have backup batteries with you. Video sound quality is terrible, and you can hear the buttons on the camera click if you use the zoom in a video. Zoom greatly reduces the video quality as well. The auto picture mode, the default settings as the camera is turned on, make the image much too bright, so you have to adjust it every time the camera is turned on. Also, the lens fogged as I was using it kayaking, and I wasn't able to clean it in time to get good pictures. It cleared up eventually, but I would recommend keeping a cloth or something on hand in case this happens.Conclusion:I felt confident enough to take this camera boating, snorkeling, kayaking and a host of other places I wouldn't dare take a normal digital camera. As a result, I got pretty good pictures just by circumstance, and the quality is really not bad. It's a durable camera that does the job for not a lot of money, so all in all I would recommend it to a person using it for camping or other outdoor activities, snorkeling (but not diving), boating (canoeing, kayaking, etc). As far as surfing or similar activities go, it would probably get good pictures and good soundless video, just make sure you have a secure strap and some extra batteries.

Reviews.Title: Cheaply built, mediocre photos
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a rafting trip down the Grand Canyon.  On the trip, there were most of the available waterproof digital cameras represented by the participants.  I chose to buy this one, the Kodak C123, mainly due to the price and the fact that it takes AA batteries.Of the 4 cameras I've seen the photos from, the C123 produced the worst quality images.  They aren't bad, but they aren't great by any stretch.  When the zoom is used, the quality distorts greatly, but even without the zoom, the quality just didn't stand up to the competing cameras.When I first took this camera out of the box, you can immediately tell that it is poorly built.  The battery door (the most important part to keep it waterproof!!) felt like it was going to snap off.  And true to my expectations, on the last day of the trip, this camera died.  Not sure why.  I went to sleep with it working, and awoke the next morning to it not turning on.Now to try to see if Kodak will honor the warranty and replace the camera (I'd really just like my money back, as the photos were not worth keeping the camera for!)...

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, even out of the water
Reviews.Author: Boldwin "Chris"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a blind but on our trip to Aruba. We wanted to try out taking underwater pictures and were looking for something better than a disposable. We got the camera bundle for ~$60 and it was a very good value.Pros:+Great picture quality and not just for underwater, regular pictures turned out great too+Durable-Had no leaks and the camera fell of a boulder during a timed picture and was fine+Decent features for the price+Price: $60 bucks!!!+Good battery lifeCons:-Low zoom but that was expected-Low screen visibility underwater, also expectedCaveats on Use:+Wipe off the lens when transitioning environments because it will fog and ruin your pictures.+The camera will stay on for long periods of time without auto-shutting off, which is to your advantage underwater but will eat through your battery everywhere else+Listen for the beep underwater so you know that your picture was taken, its very easy to hear

Reviews.Title: not so waterproof
Reviews.Author: Thomas Chmielarski "Tommy"
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes after getting in to the pool (max depth 5 foot 6 inches, and it never went deeper than two feet) the camera shut off and had water internally. I had triple-checked that the single opening - the battery compartment - had been securely shut. bah. don't buy

Reviews.Title: Fantastic idea but...
Reviews.Author: Kevin Baldwin
Reviews.Content: For the first 3 days, the camera was fantastic! It took great pictures at the beach and at the pool. Yes, it has no optical zoom capabilities, but for the price, it was screaming 'must have' for any beach trip. After the third day, and one battery change (in an air conditioned room, so the air should have been dry,) we noticed condensation formed on the lens cover and over the LCD when cold water was splashed on the camera. Took the camera home, let it dry out, closed it back up and found that the timing was now between the flash and the picture snap (about 1 in 5 pictures had the flash.) It is a brilliant concept and, if there was a design revision to seperate the battery\SD area from the rest of the camera body, I'd jump at the chance to buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Great kid's camera!
Reviews.Author: Brian Wylie
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras -- one for each of my sons. If you are looking for an inexpensive, simple, rugged camera for kids, this is a great choice. For way less than $100 each, they have a camera that they can take on our trips, on campouts, and around the house, with little worry about breaking the camera.One of the nice things from the standpoint of making the camera simple is that the lens does not project from the camera body when you turn it on. All the zoom is done digitally. Great for making the camera more durable with what kids tend to do to electronics. Also, if they leave it out in the rain I don't have to go buy a new camera! My kids figured out the simple menu system quickly. Photo quality is very good, especially considering the price.Now, just to be clear, this is not a camera I would buy for myself. With only 3x zoom and a somewhat limited feature set, it is not meant for a serious (or even an intermediate) photographer. But what do you expect for $70? For what it is meant for, this is a pretty neat little camera.

Reviews.Title: Unimpressed
Reviews.Author: asdfjkl;
Reviews.Content: After two uses in my pool, the screen got water in it and now the camera refuses to function. It was a waste of money and it was NOT waterproof

Reviews.Title: It's a portable webcam
Reviews.Author: 3rd Reviewer
Reviews.Content: Wanted a cheap waterproof camera for taking pictures of family at the beach & swimming pools.Purchased this one for $69(pre-order) but after taking few shots I decided return it.Reasons:1. Lens gets foggy underwater - (May be mine's faulty).2. Picture quality is very poor - does not look like typical 12 mp photos.Overall,camera feels like a webcam on batteries and with small LCD screen.Waterproof works.This camera would be a good toy for young kids who never owned a digital camera before.

Reviews.Title: Leaked and died after less than 10 hours in the water-- Kodak DOES NOT honor warranty
Reviews.Author: Californica
Reviews.Content: I wish I could post a photo of what this camera looks like after 1 vacation trip. It has gruesome rust like marks inside the viewfinder and looks like it's been at the bottom of the ocean for far longer than the 6 months I have owned it.PLEASE EXERCISE CAUTION when purchasing from third party sellers. They of course don't want you to know this, but Kodak does not honor warranties on purchases from third party sellers. Therefore, if you take the chance and buy from Amazon and it leaks (like many many reviewers here have stated) you will be out the money with no warranty and no one to take your complaint to. I purchased mine from something called Electronics Club. They sure will not be getting any more of my money, and they don't deserve yours, either.

Reviews.Title: great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Ralph Jackson
Reviews.Content: I would watch how far you go down in the water while using this, I am afraid I tested the limits and the camera stopped working till the pressure was less.  I was diving in Jamaica and was around 30 ft.  This was great in the pool and snorkeling.  The only downsize is that you are unable to use rechargeable batteries.  They don't seem to have enough juice to run the camera for long.  You gotta buy the Ultra types.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: BOOKGUY "bookguy"
Reviews.Content: I'm not gonna sit here and paint you a picture of unicorns and rainbows, this is an okay little camera. Having said that, I will tell you that for the price you pay you're getting a good camera. It's waterproof, durable, compact and takes decent pictures. If you're looking for DSR quality from this camera then you're looking in the wrong place. If you're looking for top of the line underwater photography then you should also be looking elsewhere. However, if you are looking for a durable little camera that takes decent pics and that you can pretty much take anywhere with no worries ... this is your guy right here.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Sport C123
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: I needed a waterproof camera for my cruise to the Caribbean.  I wanted something that would take video, be light enough to carry easily, and not cost too much.  After a lot of deliberation, I decided on this little camera.  I tested it out in a lake before taking it on the cruise.  I did have some trouble seeing the screen underwater, but that could also be related to not wearing my glasses in the water.  However, since I'm so used to using a viewfinder anyway, I didn't have much trouble taking pictures of what I wanted.  It worked great shooting in the lake (though there wasn't much to see there), and it worked just as well in the ocean and climbing a waterfall.  There was no leakage (thanks to the double door for the battery), and I didn't have any problems with the lens fogging up despite the humidity.  I made sure to rinse my camera in the sink when I got back to the cruise ship-just to be safe.I've had no problems with the camera, and the images are good quality.  The images aren't as high quality as my Canon Rebel XTi, but I was able to use it in place of my Canon while on excursions off the cruise ship and still obtain good pictures.  I'm happy with my purchase and would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good basic beat around camera
Reviews.Author: Jay Ho "Jay Ho"
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures if you take the time to learn the settings.  And to understand its limitations.  For the price, really cant complain.  I have a DSLR and a pricier point and shoot.  But in a nasty environment, this little guy has held its own.  Nice not to have to worry about knocking this around.  In an age where the cellphone camera has replaced most cameras, this is a nice option to keep on hand for those times you're getting wet.Biggest con...LCD screen impossible to see in bright sunlit days.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Fowler Lawson
Reviews.Content: I ordered this to have for my three week trip to the Hawaiian Island. It took better pictures than my "better" digital camera out of the water! Also, I've had no leaking issues and packed extra batteries based on other reviews.  It did take a few tries to figure out how to get a better picture underwater but once I got the hang of it - awesome pics!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: BoaterB
Reviews.Content: I love this underwater camera! For the price, it can't be beat. I have had it in the water multiple times. My niece and nephew used it non-stop in the pool on a recent vacation. Despite being beaten up, this little camera has continued to work great. I even bought one for my niece because she had so much fun taking underwater selfies. I find it even takes better out of the water, daytime photos than my trusty point and shoot. Overall, for the price you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Grisso "Amazon Expeditioner"
Reviews.Content: This camera is nice. took it out of the package, put batteries in it and submerged in the sink for 2 hours before playing with it at all - not a single drop of water inside the camera. took it to the beach for a family trip and did just fine with sand and saltwater. just have to wipe the evaporated salt water off of the glass. I bought a Canon PowerShot A4000IS about a year ago and I like this waterproof Kodak much better. what I like most is it is waterproof and the faster speed to take multiple pictures right after another. not sure what that's called "shutter speed maybe". it will take picture after picture after picture very fast. and no delay between pressing the button and the picture is taken. that is the problems I have with the Canon - it is very slow. our old camera 2 years ago - took it to a yearly salmon fishing trip, took 3 pics and it got wet and died. didn't want to take the chance of the same thing happening last year so we didn't get any good pics. can't wait to get good wet pics with this camera this year. don't bother getting a waterproof case for whatever camera you already have. it's worth it to spend a few more dollars and get this camera. can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Not water proof
Reviews.Author: The Guy who did that thing that 1 time.
Reviews.Content: I buy this camera to take on my Jamaican vacation. First day I'm there I get on the water waist deep water I take two pictures and the camera shuts down.  I thought that maybe the batteries are dead,  when I get to my room to put in new batteries open the camera and the batteries and memory stick were wet.  If I didn't have my cellphone to use as a camera for the rest of the vacation I would had been extra mad. At least I got my money back.

Reviews.Title: Does not work for us.
Reviews.Author: Lynne Remmereid
Reviews.Content: This camera didn't work for us.  We wanted to use it out side and wanted something slightly waterproof incase it was damp outside.  It keeps loosing the pictures.

Reviews.Title: water inside
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: bought on april here comes sept and it was water inside ;( it didn't even lasted a year, mainly used in pool 6 feet and under

Reviews.Title: extremely dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Sylvia Truc Trinh
Reviews.Content: A lot of people left good reviews for this camera and was sooo disappointed . I bought this for my Bf's son for our trip to the virgin islands just in the water for 5 min it stopped working and never turned back on. Luckily i have an olympus tough and was able to capture his first snorkel adventure. Dont even bother wasting money on this camera .

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY THIS ITS TERRIBLE
Reviews.Author: pehealth
Reviews.Content: I wanted this because i love under water pictures. i took it in the pool and not only did it take crappy blurry pictures IT BROKE IN ONE DAY. water clouded the lens and got it the camera and it never turned on again. this is the biggest waste of money im telling you!! its worth it to pay alot more for a great camera. lmao worst camera ever i hate it

Reviews.Title: Spotted pictures
Reviews.Author: Tree
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for our Cancun vacation, because I thought it would involve a lot of water activities, so far it was okay if only used as regular camera in a clear day, but once it touched water (rain) or at least 1foot deep under water, the pictures are spotted. Ugly white spots on the face, around fish, etc. It ruins most of the pictures, very disappointing !

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: charles slaughter
Reviews.Content: Took our 3 granddaughters to Hawaii and this camera was awesome when we were snorkeling-the videos were great and the stills, underwater were just perfect.  We took over 250 pictures and about 10 videos and they turned out just great.

Reviews.Title: Did no Last an hour in the pool
Reviews.Author: Manny Brizuela
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera, with the intention of taking pictures of my son while swimming in the pool.The camera seem to work OK for a few minutes, but after submerged a few times in a foot of waterit just stopped working, eventually it did not turn on anymore. I guess it was not as waterproof as advertised.Very sad I had to return it, because I did like the look and feel of it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very compact and handy to carry!
Reviews.Author: Kenanater
Reviews.Content: I will recommend this camera to anyone who wants a good value in a handy easy to carry camera .....takes great pics!

Reviews.Title: It's fine
Reviews.Author: Wow
Reviews.Content: It works great, but sometimes (at least for me) when you take the picture and you downloaded in your computer, the pictures appear with red bars or half-red, so I have end up losing nice pictures and irreplaceable

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Coons
Reviews.Content: Used this camera to document cold water fisheries research.  Easy to use. Bought specifically for use under water. Amazing clarity and quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: The camera worked well, it worked in water and at shallow depths without issue.The interface to computer works just fine.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Camera! I wasn't disappointed at ALL!
Reviews.Author: Erica M.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and I was nervous because the reviews were mixed, but I got it anyway.  I used it in Chicago to take pictures on my trip. The pictures turned out pretty good! I even dropped it a few times and it didn't break at all.  I was most impressed when I got home and I took it to the pool. Some people on the reviews said that as soon as they put it in water, it broke. But mine was perfectly fine! You just have to seal the battery compartment shut (it's super easy) and your camera is just fine. I've gotten plenty of awesome underwater pics. Super impressed! Must get if you like to go swimming and want a good underwater camera for that. :)

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof, not happy
Reviews.Author: Sarah Lyman
Reviews.Content: As soon as I took the camera in the water it stopped responding and then it died. Amazon is being pretty cool about sending it back but not sure what I'm going to take on my trip now.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the money especially!
Reviews.Author: Chanell
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good quality photos and video. It has a flash on it as well. Very good quality pictures. My only thing was that I wished it could handle a bigger memory card. I had to settle with a 4 gig in it. I put in an 8 and 16 gig and it couldn't work with that big. Otherwise this is an awesome camera and well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Fun in the water
Reviews.Author: Laura "Laura A."
Reviews.Content: Okay, I had a lot of fun with this camera on the beach.  It worked as I imagined it would.  It was waterproof, and I was impressed by that.Pros - it really is waterproof.  I did a test in the bathtub first before I brought it on a trip.Pros - it's a great little camera to use in the rain, or on a boat, beach, pool where the risk of being in the water is possible.  It alleviates a lot of worry that expensive gear will be ruined.Cons - do yourself a favor and buy the inflatable wrist strap so it doesn't sink to the bottom of the ocean. Just because it is waterproof, doesn't make it buoyant.Cons - shutter speed reaction was slow.  I would press the button and a half second to a second later it would take the photo.  Not great for taking action shots in the water, but with a little timing and practice it worked fine.  You must anticipate action shots.Bring spare batteries!  Remember to dry off the camera completely before opening up the compartment to replace batteries.

Reviews.Title: not waterproof
Reviews.Author: J. Walker
Reviews.Content: At the first touch of water this"waterproof" camera died. There was water in the battery case and behind the viewing screen. Unfortunately,  I unpacked my spare camera to lighten my load, so I had  no pictures of my wonderful trip to Cancun to swim with the whale sharks. Maybe this is why Kodak is out of the camera business.

Reviews.Title: Best for the price!
Reviews.Author: M. Moore
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best bargains out there.  We bought this for a family trip to Key West and recorded both videos and photos anywhere from 1-10 feet of water.  Pic quality was great and the sound was a fun surprise for underwater.

Reviews.Title: GOOD ENOUGH!
Reviews.Author: Stephie "steph"
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED THIS CAMERA BECAUSE I NEEDED A CAMERA THAT WAS NOT ONLY DURABLE BUT ALSO AFFORDABLE. This camera is that and more. Used this camera at Hurricane Harbor and recorded our funny moments and took many pictures. Inside of Camera DID NOT GET WET. Very happy with my purchase.Kodak EasyShare Sport C123 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera (Red)

Reviews.Title: Not a good buy
Reviews.Author: carol gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Hawaii vacation, hoping to take it snorkeling etc. I took 2 pictures and it stopped working. I changed the batteries and double checked everything.. Still nothing. Thank god for my smartphone camera!!

Reviews.Title: Did not work!
Reviews.Author: Hedy S. Cauthen
Reviews.Content: Used it in the pool and water got inside and could to turn camera on.  Not able to use now.

Reviews.Title: It's not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Daisy Cunningham
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in April for June cruise trip base on other people's reviews. I took several pictures prior the cruise, it seems ok. We took a lot of pictures on the cruise without any problem. When we went to snorkeling, it broke. It won't let me do anything. I took out the batteries, memory card, everything were wet. My entire cruise trip pictures were gone. When we got home, I looked at return policy, it already passed the returnable date. I wish I got a different camera. This is not a waterproof camera!

Reviews.Title: It last untill the first swim!
Reviews.Author: Enrique Trejo de Uriarte
Reviews.Content: Its not really waterproof, It last about 20 minutes untill the water gets into the camera, Lets see if I can get my money back!

Reviews.Title: Not seals to be water proof
Reviews.Author: Lissy
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present and on the first use water got inside via the battery compartment.  Would not recommend buying.  Better off getting a regular camera with a waterproof case.

Reviews.Title: Camers
Reviews.Author: william w.
Reviews.Content: Exellent !! I have had this camera all over the beach in seabrook isl south carolina.In the sand on the sand under the salt water,around my dogs neck ,she loves it to.It cleans right off in the water and take fabulous pictures.The memory card that comes with it only takes 8 pictures its crap! Buy a larger card and you can shoot all day and it is so easy to down load and I am computer retarded!! Get the floating wristband its a must it makes it very easy to hang on to I thoroughly recommend this for water people who love to take pictures

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Adrianna Donat
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take photos at the pool this summer, but I bought it in April, and it stopped working before I could take it to the pool.  It won't turn on, despite the fresh batteries. I only used it once.  Save your money and buy a different waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT waste your money!!!!
Reviews.Author: Corona
Reviews.Content: The first time I used this snorkeling it leaked and ruined the SD card.  It was closed properly and had never been dropped.  I ended up having to buy a different camera while on the islands for a lot more money but fortunately I was able to get pictures of my vacation.  I have contacted Kodak customer support at[...]they have authorized a repair (unless they decide I caused the leak), however they are not willing to replace the damaged SD card. I will update my review pending the repair/replacement provided by KodakUpdate:  Kodak did replace the camera however, they did not replace the damaged HD card.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Son Huynh
Reviews.Content: This camera is not water proof at it took only couple minutes and water already fully inside the camera,it's ruin my vacation trip for snorkling

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to use for snorkeling - it never even made it into the water and we encountered problems with it.  After taking several pictures as just a regular camera - to test it and to learn about the different settings - decided to download them to the computer - this is where the problem lies.  Cannot download from the camera and we don't have any other option to get the photos off of the camera.  Tried calling Kodak for support and that is non-existent - we are very disappointed with this camera and will swear off anything Kodak in the future.

Reviews.Title: pool and beach fun for my fam!
Reviews.Author: Carly88
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for 2 years and it works great underwater and above water. Its so easy my 5 year old can use it. I havnt had any problems with it leaking. The only problem is that it drains batteries pretty fast.  The pictures come out so clear and it captures those awesome underwater moments like the first time my son jumped in the pool and when he learned to swim underwater. This camera also takes great video!

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price!
Reviews.Author: Scott C. Vollmer
Reviews.Content: I normally shoot photos with a mid-level digital SLR with lots of bells and whistles, but we recently purchased this little camera for a trip to the Virgin Islands to take underwater snorkeling pictures. I was not expecting too much from a $60 camera, but this little camera WAY exceeded my expectations! Over the course of a week, I took almost 600 pictures and a dozen or so short video clips of fish and scenery. During that time, I only changed the batteries once (I was using non-rechargeable alkaline AAs).To conserve battery power, I did turn the camera off in the water when I wasn't using it. The underwater pictures were best in very clear water when the sun was out, but that is probably the case no matter what kind of camera you have, and the videos were surprisingly good too. I took a few pictures above and out of the water, and they were also nice and clear with great color and exposure. Overall, I really am happy with this little guy, and will enjoy taking it on future trips or hiking or boating when we are likely to get wet. I bought a floating wrist strap that was really helpful in keeping it attached to me, so I didn't have to worry about dropping it to the bottom.My one and only problem with it is that after a week in salt water (I did wash it off at the end of each day), some of the anti-glare coating on the screen has worn off, but that doesn't affect the camera's performance, so I can live with that. I also think it is important to make sure the camera is dry and be gentle when opening the battery compartment when changing the batteries or memory card. This camera worked great for us, and I would recommend it for anyone taking a snorkel trip or wanting other water photos.

Reviews.Title: Worked for one day
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: water got into the lens and it fogged up the second time I used it.  Would love to return it!

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong for the money
Reviews.Author: Fernando
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a waterproof camera to take to our trip to Riviera Maya, we were looking something along the $200 line, but after reading that pretty much every brand and type of waterproof camera seems to have about a 10-20% failure rate we decided to go with a cheap option.Enter the C135.Pros:* It is a small camera.* It uses AA batteries, I paired this camera with Sony's Cycle Energy batteries and charger (http://www.amazon.com/Sony-BCG34HRE4KN-Refresh-Pre-Charged-Batteries/dp/B001DL9WDG/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&qid;=1371477631&sr;=8-4 ) and I never ran out of juice, I always had back up ready and I only needed 1 charge on each to use this camera for 7 days.* It takes really good pictures, they might look crappy on the screen but they come out really good on PC and print, more on that below on the cons.* It is lightweight and very portable.* It's super simple to use, just shoot and the auto focus will do its thing quite fast.Cons:* It is made of plastic, so with time, heat and bumps it might become less waterproof due to plastic deformation.* The screen is very small and the pictures look low-res in there, but other than that is quite fine and the pictures are very nice indeed.* The zoom could be better.Neutral:* It will only hold up well up to 5m, we did a snuba reef activity at 8m and I couldn't take picutes with it, I immediately went to the surface and rested the camera on the boat, I think it would have broken if left for more than a minute at that depth.TL;DR For the money, you can't go wrong with this camera, as some reviews note, you might get one that leaks water inside, but look at every other waterproof camera, this might happen with any brand, so why not go with a small, reliable and cheap option?

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: K. Langley "KL"
Reviews.Content: Great OUTSIDE camera!  Great for pools and beaches!  Indoor pictures were not great but it does what I bought it to do!

Reviews.Title: Perfect size
Reviews.Author: Yahtzee Mania
Reviews.Content: This was great for use while snorkeling in Nassau.Perfect size for a sling pack, easy to use, and took fantastic pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great for the cost
Reviews.Author: Dlp
Reviews.Content: Everything is just as promised. Great deal. Used it on vacation for snorkeling and the wedding. Pics came out better than our main camera.

Reviews.Title: Takes pictures and video underwater!
Reviews.Author: swamlady
Reviews.Content: Easy to video and take picture.  Simple and small! Perfect for my hands. My video and pictures came out great!!!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jack R.
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived when stated and took it out to the beach the next day. The camera worked perfectly. We never took it more that 2 meters (camera states 5) and worked like a charm. We took lots of pictures, and batteries never seemed to be a problem. Great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for snorkeling pics and video
Reviews.Author: Diane Woodard "Travel Junkie"
Reviews.Content: We were only going to Belize for a week, and expected highlights to be snorkeling along that incredible reef.  I didn't want to take my big Canon just for shots of the beach and Mayan ruins, and obviously it wouldn't work underwater, so I decided to try this camera.  It was perfect.  I practiced with it for about a week before we left, to make sure I knew which setting to use underwater, etc.  Had no problems with batteries running low, changed them once during the trip, so I used 4 AAs total. All the photos I took, on land and in the sea, turned out better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Did what I needed for a great price
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: Great underwater pictures, with all the reviews that were bad I was afraid of a leak..nope.  My sister bought one for the same trip to Hawaii and we both loved it.  Underwater, out of water, didn't need another camera, bring a spare set of batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera ..
Reviews.Author: kirby fosgate
Reviews.Content: Takes very clear shots and is easy to use.  I found out it helps to buy some type of hand hold device to attach to the camera so it is a bit easier to take pictures.  Definitely get a floating attachment and a card does not come with the camera .. so that is an additional cost.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Bruce Carson
Reviews.Content: Good small camera for the price lost my last one due to rain -- hope this one is really more waterproof

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: Julie Bero "Say something about yourself!"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just for our beach vacation. We wanted good quality photos that we could use above and below water. The pictures were clear and came out pretty good. The camera worked best in the pool, when snorkeling some of the photos were not very clear, it only has a ten foot depth under water, so anything that wasn't right in front of us is not clear on the photo. Otherwise it is great for everyday use while on vacation and durable. I didn't want to risk the batteries constantly going dead so I invested in the lithium AA batteries and they lasted the whole week over 1000 photos and several videos.

Reviews.Title: happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: Sary
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for pool/ocean photos in Costa Rica.  I thought the camera worked pretty well, we had no problems with water leaking or anything.  The resolution of the images on the screen isn't the best though-  it's difficult to tell if your photo is out of focus or not until you get it on a computer screen.  But overall the camera worked fine and I felt it was a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, light and stylish!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love the color, small that I could fit in my pocket. You need to have extra batteries with you, or at least get a good well known brand because the ones that comes with it doesn't last very long. The quality of the pictures are good, but for underwater pictures I had to edit the color on my computer because they were a just too little dark for my taste. Overall I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: RIM
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great underwater pictures. It is as nice as my other camera that I paid twice the price for that I will not get anywhere near the water!

Reviews.Title: kodak camera
Reviews.Author: Otto Garcia
Reviews.Content: great product works as described batteries last along time between changes works great under water I would recommend this product to my friends

Reviews.Title: Kodak water proof camera
Reviews.Author: Paula H.
Reviews.Content: I have always had Kodak cameras and printers, they are easy to use and reliable. The camera is for my granddaughter for her birthday. I know she will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Did everything we expected and more, for a GREAT price !
Reviews.Author: Bonjour "Bonjour"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for our 2 week beach holiday, based on the great reviews on this site combined with a very good price. For this price did not expect professional quality photos, just good quality amateur photos, and our expectations were exceeded.  Did everything really well -- amazing underwater video (and you can zoom in and out 'live' during a video) even in low-ish light, very good transition between above water and below water in the same clip of video, really great still photos, turns itself to 'sleep' when you don't use it for a bit, then turns back on as soon as you hit the button, worked great diving to 6-10 feet below (we were snorkeling, not scuba-ing) and also took great pictures in 2 different pools.  When you turn it off it reverts to 'auto' so make sure you set it back to "H20" before using it underwater again.  We haven't yet explored all of the features but the basics work very well indeed.  No leakage problems whatsoever in 2 weeks of hard use, no fog problems either.  Uploaded photos and videos in to iPhoto automatically, very easily done with the connecting cord which is included for USB slot.  2 Kodak batteries which came with the camera lasted a reasonably long time, but we bought the long life lithium batteries once we wore those original ones out and the battery life seemed to be quite good, even when taking a number of 5 minute videos in a row.  Make sure you buy an SD card as the camera does not come with.  We mostly used it for outdoor photos although son took a number of indoor videos in low light which turned out quite well.  Only quibble would be that the slot to put the connecting cord in is very close to the piece of the camera which flips up to open the output/battery compartment, and it seems that that piece of the camera could break off easily.  We were very careful in connecting and disconnecting the cord and thus didn't have any issues.  We also made sure to wipe the camera off with a damp cloth after using it in the sea, and didn't open it until we'd been out of the water for a few hours.  Orange colour made it very visible when digging for it in the dive bag.  Make sure you buy a floating wrist strap because while this camera does everything ... it doesn't float !  We bought and liked this one http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004GKLW3O/ref=oh_details_o00_s02_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1

Reviews.Title: Best money I ever spent on a camera!
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for almost two years now.  I wanted something sturdy and could handle water I did  a lot of research on cameras before I decided on the Kodak Easyshare Sport camera (I even drove 40 miles out of my way to see one of these cameras in person) I have dropped this camera many times and so has my kid, although some of the paint has chipped off the edges it still works like newAbout year ago I finally became brave enough to take it underwater and see how it would do and it was great I have taken it in to the pool and water parks many time since then and the kids love it The pictures are amazing and clear.The zoom works under water too and the features are easy to learn and use  and that means A lot coming from me! (I find most cameras and phones features hard to figure out)I think people who say that it gets wet in the batterie compartment are not making sure that it is closed properly.If something ever happened to this camera or I wanted to get one for another family member this would be the one I would go for!

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera!
Reviews.Author: Justlaurax3
Reviews.Content: I love this camera so much! I love the quality of the pictures when I take them under water and on land!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! Great Price!
Reviews.Author: 9Cammy22
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in April 2013 for my vacation to Mexico. I debated since the previous reviews were back and forth. However, I'm glad I decided to buy it. Its a GREAT camera for the price. It took great pictures on the beach, in the pool and on my snorkeling adventure. I dropped it a few times, so it is pretty durable. I had NO problems with leaking. I used it alot during the week so I went through 2 sets of batteries, but I didn't think that was too bad. The flash doesn't work but I didn't buy it for inside use. Its a great camera for outside in the daylight and in the water. I would DEF recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: easyshare123
Reviews.Author: lisa
Reviews.Content: This will be my first review...and im srry to say i have to return it.....the camera was beautiful and easy to use...but no software to use it. IF i Had the Software....it would have been a keeper for sure. i went online to download it butt kodak doesnt offer it anymore......so very disappointed..i wanted this camera for the water park in june.  UPDATE>>>>>>>>  i just learned how to upload my pictures without the software...so i no longer want to send the camera back...i used windows to view and upload my pictures now... i hooked it to my computer and bamm  Results  Still love the camera cant wait to use it on my trip in june ....i going to order another one for my husband ....LOVE IT love it

Reviews.Title: This has been a great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Tracy V Jones
Reviews.Content: I use this camera when I do not want to risk damage to a more expensive camera that I own or when my family is going to be in or around water.  I actually purchased the camera last summer and have since used it a lot.  It has been perfect for trips to the lake and the beach.  I love the fact that I can just jump into the water with this secured around my neck and when I want to snap a shot of my family I do not even have to leave my water raft :D  The pictures turn out great, I have no complaints what-so-ever.  I would recommend this to anyone who would like to capture memories in or around water or in damp environments.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: William E. Sparks III
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the quality of the pictures, it is easy to use and not bulky like our old one.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof at all
Reviews.Author: J. Sisemore
Reviews.Content: After seeing so many reviews from people who complained about water in the battery compartment, we used extra care when installing the batteries.  In spite of that, the camera shut off as soon as it hit the water.  We later discovered water in the battery compartment.  I'm going to attempt to return to Amazon today.We've owned several other brands of underwater cameras in the past, including Canon, Sea & Sea, Polaroid and SeaLife, and I've never had a problem with any of them.  I'll be staying away from Kodak underwater cameras in the future.

Reviews.Title: I love this little thing!
Reviews.Author: Stacey "swade"
Reviews.Content: Great little waterproof camera.  I bought this specifically for our honeymoon because we were going swimming with sea turtles.  The images turned out incredible and I have about 3 that people can't believe I took myself.  I used it snorkeling in saltwater and it was great, I just rinsed it off afterwards.  The wristband was also very convenient.  Only downside was that it requires batteries and the reader doesn't work that well.  We were climbing a waterfall, checked the level before we went, and it died halfway through.  Was unfortunate, but well worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: Battery compartment fails easily
Reviews.Author: Angus Parker
Reviews.Content: Having owned a couple of waterproof cameras I have found that the most important feature is how easy it is to close and maintain a waterproof seal around the battery compartment. Unfortunately, within a few minutes my young son (who was the recipient of this camera) managed to make the battery compartment inoperable / unopenable. So my feeling on this camera is give it a miss despite all the other features. If you can't close and seal the battery compartment easily then pass on any waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Turn it on and it turns itself off before you can snap a photo.
Reviews.Author: BigMomma
Reviews.Content: Got this because I thought a waterproof camera would be good to have during summer fun with the family.  Wrong.  Automatically turns off right after it's turned on - even with brand new batteries.  Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Don't take the chance...
Reviews.Author: njdiyhousewife
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before I bought this camera; some people had no problems, many did.  Unfortunately, I decided to roll the dice and give it a try for a trip to Key Largo; I wanted to take pictures on our snorkeling trip.My daughter and I tried it out the day before in the pool.  It did take about10 pictures, and let me tell you, they were great--crystal clear.  At that point, however, the camera's screen went grey; I thought at first that perhaps it had just run through the batteries very quickly, so I changed out the batteries. Still no luck.  I did not notice any moisture in the battery compartment, but just to test things, I left the battery compartment open and empty over two days.  After that time, the camera suddenly came back to life, sort of.  It turned on and actually snapped two pictures before it conked out again.  What a disappointment.  In the end, we have no pictures of our snorkel trip, and this camera is going back.

Reviews.Title: Photo quality is terrible about 50% of the time
Reviews.Author: Jimmy & Cari
Reviews.Content: I have not tried this underwater yet, but I have been really disappointed with the quality of at least half of the photos. Indoor photos are horrible, unusable--grainy, blurry, dark. The supposed "image stabilization" this camera claims to have is non-existent. It has no option for taking close-ups at all - you just can't do it. And the zoom is not optical as is also claimed--it's purely junk digital zoom. Pathetic.

Reviews.Title: Saved my vacation - terrific underwater pictures!
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: My 'primary' camera broke in Hawaii, and this served as the backup. I bought it specifically for underwater pictures and video while snorkeling - and both turned out FANTASTIC!For the price it was a bargain - and for the fact that it saved my vacation memories, it was priceless!

Reviews.Title: Don't believe the bad reviews
Reviews.Author: Denver37
Reviews.Content: I read plenty of reviews and picked this camera for the cost.  I figured if it got water logged I was not out too much money.  Disposable cameras are too much to develop and half of the pictures dont even come out.  This camera took great pictures and even great video.  I can use it again and again and not waste money on the cheap disposable cameras.  It does take AA batteries but it did not eat through them too quickly.  Buy it for your underwater adventure and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: A snorkeling must have
Reviews.Author: omh
Reviews.Content: I used it snorkeling it worked perfectly.  Works as a wet or dry camera  the water seals held tightly under water.

Reviews.Title: Good, but not great
Reviews.Author: Robert Evans
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take with me for some underwater video for my upcoming Great Barrier Reef trip in Australia, however when it arrived, I knew right away that this was more of a toy than something I wanted to capture memories with. The camera is actually good, with adequate lighting and the video's are great too, but I wanted better images and real HD video.Cons: - Takes forever to turn off - Extremely slow SD card transfer of images (using a class 4 card) - Slow if you want to take images quickly - LCD makes pictures look great, but then you look on larger screen and they are blurry - Not real HD 720/1080 video, just SD - Only 10ft underwaterPros: - Uses easy to source AA batteries - The cheap priceAll in all, I will spend a little more money to buy a Fuji XP50 or 60 so I can get better quality imagery and great underwater video. You can find a refurbished Xp50 for about $100 dollars as of 04/2013 and it can go up to 33ft underwater.This Kodak is a great all around camera, but so is my Samsung Note 2 - and much better. I bought a Frieq universal underwater case (upto 100ft underwater) for my phone if I want to use that too (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00AW2QT8I/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i01?ie=UTF8&psc;=1)UPDATE: After countless days of being indecisive - I didn't get the Fuji XP50. I was then looking at the XP100, but it seemed to not be adequately reviewed and I wasn't 100% sure of wanting that over the XP50/60. The XP60 was a little over $200 dollars and I just really didn't want to spend that much - especially since I'm buying this specifically for my trip, so I then keep going back to the XP50. After more searching I then came across the Nikon Coolpix AW100, it hands down was the BEST choice for the money, comes with GPS, 16MP CMOS Sensor, 33ft depth for underwater and 5X optical zoom. The pictures I came across online look great underwater and out of the water and it can do 60FPS HD 1080 video! If you search the webs you can find it for about $160-ish bucks refurbished and I'm REALLY happy with it - so much more camera for about 65 bucks more.

Reviews.Title: easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: Mavis J
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a recent river float trip. While I haven't use the camera completely submerged yet, I have taken regular pictures with it. It's a really basic and easy to use point and click camera. Please note this camera only comes with digital zoom, and no optical zoom like that stated in the desciption. My pictures have been clear, and the video took good quality. The digtial zoom is the same as most camera's and only provides basic zoom before the quality becomes distorted.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Hope Stewart
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to use during our honeymoon since we were swimming with manatees. Used it once while snorkling for a half hour and it started malfunctioning. The camera would not turn back on and when it finally did after letting it dry out for 24 hours, the buttons no longer worked. Buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof!
Reviews.Author: MaryLee
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera in advance of our trip to the Cayman Islands.  It quit working on the first snorkel around the dock...it is not waterproof as stated!  Sadly, when we returned home and I tried to return it, the 'return window expired' and I was not able to return it for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: not good so far
Reviews.Author: elizmellisa
Reviews.Content: i bought this a few days ago and received it today - i bought it used (but in very good condition) on amazon. it looked fine (just a few little scratches) and i thought all was good until i tried taking pictures. the shutter button would not work (or i guess i should say it worked sporadically - extremely sporadically)... i changed the batteries and checked that my memory card was in correctly - i even had my boyfriend look at it (i've never owned a digital and he has 3) but to no avail. i am returning it - and since i already bought the memory card i re-ordered (a brand new camera) i really hope it works better!

Reviews.Title: believe the other reviews, this product is horrible
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: This was the worse buy I have made, although, Amazon was great in taking care of the return.  it took very so so pictures, but very nice video....for about 20 minutes, and it was NEVER submersed.  I heard a little bzzzt and it was toast.  Unfortunately, it was the only camera I brought to see Napali on Kaua

Reviews.Title: Excellent overall little waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Alex Croy
Reviews.Content: Excellent little gizmo. Good enough to be the go-to point n shoot for all occasions if you don't need a lot of features.Pros-Light but solidly constructed-waterproof - survived 3-4ft depths for hours in the salt water while snorkling-Takes aa batts-Batts last a long time-Takes very decent pics both aboth and below water, all settings to 'auto'-Microphone works very well underwater-starts up and shuts down fast-Intuitive menu system-Adjustable screen brightness - last longer when darker, nice n bright when needed-easy to transfer pics - use it like a memory card-good feel to the buttons - rubber but still a solid clickcons-Always starts up in default mode, does not remember if you were in video, underwater etc. This got annoying - snorkling around for a while, see something worthwile, then have to not just turn it on but cycle through the settings (and hope fishy is still there) before snapping the pic.-poor low-light performance-Mic easily overwhelemed by wind-no gridlines. Better be good estimating the horizon, easy to take all pics a bit tilted-very suseptible to water on the lens when above water. i.e. a droplet on the lens while walking the shore will totally blur the pics. May be no way around this, as a water droplet is a very good lens.... But a good FYI-want to install Kodak software.

Reviews.Title: Loved using this!
Reviews.Author: Shanna Terry
Reviews.Content: Bought this to use on a cruise in the carribean....we used to purchase waterproof disposable cameras, so this beat that hands down in every aspect.  Cost, qualtiy of photos, ease of use, we loved the videos especially!  Would recomend this to anyone needing an inexpensive water proof camera!

Reviews.Title: I would not buy this again
Reviews.Author: Windy
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my son and I.  It was a waste of money.  The pictures are not very good.

Reviews.Title: Works great!!
Reviews.Author: JimU
Reviews.Content: Easy to use....takes great underwater pics and even better videos.  Just make sure you have enough room on your SD card if you take a lot of video.  The screen can be a little hard to see with sun glare, but its a point and shoot camera, so you don't always really have to see the screen to take a picture....especially under water.....use the float wrist strap always!!...this thing sinks with out it.

Reviews.Title: PERFECTION for an underwater/water friendly camera!
Reviews.Author: jay
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a pocket camera for a cruise that we went on.  We weren't sure how great it would be until we went snorkeling in the Bahamas.  Holy cow!  GREAT clarity video AND still shots!  We had this camera underwater at depths of about 10 feet or so for the better part of a full day, multiple days for a week & it never once had an issue.  DO NOT concern yourself with leaks w/this camera.We also used it in a Color Me Rad 5k (just google it), being pelted by colored cornstarch and sprayed w/colored water.  It looked absolutely terrible after the race.  Caked in colored crud, we thought it was probably time to order a new one.  NOPE!!  I literally rinsed it in the sink for about 5 seconds and it came 100% clean.AMAZING CAMERA

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Adams "cell phone addict"
Reviews.Content: I work for a roofing company and the guys love these. Easy to use and waterproof for when its raining.

Reviews.Title: An Amazing Value For An Incredible Camera
Reviews.Author: Matt Lacoste
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a cruise this past March, and it worked BEAUTIFULLY!  I used it extensively during a snorkeling excursion, and although I didn't really have high expectations for the picture quality, I was SHOCKED at how well the images turned out:  crisp, clear, colorful, and detailed.  Since then, I've leant it to a handful of friends who were also going on cruises, and their pictures came-out just as beautifully as mine.  The ability for the camera to auto focus underwater is simply incredible.  This camera has made it through 3 rather abusive underwater adventures and it still works perfectly.  I would definitely recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Gramma P.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for a recent trip to Australia and New Zealand, knowing we would be doing some water activities and did not want to risk the loss or damage our regular digital cameras. The price was right, it did it's job. I am sure we could have paid more for one that would have taken better photos. But you get what you pay for. This camera was exactly as it was advertised.

Reviews.Title: A Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: wise tech "mlm_phx"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my teenage granddaughter last year.  It has stood the test of time with rugged use by an avid young swimmer who loves to take underwater pictures.  She bragged to me that she still loves her camera and it is in good working order.

Reviews.Title: Canon C123 - Very good, but ...
Reviews.Author: GeBat
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my boyfriend as a Christmas present, and since my sister lives in Chicago and we live in Argentina, I got her to bring me the camera. Very good price, good quality picture, and it looked as a reliable product. I have some concerns about some of the negative reviews, saying that there were leakings and odd behaviour after using it underwater. I decided, though, to give it a try, risking that if the camera failed I wouldn't be able to get a refund, because sending the camera over would be a pain in the ass and it could take forever. Plus, I really wanted this to be the present.  So, this was the scenaro in which the camera was bought, to give you an idea of why the rating. Here's what happened. We used the camera for regular shooting, outside, inside. I'm a photographer so I tried pretty much everything. We used it out of the water like a week or so, because the weather was bad and we couldn't get to go to the beach or to a swimming pool. Yesterday the weather was pretty much ok and we went to a water park. As soon as we got there, we got into the pool and started taking underwater photos and shooting videos. It was ok, the lcd wasn't very visible 'cause of the sun, and the audio of the video wouldn't play (though I knew that it was made that way). So, after a couple of hours of using it and pluning into water and sliding down some rides, we turned of the camera and the screen begin to flicker. Then it went blank. Then it flickered again. We didn't know what to do or what happened. We looked every compartment to see if water had leaked or wtf could be causing that. We got into the internet and searched for the problem. It said that the camera should be left off for drying, so we remove the sd memory and the batteries, quit using it for 24 hours and waited. We just turned it on again, and it works perfectly! The screen doesn't flicker, nor goes blank. We downloaded the pictures and videos and it all looks pretty good (image and sound too!). It is a very good camera, nice, easy to carry in a swimsuit pocket and around your wrist. BUT that flickering thing freaked me out. I think it maybe had to do with some steam or sth. Like the camera got wet and because of the heat, there was steam inside it. IDK. The thing is, it is a very good product, but I'd be more comfortable with a product that doesn't behave that way.  But I think that that's one of the risks of getting things via amazon living on the other side of the globe. It IS a good deal. You just have to be careful. I read every review for this camera at least twice before buying it and tried it anyway. I'm satisfied but not entirely. I hope this flickering thing was a just one time thing.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace one just like it that I dropped into the river.  It takes excellent pictures and the colors are vivid and perfect.  I have had 5 digital cameras, but Kodak made the ones that got the best color pictures.  I hate to see Kodak stop making cameras.  They were the best.

Reviews.Title: Rugged enough for my 9-year-old
Reviews.Author: ChrisG "ChrisG"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my 9-year-old, who is notoriously rough on things.  1 year later, it's still holding up.

Reviews.Title: User friendly
Reviews.Author: Snapdragon69
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera hoping it would be easy to use and water proof. I was hoping for nothing fancy just a simple point and shoot camera. I got it and took it on my cruise vacation were we did water activities (snorkeling) and regular activities and I must say the camera got great pictures. I didn't have any trouble with the camera letting in water (I bought the blue one)  but my brother bought the gray one and it leaked. I think it is a great camera. It is the only one I use know.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Mick
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Amazon about a year ago. I wasn't really concerned about how well it worked when submerged, instead I was simply looking for a camera I could take to the lake, beach, etc.  After a summer full of lake trips, several trips to the beach and pool, and deer hunting in the pouring down rain; I can say with confidence that this camera is more than water resistant.  It wasn't until this past weekend, we realized just how trusty this little camera is.  My sister, brother in law, and their 2 sons went on a river kayak excursion.  The kayak the camera was in capsized and got lodged under water for almost a half hour.  The camera never took on a single drop of water.  The battery compartment stayed dry as a bone, and the pictures they had taken were very clear and colorful.  They continued taking pictures after they recovered both the kayak and camera with zero problems.  I only gave it 4 stars because if you don't hold it real steady, some of the pictures tend to come out blury.  It has no stabilizer.  Also the price of the camera has increased significantly.  I purchased mine a year ago for $69 and now they are more than twice that but still a good bargain for such a trusty little camera.

Reviews.Title: Still works after a week in the ocean!
Reviews.Author: C. Mazza
Reviews.Content: We lost our camera in the water off the Na Pali Coast in Kauai.  A week later, the boat captain was snorkeling in the same general area with another group and found it!  She turned it on and it was still working and the pictures were still there.  Can't wait to get it back!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: NC
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this for a trip filled with water activities.  It was received the exact day the manufacturer/Amazon had said it would be. Have only tried it out in a pool, and was extremely happy so far. Out of water took great pictures too, for the price you really can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Leaks too easily.
Reviews.Author: M. Forehand "Spike Forehand"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures for the price both above and below water, but the problem is that it leaks very easily through the battery compartment.  The first one my daughter had leaked during it's second use.  Kodak was excellent about replacing it with a refurbished one under warranty, but the refurbished one leaked the first time we used it.  While I am sure Kodak will also replace this one, we won't be trying to use it in water again and will instead go another way for underwater photography.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Nawora
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera before heading to an indoor water park for vacation.  On our first day there our 3 year old decided to start swimming underwater for the first time.  This camera was perfect for catching those moments.  I've since used it for every pool party, lake adventure, and just times at the local city pool.  It works great.  The only complaint I've had is trying to see the images on the screen has been hard at times in the bright sunlight, so I've had a lot of "just shoot, shoot, shoot, and wait til I get home to see what I've got" days.  Luckily it takes so many great shots I'm usually happy with what I wind up with.As far as video goes, I can't complain there either.  It's a small camera, so the video quality isn't that  of a larger HD video camera, but it's sufficient for catching those smalls moments in the pool.I bought rechargeable batteries immediately so I can't so what the normal battery life is like.  I know in the month and a half that I've had the camera I've had to recharge once so far.  That's with using it frequently.I really like this little camera and have received so many complements on the pictures I've taken with it.  Just tonight I had 3 different friends ask what camera it was and where to get one.  I can honestly say we compared and searched for over a month before settling on this Kodak and I'm so happy we did.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly D. Peach "K. Peach"
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the price, took it to Florida shot lots of pictures and video underwater all went well and very easy to work.

Reviews.Title: So much fun!
Reviews.Author: smpphiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We took this camera to Cancun, both in the pool, and snorkeling! We had it out every day of our week long vacation with no issues, and then lent it to a friend who did the same. Images are great, we had a blast photographing each other, fish, coral, our snorkel guide... not to mention that it does okay on land as well... you just don't have to worry about getting it wet and sandy! Our honeymoon will always be remembered because of this camera. Great investment.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Tierra
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip I was going on and just wanted a simple camera instead of dealing with diposable ones. This is a perfect point and shoot camera. It takes good pictures and is easy to use. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Prettty good
Reviews.Author: TrikiaDav
Reviews.Content: No problems with this camera yet. It did not come with any type of software but I have what came with the kodak camera I bought this to replace.

Reviews.Title: Awesome underwater camera!!
Reviews.Author: Kane
Reviews.Content: Had so much fun with this camera in the pool. Pictures come out so clear, friends enjoyed it so much. The only drawback of it is that you could't see the screen underwater, so you sort of need to "blind" shot at different directions. It takes some time to get used to it.

Reviews.Title: poor display illumination
Reviews.Author: Edward "Eddie P"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take to the caribean and use while snorkeling. The led display is useless outdoors in the sunlight. You cannot make anything out on the display. There is no view finder so the the camera does not work in the daylight. It is better tho not much underwater. The display is difficult to see underwater. I was essentially guessing where I was aiming. Maybe that is expected from a low cost camera.The pictures are nice enough but since it is difficult to aim they are not always of what is expected

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: davide
Reviews.Content: It works really good. Specially for how much it cost. I used it in a trip to Cancun in March 2012.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: LaRonna
Reviews.Content: The week after I received this camera, we took it to Mexico on a cruise.  I was VERY PLEASED with ALL the pictures I took with it!!!  I printed them and they are beautiful!  It was hard to see underwater what I was taking a photo of, but it's digital so I just took a bunch and erased what I didn't need.  I'm so excited to have something I can take to amusement parks, water parks, and just around the pool and not have to worry about it getting wet.  Before, we took baggies with us when we would ride the water rides at amusement parks we would bag the camera up.  Now that we have this, we don't need to do that anymore!!!

Reviews.Title: Set-up is a Snap!
Reviews.Author: Brett Rudy "aka Kerri10"
Reviews.Content: The set-up on this camera is remarkable. Plugged it in and the software auto-installs. Then it walk you through linking to Facebook, Twitter and other social media accounts so that when you take a picture, right afper plugging in, everything shares right away. Very high resolution shots too. For under $100 bucks, it is so much less expensive than buying disposable underwater cameras for our vacations and then paying for developing. Recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price!
Reviews.Author: k1088

} } } Length:: 0:56 MinsWe bought this camera for our recent trip to Mexico, so we could take pictures & videos when we went snorkeling. We didn't want to spend a fortune on an underwater camera (no matter what the price, there seem to be some "bad apples" that will leak & break), but we wanted a good quality. This camera gave us just that! We tested it in his saltwater tank at home for a few pictures, and it worked fine.When we got to Mexico, we used it in the pool, in the ocean for about two hours, and again the next day for a couple more hours. The picture quality & video quality was great (I'll upload a couple to show later), and we never once saw any issues with leaking or sand getting in cracks.Be sure to dry it off thoroughly after getting out of the water each time, and you should have no problems.

Reviews.Title: Didn't make it through vacation
Reviews.Author: Sundog
Reviews.Content: Hoped for an inexpensive camera to use while snorkeling on vacation.  Got a few shots, but stopped working the second day in the water.  Very difficult to see the view screen or see to change settings while in the water.  Had to just point the camera and hope.  Did get a few fun shots, but the quality of the photos is pretty poor. (May not have had the settings correct, because of the difficulty in seeing the view screen in sun and in water.) I returned the camera and kudos to Amazon for easy return.  Well, it made it worth a try, but will try another camera for my next adventure!

Reviews.Title: Simple is always BEST!
Reviews.Author: janie
Reviews.Content: This camera delivers great pictures underwater for the money!!! Due to the double locking door...water STAYS out! My cousin came to visit me here in the Virgin Islands and her NEW FIJI underwater camera which cost DOUBLE the cost of the kodak was RUINED in the first hour of snorkeling...a single door had accidently been switched to "open" and salt water POURED in....So more money does not always make for a better product....BUY THIS ONE! And it is EASY to operate....less is better too!!!!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Lawrence R. Owen
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera. It takes great pictures in or out of the water and even has sound... underwater. We took this camera onto the beaches and places that we did not feel comfortable taking our more expensive cameras and it took great pictures. I could hardly believe that some of the pictures that were imported onto my computer were from the Kodak and not the Canon or my Nikon SLR. One very minor problem was the fact that you could not see what you were filming underwater. Pictures and Video were really clear underwater. I was surprised that I was able to capture things underwater that I could not even see through my googles. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Vagrant
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo398HQFSC2ATPW', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo398HQFSC2ATPWloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf";
