The only thing I could see is my own reflection, I guess the camera needs a glare free screen.  I did take this underwater and did not leak.  Except for the screen glare it is a nice camera for the money it just depends what you want to use it for.  I bought it to use underwater.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Douglas Hunsinger
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for my vacation in Mexico. It took great pictures. I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Ordered the 14MP one, received the 12MP one by mistake...I still like it
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to serve as a "secondary" camera.  A camera that could:1) Travel without worrying about breaking or losing it (if it's cheap enough)2) Take reasonably good photos; I thought coming across a 14MP version on amazon was a huge score, much higher res than I was originally expecting.  However, the vendor, Hidden Treasure Emporium, shipped me the 12MP one by mistake.  I won't hold it against them because they offered the best price (about $10 less than most of the others).  I probably wouldn't notice the 2MP difference anyway.3) Take really good videos4) Use in shallow water and/or beachside without destroying the cameraSo far, 1-3 are definitely satisfied.  The pictures that this camera takes are better than what I was expecting from a secondary camera.  I haven't tested the waterproof nature of this camera, but it looks like the important parts are sealed.FYI...The camera also comes with a wrist strap, so you don't need to buy that floatation wrist strap add-on thing; however, if you think you'll be in water a lot and want the camera to stay near the surface at all times, in the event that the wrist strap comes off your wrist, it may be worth forking over the $6 or so.Rich

Reviews.Title: Does a fantastic job for the price
Reviews.Author: Chris Baker "cb2000a"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a simple and cheap underwater camera this is the one for you. It takes great pictures underwater and also above water. My wife uses it quite a bit in the ocean here in Maui. You always should clean it in fresh water then let it dry completely before opening it. Yes the paint will flake off eventually, but that has no impact on it as far as taking pictures. It also takes great underwater videos with sound. Overall, a great starter camera for underwater photography.

Reviews.Title: underwster kodak camera
Reviews.Author: nikki_matthews
Reviews.Content: Took this snorkeling in the Bahamas. Pictutes turned out great.. batteries that cane w/ lasted almost the whole trip.. great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: my experience
Reviews.Author: Andres
Reviews.Content: I returned it right away because when i started testing it after it arrived, the video did not have any sound. it would record and it looked good but I could not hear. I made sure the sounds were turned on and I also reset it but it did not work. I also did not like that it does not have the auto focus. The camera will simply take a picture without knowing if is clear or not. I literally played with it for about 30 minutes and stuck it back in the box and returned it. Returning is simple and the postage is paid by amazon so no problems with that. This camera might be better for a young person as a first camera since is cheap but is better paying a bit more and get something more solid.

Reviews.Title: Took it to an indoor waterpark
Reviews.Author: KMc814
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for going to a water park or the pool. You have to be extremely still to use the camera, because a LOT of our pictures came out blurry. (We are photographers by trade). But, it did exceptionally well with underwater shots and we had fun playing around with it. Worth the purchase!

Reviews.Title: miguel gonzalez
Reviews.Author: Miguel Angel  Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: estoy esperando todavia y desde que pague los impuestos y nada que llega ya llego semana santa y no la tengo era para usarla en semana santa

Reviews.Title: Not the best camera
Reviews.Author: themightytank
Reviews.Content: Not the best camera at least for me. I usely only buy easyshare, I have bought 4 counting this one I LOVED my easyshare cameras then I bought this one because I have started kayaking and I was afraid I might get my camera wet so I was very exciteted to find one that was waterproof, I don't take pictures under water so that might be the problem, the picture quality is terrible! not vivid and clear like my other cameras, It's a nice looking camera, I was just very dissapointed in the picture Quality..

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Daria B. Araujo "Daria Ratliff"
Reviews.Content: It's light and easy to use. Pictures are very nice, either in or out of water. Best if the images are edited in software to get rid of that green cast when in underwater. Other than that, great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: jpjeep
Reviews.Content: We have used this camera for many activities, including hiking, biking, white water rafting and kayaking.  Its been rained on, submerged, covered in color powder from color runs, and dropped.  It has scratches and nicks all over from the abuse it has endured (war wounds) and to this day remains our favorite camera for our active lifestyle.  Great camera for the price, and its been completely reliable as a waterproof camera.  It was submerged and thrown against boulders in the Arkansas River in Colorado for over a minute, yet still works like a charm.  One "complaint", it is not a speedy camera....don't expect to get a number of shots off at a time.  Runs through the two AA batteries fairly quickly too.  Still definitely worth buying.  We are ordering another one so that we can both have the "good" camera for our next adventure.

Reviews.Title: Good for underwater photography
Reviews.Author: E. Steffeck
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great underwater photos.  I was very impressed by its capabilities for underwater.  However, it does not take great above water photos. I got this camera to take on a waterpark vacation.  After the first day I realized I had to take my regular digital camera in a waterproof bag if I wanted any above water photos.  The above water photos are always washed out and grainy.  So if you don't mind hauling around two cameras than this camera is a GREAT underwater camera, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: excelente
Reviews.Author: Jhonatan
Reviews.Content: excelente producto, de alta calidad, original, entregado a tiempo, lo recomiendo ampliamente a todos los lectores y espero que mi opinión les sea útil.

Reviews.Title: Slipped off my wrist in the surf, never to be seen again
Reviews.Author: PacificNorthWetGal
Reviews.Content: Great little camera but it didn't survive my first encounter with water. I was wading into rough surf to go snorkeling. I had the camera strap around my wrist. A wave washed it off my wrist and I never saw it again. Just posting this as a warning, not a criticism.I notice now that one of the items frequently sold with the camera is a wrist strap with a flotation doohickey. That might have made it easier to find the camera.I also bought a bunch of the disposable 35mm underwater cameras, which I ended up using for the rest of the trip. These cameras came with big rubber bands that served as the wrist straps. The grippiness of the rubber bands was more effective at keeping the cameras attached to me in similar circumstances.

Reviews.Title: Good for simple underwater photography.
Reviews.Author: Elton Salgado
Reviews.Content: The picture quality for underwater photos is not bad, however don't expect amazing quality photos. It obviously doesn't perform like a professional underwater camera, or like a DSLR, photos look a little more foggy than the water actually is, but again, for the price, it's pretty darn good.For out of the water, it's a pretty good point and click camera. The pictures come out pretty clear, and it's great for taking on a boat or out into the beach so that you can get it wet without worrying about it.Video quality is similar to the quality you'd find in a typical smart phone.Battery seems to last pretty well too. The stock Kodak batteries that came with it lasted more than 2 days of constant use, we then changed them to better ones because they were half way used, and didn't want to risk running out. We used it for about another 4 days and it's still got plenty of power to go.

Reviews.Title: Great producet
Reviews.Author: Sonja Rudder
Reviews.Content: I had the previous model before i accidentally destroyed it, zoom is better, battery life is way better!  I am a hiker so any waterproof camera is fantastic!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Bargain!
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Devine
Reviews.Content: Great little camera and economical.  Easy to use and good quality pictures.  I would recommend this camera for all ages.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jaki R
Reviews.Content: This camera is waterproof and also takes great quality photos. I am thrilled with it. I have recommended it to others who  have also purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: S. Pappas
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for the price. Simple & takes great pics. Great for snow & wet situations where a more expensive camera isn't needed.

Reviews.Title: not the best but it works
Reviews.Author: redeyeblues
Reviews.Content: It takes okay pictures and videos both in and out of water - not the best quality but decent enough to remember your trips by.  I took some while snorkeling and got a couple of nice photos.  The only thing is that even at the brightest screen setting, it's hard to see what you're taking pictures of underwater, so you just have to aim it at the general direction, take a bunch of pictures, and hope for the best.  And of course it needs bright sunlight so it's not good for night photos.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: apoem "apoem"
Reviews.Content: This has been a great camera.Others have posted their pictures of fish and underwater activities so I will skip that. Let me just say that my camera preformed just as well and took videos that looked just as good as those posted.We were going to Maui and I wanted .... just believed I NEEDED.... a camera that would take pictures under water. I did some research and this one seemed to be a good camera for the price. I haven't had much luck with Kodak cameras so it was with some hesitation that I ordered it. However, it was fantastic.This camera feels heavy. It feels like it is sturdy. This is also why the directions have the warning that the camera will sink. It is heavier than many digital cameras.Despite being heavy though it fit well in my hand. It was easy to use. The icons on the screen of the camera were easy to understand and the dials and buttons were very intuitive. There were enough bells to make me feel like I had my money's worth and not so many that it was difficult to remember how to operate the camera.For the cost this is probably the best option out there if you are looking for an underwater camera.Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Good Littl Waterproof Camera for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Paul Blake
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a recent Caribbean Cruise that I took.  We had 2 shore excursions that invloved water sports, and I wanted to get pictures.  The camera spent a fair amount of time under water, both intentionally and unintentionally (like when I wiped out my jet ski) and still worked as advertised!  The screen was somewhat difficult to see in the bright sun and glare from the water, and there is no view finder, but other than that, I have no complaints about the performance.  The pictures it took were clear & sharp.  The case it came with is small, with no compartments for carrying xtra batteries, etc., but for the money, this was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: Practical camera
Reviews.Author: Irma
Reviews.Content: I've been using my waterproof camera wherever I go. It takes really good pictures underwater, clean frames with good resolution. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Shannon K Crabtree
Reviews.Content: As a trained professional photographer, I'm always looking for fun little point-n-shoot cameras that I can play with and add to my collection.  We planned a trip in which we were going snorkeling and debated whether we should buy some film underwater disposables or a cheap digital underwater.  We went with this one and am pleased with the results.  It actually takes decent pictures....but remember, its a fixed lens point and shoot!  You have to be fairly close to your subject-matter, as the 'zoom' feature gets grainy quickly.  Good lighting is a must.....so bright, sunny, and close is the KEY!  We submerged it numerous times, probably up to about 6 feet and had no issues with leakage.  If you want to go below 9 feet, you have to get something better, but hey, for the price this little guy is PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: Took it Snorkeling
Reviews.Author: D. Malnar "Chels36"
Reviews.Content: We went to Costa Rica. I wanted a water resistant camera. I was very pleased with this camera! We took it into hot springs, the ocean and zip lining in the rain. Had no problems. Great Value for the money!

Reviews.Title: A wonderful job
Reviews.Author: Laura B. Mehaffey "Anime/Manga Guru"
Reviews.Content: This camera worked quite well for amateur underwater photography.  The microphone worked fine to record sound lectures and gurgles underwater.  The photos were much clearer than the disposable cameras.  The video quality was breathtaking, and much better than the photos.Once you buy this camera, MAKE SURE that you close both the inner door (red) and secure it BEFORE closing the outer door.  If you do not close that inner door securely, it WILL leak, and you will have to dry it out for 24 hours.  After 9 hours of use, the outer lens fogged only once, and otherwise it worked wonderfully for a sometimes-photographer.I would recommend that you purchase a floating camera strap.  I dropped this camera at least twice while snorkeling, and it floated quickly while still recording.

Reviews.Title: NO SOFTWARE!!!
Reviews.Author: H. Armstrong
Reviews.Content: I love the ease of this camera.  It took great pictures both above water and under water.  However, I wouldn't know what they look like on a screen bigger than the back of the camera because Kodak doesn't offer the EasyShare software as a download after 9/5/2012.  Which isn't broadcast anywhere on the Amazon site.  So, I spent $84 on a camera that I can't get the pictures onto my computer.  When I called Kodak, all they said was "sorry, this software is no longer available."  Can anyone help me figure out how to get the pics off my computer??!?!  I'd rate the camera higher if I didn't feel like I got duped.

Reviews.Title: Great for outdoors !
Reviews.Author: Juan M
Reviews.Content: Easy-to-use and good performance under water. It is also shock-resistant. Ideal to use outdoor or in not-so-safe environments (i.e.: with kids at home)

Reviews.Title: the entire family ages 3 to 73 used the camera and enjoyed it
Reviews.Author: Gordon Whitney
Reviews.Content: we took it on our trip to Cabos San Lucas...the kids and parents had a great time picture and video taking each other under water in the pools...

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Nelson Eduardo Quintero Londono
Reviews.Content: Excellent!!, i went to Cancun with this camera. i used it and abuse it. i did snorkeling, when deep in the sea. tuck lots of pictures everywhere and the resolution was great and the quality video is awesome too. I highly recommend this camera if you want to go to vacation and want to take pics everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Simply love it!
Reviews.Author: Salome Graven
Reviews.Content: I used it to take photos of me and my parents' island hopping tour in Palawan, Philippines.We used it while we were snorkeling and in the swimming pool and it performed as promised, and we also used it for regular photos and the pictures where A-okay!

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Forevernight
Reviews.Content: I got this nifty little camera for my vacation to Jamaica. It worked like a charm. No issues with water leakage like some reviews. Only problem was, when you rise to the surface make sure water is not on the lens because you will get a blurry pictures. The video option works wonderful. Only drawback is if you want to zoom in really close, then the picture looks distorted. Regular pictures come out good. Did not try taking low light or night pictures because of multiple reviews saying it was bad. i bought another camera for those shots. Overall I am extremely happy with this camera and can't wait for my next vacation to use it.

Reviews.Title: Works great for low price!
Reviews.Author: kelly brinks
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera recently for a trip to the bahamas. I wanted something that I could use both in water and out of water. I was able to get some great pictures while we were snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: Great photos for a great price.
Reviews.Author: M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This camera did exactly what we needed it to do - took pictures in and around the water.  Bought it for a cruise (at a cheaper price I guess because the yellow isn't as popular as other colors) and used it in the pools, parasailing, snorkeling, and on and around the beach.  We had no issues with the battery or compartments opening and the pictures were as good as any normal digital camera we've had.  It was definitely worth the price as compared to buying the disposable waterproof cameras and then paying for developing, and we got hundreds more shots to choose from.  I'm sure there are higher quality cameras out there but for the price this one couldn't be beat!

Reviews.Title: Not so waterproof
Reviews.Author: dtchamps
Reviews.Content: This is a decent camera to take hiking without having to worry about dropping it or getting it dirty--mostly because of the price. It took decent pictures for a ~$90 camera with no optical zoom and, even if it wasn't as durable as it looked, it wouldn't be a big loss if it got damaged. When I finally tried to take it snorkeling, water got inside the camera body and ruined it. I returned it for a refund and did not buy another, mostly because the price went up. If it were actually waterproof, it would be a good buy, but since you risk turning it into a paperweight by getting it wet, it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Fair product
Reviews.Author: Steve Pulliam
Reviews.Content: Product takes decent pictures of landscapes but only has a digital zoom, which is useless. It is waterproof, as claimed.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Amy K.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 9 year old to use on our vacation to Florida.  I am amazed by the quality of the underwater pictures it takes.  He even used it in the ocean, the pool and then on the beach.  All in the same day!  6 months later the camera is still working like the day we bought it!  Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Water damage on first use
Reviews.Author: Vicki09
Reviews.Content: The first time I used it, it took a couple of pictures inside the pool, before taking in water and shutting off. It continued to work after drying off, but not a waterproof camera... Very disappointed

Reviews.Title: Camera Audio
Reviews.Author: Maria Polanco
Reviews.Content: Very good camera i love everything about it, except for the fact that it doesn't record audio. Maybe it does and i just haven't found out how to set it to record audio.

Reviews.Title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!
Reviews.Author: C. E. Stevens
Reviews.Content: I had a "feeling" after reading a number of the reviews but thought "everything else I have that's Kodak has been good".... poor decision making on my part. The camera, that was a Christmas present for my wife, took great pictures when it arrived. 12 mega's are a decent looking picture. We live in Hawaii, I know that's the tough part, and travel a lot taking pictures of the North Shore, Napali Coast (on Kauai) and other out of the way locations. We go to Hanauma Bay and relax on a regular basis. Have taken thousands of pictures and wanted some water shots for our childrens scrapbooks. The camera lasted 1 minute wet, took 2 pictures and then died. NOTHING has awakened this camera, new batteries don't work and the laying on of hands has also been unsuccessful. This camera is a bust. I should have ponied up the extra money and gotten something "real". If your going on vacation and need something that will do what you need my advice is buy something else. Don't ruin your trip with something that doesn't work. Don't buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof digital camera
Reviews.Author: bujo
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent sport camera. We take it on lengthy bicycle trips (multi-day) where rain is a distinct likelihood without worrying about the camera being damaged. We can also use it in the pool to take pictures of the kids. It does not perform well in low light situations, but what do you expect for that price? The pictures are  very clear and the controls are very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: For rainy trips
Reviews.Author: QuellyEnvi
Reviews.Content: Had to return the camera. Amazon's service was quick and helpful for return. The camera took over-exposed pictures. Using the auto and the sunlight settings, pictures were WAY too bright. Not sure if the setting was off, but after days of pictures in a mixture of situations I noticed low quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Mal articulo
Reviews.Author: Noraima M. Robles V "Noraima"
Reviews.Content: El articulo fue utilizado 1 sola vez bajo el agua, la camara de apago y no prendio mas. Quiero comunicarme con el vendedor para devolver el articulo!!!!

Reviews.Title: Kodak is great
Reviews.Author: Wayne B. Hodges "WBH"
Reviews.Content: Being a Kodak user in past years it was great to have the opportunity to purchase this Kodak Digital camera.

Reviews.Title: worked well
Reviews.Author: Lee F
Reviews.Content: didn't do too bad,  we took about 100 pictures,  25 on land and 75 underwater.  we need more practice. for the price it was right for us.

Reviews.Title: Buying another one!!
Reviews.Author: Sprinkle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few years ago and I can honestly say it survived everything! It was used in the rain, the pool, the beach, the creek,jacuzzi, camping,dry photos/videos, wet photos/videos. It's been used, thrown, dropped, left outside, you name it.It has been used by the entire family, from my 8 year old son (he was about 5 when purchased) to his grandmother and we are happy with the quality of this camera. I have owned $300 Kodak cameras that I did not like and returned to the store shortly after purchasing them. So to say that we like this camera and used it several times a week is a GOOD THING! The only problem I had with this camera is one day I removed the SD card and when I tried to put it back, it wouldn't stay down. Apparently the spring, well, sprung lol

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Linda Clark
Reviews.Content: Don't usually write reviews, but that is not fair because I rely on other product reviews so I decided to write this one.  I purchased for my 8 yr old grandson.  Thought it would be a good choice for a beginner, and I am no pro.  I tried hard to make be all that it could be and not return it.  Did not want grandson to be disappointed.  Unfortunately unable to keep this product.  LCD screen displays a very dark image, photos are grainy,  Mut to m regret force to return.

Reviews.Title: for my younger son who is hard on stuff
Reviews.Author: Marjorie W. Dunaway "MarjD"
Reviews.Content: Got it hoping it will hold up under tough weather conditions.  Seems to be working well, easy to use.  But my 11yr old doesn't play w cameras as much as his older brother. I like using AA batteries instead of proprietary ones that need special recharging units to drag around.  We use rechargeable Eneloops in this and they are working fine but I can get AA's anywhere.  I'm a little bummed that Kodak is on the ropes so we bought the square Trade warranty just in case there is no Kodak to run to if/when we need help.  But so far working well. Nice size and nice price.  I like the bright color - easier to find under the couch, behind the TV or where ever an 11 yo "loses" it next.....

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Hbromy
Reviews.Content: It takes REALLY good pictures! M super satisfiead and super glad I bought it! If anyone is looking for a nice camera not just for under water, this IS it!!!!

Reviews.Title: nice nice
Reviews.Author: HECTORBRITO
Reviews.Content: thank you very much i love this product i recommended a 100% to everyone, its very good and you can buy.

Reviews.Title: Terrible quality pictures...
Reviews.Author: D. Dunigan-Breen
Reviews.Content: I have never seen such terrible quality pictures from a camera...EVER!I bought this camera because I like to travel and take many trips throughout the year where a portable camera that is also waterproof would be very handy.I took it for a test run at an event that I attended this weekend...I noticed that when looking at the pictures on the screen they all looked pixelated and grainy, but I assumed it would be better when they were actually uploaded though and that they just had a terrible screen. No love. I didn't think it possible, but they look even worse after uploading them! I truly have no idea how a camera that is 14 MP could even possibly be this bad. No exaggeration. I wish I could upload them to show you how awful...but I guess you will have to take my word for it that it is so bad I wish I had a disposable on me that day weekend instead, cause they would have been infinitely better quality. I'm very bummed.

Reviews.Title: unbelievable for the low $$$$
Reviews.Author: Dragoslav T. Marcovich
Reviews.Content: decent camera to carry along all the time; nice underwater pictures, decent 'land' pictures, easy to use, easy to manipulate the pictures on the PC.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Jose Saldaña
Reviews.Content: everithing was ok I am agree whith this product .. . . . .  . . . . . . . . .

Reviews.Title: Happy then sad
Reviews.Author: Ramaju "Ramaju"
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the camera... the first time we tried in the pool it was excellent but in the second the camera had some leaking.. so the 3rd time it allowed to take 3 or 4 pictures before it leaked again.. now is being use not as a pool camera but as normal camera...

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: DarcieMae1121
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my boyfriend for a Christmas present and he LOVED it. We used it in the summer. The video and photos are perfect and the quality is unbelievable. I would definitely suggest this to anyone who has a pool. We even used it at the beach and it was still perfect!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa Bain
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for water play!  I was only disappointed in the display not being very visible.  It also sinks very quickly in water so be sure to have something attached that helps it float.

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: WyoSoldier
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a trip to Nepal. The camera functioned fine but the quality of the pictures and videos was low at best. I guess I should have had this as a backup camera and not my primary.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Edward Littrell
Reviews.Content: Not  a professional camera by any means, but it did exactly what it said it would and I am very happy with this purchase. The camera takes great land pictures and decent underwater pictures. I would recommend this camera to anyone that will use it for both applications.

Reviews.Title: This camera worked for one day. What do i do now? Should i return it.
Reviews.Author: Marion T Andrews
Reviews.Content: It stopped working after. The first day. Where do i send it to return it? It was a gift for my grandson.

Reviews.Title: Gave this camera as a gift
Reviews.Author: Nancy Neeks
Reviews.Content: We  gave our granddaughter this camera.  She loves it.  It takes nice clear underwater photos.  Great underwater camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: exelent
Reviews.Author: ldgo357
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy whith this product, have all things that I was waiting and Consider is cheaper than other!high quality of material and strong construcction, recomended 100%

Reviews.Title: I don't recommend
Reviews.Author: James R. Hooks
Reviews.Content: In the course of holding on to it while snorkling the battery door opened. I read that was a problem, but on dry land it didn't seem like it would be. It was. Lost all my vacation pictures except what I got with my "backup"...a throwaway underwater camera. Up until the battery door loosened it seemed to be working great, but I don't think it's worth the risk for underwater shots. Maybe in the rain or something like that.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Victoria Peñalver Salazar
Reviews.Content: It is a very good camera. Take greats photos of course not  a super quality. I lost one and then I bought the same camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Country Colie
Reviews.Content: I gave one to my son for Chrismas and he had a lot of fun photographing under water the following summer!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Valerie Richmond
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our daughter as an Easter gift.  It is very durable and the perfect size for young hands.  (She was four at the time.)  It was easy for her to figure out the settings she needs and takes good quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: Hector C. Jones
Reviews.Content: You can’t beat the price tag on this camera. I purchased it based upon the video reviews and the lower price compared to other models. So far, I’ve only taken it in the pool and a short snorkeling trip and I have been completely satisfied by it’s performance. I like the fact that the underwater video really captures the moment by also recording sounds underwater. It gives you a genuine feeling of being submerged…cool stuff.The functions of the camera are incredibly basic. No bells and whistles here; so if advanced functions are what you’re looking for, this is not the camera for you. I like the fact that the media is SD Card. This makes it extremely easy to transfer pictures to a computer. Lastly, while researching I found that the same camera was listed at different prices based upon the color…interesting. I guess nobody likes red cameras. I, however, am enjoying my inexpensive red camera.

Reviews.Title: en el texto
Reviews.Author: alejandra rodriguez yanez
Reviews.Content: exelente producto, funciona muy bien, pienso comprar otra, gracias por estar pendiente de las compras que se realizan por esta pagina

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera... for outdoor daytime activities...
Reviews.Author: C.C.
Reviews.Content: This is not a good camera for night time, but for day time and outdoor activities it couldn't be more perfect! The underwater shots couldn't be more clear, and in a lot of sunlight the out of water shots are great too. If you try to use it for night time the pics get really grainy and it doesn't like to focus in the dark. But for being a waterproof camera, totally awesome for the price! All my friends and family are jealous!

Reviews.Title: like it
Reviews.Author: Oleg Sukharenko "soleg67"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daughter 14th BD after fail attempt with Fuji XP170. This one is twice cheaper and twice better quality under water and above.

Reviews.Title: Decent little waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: tonia
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter to take pics at the river.. it works well and she is happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Easy Share Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian J. Douglas
Reviews.Content: Worked great for a short time until the little battery door broke making it not water proof any more. It would be nice to be able to send it back.

Reviews.Title: works good underwater
Reviews.Author: Lori Dittman
Reviews.Content: This camera has been a lot of fun for my son, as he has taken some good underwater pictures while spear fishing. the trade off is that he doesn't think it takes that high quality of regular pictures.

Reviews.Title: quick service impressive
Reviews.Author: pamela sue fuller
Reviews.Content: the kodak waterproof camera arrived early than expected and was just what I  ordered. the service meet all of my expectations

Reviews.Title: Easy breezy
Reviews.Author: Jessalyn Rogers
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, easy to share.Kodak is known for not over complicating their devices. I do wish it had image stabilization built in, but it is a beginners camera. I do like the fact that it's only $120 and I'm not worried about taking my high dollar camera on the boat with wet kids.

Reviews.Title: evaluacion inicial
Reviews.Author: Freddy Rivera
Reviews.Content: es un excelente producto facil de manejar y muy completo excelente funcionalidad compacto completopractico excelentes tomas nocturnas con flash o sin el

Reviews.Title: Great little action camera
Reviews.Author: RPD
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, I've owned multiple Kodak point-and-shoot cameras over the years and picked up this Sport C123 for my girlfriend. Underwater photos look awesome and it even takes video too. It's a durable camera with good battery life, a high-resolution screen, and cool share functions. Awesome job Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Marcus Twin
Reviews.Content: takes terrific pictures underwater on snorkeling and minor dives.  Also handy for beach use where the regular cameras are at risk.

Reviews.Title: Nice and useful option
Reviews.Author: Maged
Reviews.Content: i really liked this camera, used it under water snorkeling in the red sea, and also very nice as family camera for trips.

Reviews.Title: EasyShare never disappoints
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: This camera works perfect, and Kodak's software is so "easy" to use. The camera works great in the pool and the function buttons are also "easy" to use. The only draw back is you have to change batteries. We wish it was rechargeable.

Reviews.Title: Best buy ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Good quality, best camera in that price range..worked out great for night snorkeling, awesome video. Hard to see in screen when your taking pics or video. But you learn how to make it out pictures. I will buy this camera again. No leaks, easy to use underwater. No batteries issues, they got swapped out every morning, camera never died. Go for good batteries, not cheap ones.

Reviews.Title: bien
Reviews.Author: Rainjor
Reviews.Content: muy bueno el producto que compre por este medio me a resultado de gran utilidad y recomiendo el vendedor ampliamente gracias por ser tan puntual y por la calidad de producto!!! lo recomiendo ampliamente!!!

Reviews.Title: Bought this a year ago... but it has doubled in price???
Reviews.Author: Lillie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago and loved it. It was a nice camera, could go underwater, and was fantastic for the price (which was $50). I decided I wanted to buy another this year as a gift for someone and searched through my order history to get the same product. I found it... but a year later Amazon has DOUBLED the price on the item? Usually electronics decrease in price as newer versions become available. What is with the price inflation?I was willing to buy this product at the price that it was a year ago. I'll have to think about it now that it is double.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen L. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I am glad I purchased this camera: it was refurbushed and is every bite as good as new. Small but creates excellent pictures and although I don't plan on doing any underwater shots its great to have a waterproof camera when doing field surveys for Architechture in the rain.

Reviews.Title: For an "Easy Share" camera, this is the most difficult digital camera I've owned.
Reviews.Author: DO'D
Reviews.Content: Photos are decent for a camera. But you know, you'd think a guy with a graduate degree in computers could figure out how to run this camera. My biggest gripe is the download software .. which you are forced to use (no direct access to the memory as a remote device on your computer .. ). And the operation on the camera itself? If an EASY SHARE camera requires spending time w/ the user manual just to figure out how to delete photos, it's tooooo complicated.I've had this thing a year. Use it for kayaking. After the latest round of frustration of trying to download, then delete photos, I decided, enough is enough. I'm giving up on this thing and getting something easier to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: kenflys
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take to Australia and use snorkeling the Great Barrier Reef.  Worked as advertised.  Had to remember to set it to underwater after turning it on in the water.  Pics were good.

Reviews.Title: Short battery life - esp in water!
Reviews.Author: mqo001 "mqo001"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for snorkeling purposes.  The camera works ok...pictures usually turn out better than they appear on the screen on the camera.  The screen itself is heavily pixelated and generally doesn't do the pictures justice.  Pictures taken in air turn out much better than those underwater, but being able to take pics underwater at all at this price is pretty cool.  My biggest complaint is the short battery life.  We have yet to get through an entire snorkeling venture without killing the batteries...usually after 20 pictures or so.  We have tried everything we can think of to conserve the batteries and still no luck.  Also, the camera often seems to think the batteries are low underwater and will shut down only to come up and find out the batteries still have 50% of their life left.  Overall, for the price, it's not terrible, but it's not anywhere near as amazing as I was hoping.

Reviews.Title: Not so easy...easyshare.
Reviews.Author: AmazonFan
Reviews.Content: I never review products so that should say something....I bought this for my daughter's birthday.  She used it for 2 days and it has stopped working.  When I called Kodak "customer service"...they kept telling me to change the batteries.  When I told them I had changed them they would again tell me to make sure I changed the batteries.  Then they went to check and told me I needed to purchase rechargeable batteries and a charger. The box shows plainly that you can use any "AA" batteries.  I went on to make an additional phone call to customer service again to see if I could get a better operator or more help.....all in vain...Thankfully I shopped with Amazon and Amazon is refunding my $$$...Thank you Amazon...NO THANKS to Kodak...Wish I would have thought twice before wasting my time and $$$...I would definitely look elsewhere for a "waterproof" camera.

Reviews.Title: *Don't bother - this camera is worthless*
Reviews.Author: SMW
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED THIS CAMERA FOR MY HUSBAND FOR HIS BIRTHDAY. HE ONLY USED IT A COUPLE OF TIMES WITH NO PROBLEMS. THIS PAST WEEKEND HE DECIDED TO TAKE IT IN THE POOL AND GET SOME PICTURES OF OUR KIDS - IT FILLED UP WITH WATER AND NOW THE CAMERA IS USELESS AND OF COURSE ITS 2 MONTHS OUT OF WARRANTY. WALMART WOULD NOT REFUND OR EXCHANGE IT AS THEY HAVE A 15 DAY POLICY. I'M IN THE PROCESS OF CONTACTING KODAK TO SEE IF THEY WILL DO ANYTHING. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA - ITS NOT WORTH THE MONEY!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but bad on battery life...
Reviews.Author: Nosila78
Reviews.Content: I love the camera for the on land pictures, and underwater it took good photos, but not as clear as I was expecting. Also it drained the battery life quickly for the underwater setting...actually right in the middle of snorkeling. Make sure you have plenty of AA batteries around if you intend to shoot a lot of photos with this camera. For the price I am not really complaining, but I was frustrated that I underestimated how long the batteries would last.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: BoyscoutMamaw
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price!I got it for my grandson for Scouts...he loves it! good pictures, good even in the pool!

Reviews.Title: I use this camera all the time and LOVE it!!!
Reviews.Author: Cassandra Mantyla "Working Mom"
Reviews.Content: My sister lives in Hawaii and I've used this camera on 2 of my trips to Hawaii. I also have used it snorkeling in the Bahamas, St. Thomas and St. Maarten. It's a terrific camera for the price. I love that it takes both video and pictures. It has an auto mode and an underwater mode. I noticed when I was in Hawaii snorkeling that if the water is clear and it's bright outside it's best to use the normal auto mode than the underwater mode. My sister has a $500 underwater camera and I'd say our pictures turned out the same on my camera vs. hers. So for $120 bucks, buy this Kodak! I love this camera so much I take it with me everywhere. I even use it at the pool and sprayground with my son. I use it as an everyday point and shoot as well.

Reviews.Title: Try and find a better camera for the $, you won't.
Reviews.Author: wyleone
Reviews.Content: I have purchased one of these for my daughter three two and half years ago when they came out. I bought myself one just over two years ago. Let me say without reading one review here that this camera is worth every penny. I have snorkled in Destin, FL in salt water, I have gone on backpacking trip up the Pinhoti trail and Appalachian trail. I have kayaked and abused this camera. Every time I use it, I expect to see it failed, but no, still going. I have gone from in 100F temps to 50F water, still going. Mind you, I will kill this camera, but before it happens, it has taken some awesome pics in some extreme environments. It has beat against my kayak while being dragged through the water because it fell out and was hanging by it's lanyard.The only limitation, the camera hardware. It is slow to cycle and write to the SD. Trust me, you will have to spend double the money to get a better camera. I use Ultimate lithium batteries in it and a Sandisk 8G card.

Reviews.Title: water ruined it!!
Reviews.Author: jbeans
Reviews.Content: My son was thrilled with this birthday gift.  The very first time he got it wet...ruined. So sad to see his disappointment!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: wecamp
Reviews.Content: I am so happy we bought this camera. It stayed dry while in water and took GREAT pictures. I took it on a cruise and used it at the beach and cave tubbing.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Clint
Reviews.Content: We went to Easter Island, and needed an underwater camera.  So I chose this one.  It worked GREAT! Granted, it isn't the greatest camera, but for the money, I am happy. Pictures above water were fine, and so were the ones underwater. Carried it in my swimsuit pocket for 3 weeks, so it took some abuse and did just fine. It spent at least a hundred hours underwater in sandy and non-sandy environments and never had an issue. I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Great until it quit working
Reviews.Author: kimonacharlie "POP-POP"
Reviews.Content: Loved it until disaster struck...really expected more from a Kodak product....I guess this was my Kodak Moment.  It took some beautiful photos underwater in our pool.  I noticed water seepage in the battery compartment today after it quit.

Reviews.Title: Good for less than $100
Reviews.Author: digicam "digicam"
Reviews.Content: Took this to the pool to test it out, it actually took fairly good pictures.  The video is 640 x 480, but it looks fairly decent.  Had no issues with leaking, feels pretty sturdy.  I can see how this thing would chew through the batteries, there is no typical viewfinder, just a digital display, so when using, need to be aware of getting the picture/video and then, if not using, turn off.  The stills were actually pretty good, and as one other reviewer noted, the underwater flash really makes a difference.  I bought this for an upcoming trip to St. Thomas, and after testing it out, based on the quality of pictures and video I am seeing, I am fairly confident it will meet my needs.  Would I pay more than $100 for this - no, but at $100 or less, I call it a fair deal.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful deal
Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: I almost didnt buy this camera since there were quite a few mixed reviews, but I am so glad I did! I purchased it with a 2 year warranty just in case, but this has been a fantastic camera. I bought it specially for my trip to Jamaica and it survived hours in a pool, horseback riding in the ocean, ziplining, river tubing, climbing a waterfall, and snorkling and it still works great! Many people said theirs stopped working after the 1st time in the water, but mine was submerged hours at a time and I dont think Ill be needing that warranty! Great camera for the money!

Reviews.Title: ok, camera - problems connecting and retriving photos
Reviews.Author: Victoria M "Victoria"
Reviews.Content: The camera itself was ok, but when I tried to connect the camera to my computer, it kept connecting and dropping the connection. AND IN THE PROCESS IT DELETED ALL OF MY PHOTOS. SO DON'T CHANCE IT - GET THE CANNON INSTEAD. So angry right now. Pics are gone, and then I even tried to install their software, which I don't want, to try and get my pictures back and that didn't work, and they require you to register. So you can no register, and then it doesn't connect right, and you lose your pictures, or you can give them personal information just to run software that you've already paid for. KEEP LOOKING OR RISK LOSING ALL YOUR PHOTOS!! CAMERA CONNECTIONS ARE GLITCHY!

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera for water
Reviews.Author: Dale C. Voon "Dale Voon"
Reviews.Content: The camera is water resistant (splash of water now and then), but not waterproof. Water got in and moisture build around the lens after using it the second day. Very dissappointed, waste of money.

Reviews.Title: water
Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: I first bought this camera in grey and it was great. I took it to noah's ark, swim meets, the pool everyday until the orange battery door broke. It closed ok but when i took it to the kalahari water got inside of it. I contacted amazon and kodak but they would not fix it since it was out of warranty (I had it from July to September). But I loved it so much I bought a second one in red. I took it to California to use it first and it was great for the first week, but then water got in it. I contacted Kodak and I mailed it in and they fixed it. I didn't use it again in water until June where it again got water in it in the first week. I'm now going to mail it back and have them fix it but it is a frustrating camera.

Reviews.Title: like
Reviews.Author: nicky
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 12 year old daughter. She loves it. She has had it in the pool several times and it works well.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Kendal
Reviews.Content: So far this camera has went above and beyond my expectations. It takes amazing pictures in and out of the water. I have used this camera mainly for floating trips on the river and it's great not having to worry about it getting wet. It's very east to use and I couldn't be happier with the camera, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent price for an excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Kimberly B.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a class to San Salvador a few weeks ago. From the start, I had been worried about leakage, since that seemed to be the problem most people had. From the start, it took wonderful pictures, and while I was concerned about taking it into the water for the first time, it worked beautifully. It took almost everything I could throw at it and more, as we went in and out of coral reefs, with me accidentally running into rocks with it, and a cave that had natural sulfur in it.The only problem I did have was in the cave, when the camera froze twice for about two minutes apiece. The first time, I did not take any pictures, the second time, someone else had my camera and took some without realizing it was frozen. It took the pictures, but they were black with dots on it-what the camera screen had frozen at.I was not overly careful with the camera, feeling that if the camera died the last day of the trip, it was $100 well spent. I got over 600 pictures, and backed them up each night as a precaution.The battery compartment never leaked, not even a drop, and I was thrilled with the quality of the camera for the price. Other people on the trip bought $300 and upward cameras, and they did not perform half as well as this one did. Well worth the buy!

Reviews.Title: Did the job superbly!!!
Reviews.Author: M. Torres "Massy"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera at the last minute for my trip to the Bahamas! I needed something waterproof to avoid leaving it behind. This camera took great pictures both in and out of the water!!!!  My only concern was it needs AA batteries, so you have to carry extra batteries whereever it goes to ensure you don't miss a beat!  Otherwise it was a great purchase and I couldn't be happier with the memories captured!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: svgal
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in October and have used it multiple times on the two cruises that we have taken. I wanted a camera that was waterproof to take with me snorkeling or tubing.  My snorkeling pictures turned out great. Considering the currents were up and the water wasn't as clear as normal, the pictures are clear and you can see some of the detail in the coral.  We took the camera out into the water at various beaches and the pictures were clear. The edges of some of the items were a little sharp, but other than that I really have had no real complaints.  We took pictures during cave tubing using the flash and I was shocked at how good some of the pictures were.  The camera got soaked in mud while doing an offroad xtrails adventure, and still took great pictures.  My only real complaint is the screen. You can't tell what you are taking pictures of half of the time.  In sunlight or underwater, it is hard to see the screen.  The camera is not the best point and shoot I own. I would definitely use my DSLR or one of my other point and shoots for normal picture taking, but it really exceeded my expectations for an underwater camera.  The camera was an awesome deal!

Reviews.Title: Broke the first day
Reviews.Author: Kristen B Vickery
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera for a christmas gift and it broke the same day it was opened.  Tried resetting the camera several times and could never get it to work.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: OK ONLY FOR PICTURES
Reviews.Author: Slappy Blanco "you betcha"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to have fun in the pool, but it takes OK photos. It wasn't HD or anything, but the video does not work! When you try to upload it on a MAC it shows a complete grey screen and has really bad audio. I tried using it outside of water, and there were lines running through the picture. The audio is TERRIBLE. It's grainy, the video is blurry. Waste of money if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: Not great
Reviews.Author: Tgfran
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so we could take pictures while snorkling in Hawaii. When the sun shines you cannot see the screen thus cannot see what you are trying to take a picture of. The same thing happens underwater. I definitely would not have bought it if I had know this.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Angeleyes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son. We went to Jamaica snorkeling this camera was GREAT. I had a Nikon L110 and it got broke the 2nd day we were there. I was so pleased with this Kodak camera that I would like to get another one. The only thing i wish is that it had a bigger zoom. Other than that this was an awesome camera!!! I would definitely recommend this camera!!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Find
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: I found this item in the clearance bin at my local Target. It was ordered online but the person returned without even opening the package. I purchased for $30! Just got back from a cruise to the Cayman Islands.  The camera worked extremely well. I thought maybe it was a $50 camera since I got it so inexpensively.  I just came on Amazon to see what it sells for. Now I understand the great quality. It worked well in, under and above water. Remember to change the setting when you go underwater. Easy to use.  We will be using it this summer for kayaking outings. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy share Sport underwater camera
Reviews.Author: R. B. Crawford
Reviews.Content: Very good photos, fairly easy to use, well-made and "right price".  Came with computer cable and clear instructions for use.  Only fault is did not come with TV cable so cannot view on TV or make a copy via TV only.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Margarita
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my 14 year old daughter in June 2011 and it hasn't even last a full year before breaking. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Chris Stephens
Reviews.Content: Although my trip to Jamaica is months away and I haven't used it under water yet, it takes great photos otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Nice and fine built camera
Reviews.Author: I. Safner "AMD fan"
Reviews.Content: We bought this 2 month ago. So far it's working fine, very good image quality both day and low light. Still did not try it underwater.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: Paul

var cv_moUHO45203BHSCpreplay = document.getElementById('cv_moUHO45203BHSCpreplayImageId'); if (cv_moUHO45203BHSCpreplay) { cv_moUHO45203BHSCpreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_moUHO45203BHSCpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51T-Yom%2BWpS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_moUHO45203BHSCpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_moUHO45203BHSCpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51T-Yom%2BWpS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_moUHO45203BHSCpreplay.parentNode; var cv_moUHO45203BHSCcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moUHO45203BHSCcurrentClick) { return cv_moUHO45203BHSCcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:12 MinsI bought this camera for a trip to The Keys for $60. The picture and video quality is good, as you can see in the video(Note: The water was a little foggy). My only problem with this camera is that when I uploaded the content onto my computer, I was unable to view some pictures and videos. I don't know if it's my computers fault or the camera, but either way it's a bit of a problem. The paint on the camera also chipped very easily. But for 60 bucks, it's a good camera.

Reviews.Title: NOT waterproof
Reviews.Author: Angie Maher
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a cruise and the different water excursions we were going to have. The camera worked great out of the water, but the first time we used it in the water after 3 pictures it shut down. I thought it was the batteries running out, so I got out of the water and went to change the batteries and when I opened up the camera water poured out! I was pretty quick at pulling the SD card out so only one picture was lost. But the camera is completely ruined. We were only in 3 feet of water.Not a happy experience at all. We ended up having to purchase another camera on the ship since this was only the first day of our cruise.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: whydoesitmatter
Reviews.Content: The camera was priced well. I got a floating strap, but not from Kodak. It was a little too waterproof for my use. The best part about this camera is that it takes actual batteries. I found a better price for it on sears.com, but they were having a sale on it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera & video recorder
Reviews.Author: Love2talktravel
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best purchases I've ever made. For the price we were just hoping it would work and some pictures would come out. The pictures all came out great, and we were surprised at how well the video worked - and there was even sound recorded underwater! You can hear the waves crashing and bubbles from snorkeling. The camera worked so well it became the only camera we used on a recent vacation. I agree with the other reviewers that the viewing screen is small and difficult to see when underwater - but for the price it was worth it. I would suggest setting it on a wider zoom so you do not miss anything. Be sure to bring lots of extra batteries - you'll be surprise day how much you will use it - we kept reviewing our pictures and videos which used up a lot of the battery. Also make sure you take time to look at the controls before using underwater - they are simple to use, but when underwater you do not want to be trying to figure them out underwater and miss a great picture. Be sure to set it to "underwater" before going underwater too. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: concerned "car guy"
Reviews.Content: I liked the camera until I took it snorkeling.  The battery door was locked, which is the only way it will stay closed, and the outside door was also locked, which again is the only way it will stay closed.  BUT after ten minutes snorkeling the camera stopped working, water was in the battery compartment.  Not quite sure what the warranty is at this point, since I purchased it 5 months ago.

Reviews.Title: this camera does it job
Reviews.Author: jknnur
Reviews.Content: This camera does what it says it will do but do not expect professional photos from this little,cheap device.The photos are grainy and somewhat unfocused but this could be from operator error.Otherwise,it takes ok pics for the price.I bought it for my father to take out on the boat(camera supposed to be water resistant/waterproof)to take pics of fish that he caught.I really dont expect this camera to be able to take pics @ 20ft below the surface but would expect it to get damp and still fuction,which it has done.He loves it so I am happy.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kid at Heart
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these cameras for a trip to the Virgin Islands.  We've always used the disposable underwater cameras and had terrible photos.  I wanted a digital underwater for snorkeling, but didn't want to spend a lot.  These were perfect.  I never had any trouble with water getting inside.  We got some great photos, and of course with digital it was no big deal that we took a lot of not so great photos.  All together we took over 800 photos between the two.  It also takes pretty good out of the water photos & video clips.  I only changed the batteries once or twice in 10 days.  I rinsed the cameras off at the end of the day and dried them overnight, but other than that, nothing else special.  You do need to wipe off the lense after using underwater before you use out of the water.  Can't beat the price either!  The only downside is that every time it powers off it reverts to Auto mode and was a little difficult to switch to H2O still mode while looking through a mask underwater, but I got used to it.  I even got to where I could use the optical zoom to catch those cool bottom dwellers.  I got a great shot of a spiny Carribean lobster sitting on the ocean floor.  Never would have seen it in a photo from a disposable.  I'm very glad I got these cameras!

Reviews.Title: Worth Getting
Reviews.Author: ar.mtz24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently used this on a vacation where we did a lot of snorkeling and it worked great. We purposely dropped the camera and it floated right back up. Also, the product will work on any waterproof camera, not just kodak. My only grief was the length of the cord. When you have it on your wrist it isn't long enough to hold the camera in the other hand without having both in front of you.A note for those with smaller wrists or kids: It works fine for adults/larger wrists but if you have a smaller wrist or had planned to let your kids use it, it probably wont work. The part that tightens around your arm does not tighten very far and would most definetly slip right off a childs wrist.

Reviews.Title: Good Photos, Great Price for a Small Camera
Reviews.Author: Allen
Reviews.Content: It's too bad Kodak has filed for bankruptcy and is selling off the camera unit, because this is a good little camera. I volunteer doing hiking trail maintenance and this camera is a tough little dude. It's been rained on, covered in dust, abused, and it keeps on taking pictures. Got rid of my more expensive camera and just use this one. When you set it up you can choose to use the Kodak Easyshare software or just download photos to your PC's photo software. Macro photos is good as I take close up photos of needed bridge repairs. I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Cami
Reviews.Content: I got my camera today & I couldn't be happier. I was thinking of taking this Kodak Waterproof Camera & my regular 14MP Camera to my trip. It turns out I may just be taking this camera...There is no need to take two cameras. I thought I may need to take two cameras to my trip because I was concerned about the quality of pictures with this waterproof camera.  I have taken pictures today in different lighting, of my dogs running & I am so happy at how clear the pictures are. I have not tried the waterproof aspect of it yet. But so far I am so happy with the pictures quality specially because of the low price. :)

Reviews.Title: Great pictures & videos, handy and fairly easy to use
Reviews.Author: C. Bauman "bauman171"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera primarily to use on a family vacation to the Caribbean.  Mostly, I was looking for an relatively inexpensive camera with underwater picture capability that was also compact, for use when I didn't want to carry around my DSLR.  The Kodak C123 Sport seemed to fit the bill.The camera uses an SD memory card (1 1/4" X 7/8" with a corner that appears dog-eared), and I would recommend at least a couple gigs because of the camera's 12 megapix.**This camera doesn't have a rechargable battery; 2 AA batteries are needed and if you intend to keep the camera ready for spontaneous pictures, make sure you have backups because standard batteries (as opposed to rechargable AA batteries) don't last terribly long. I was disappointed to have to swim back to shore for fresh batteries on two different occasions.  I would guesstimate that a set of batteries lasts maybe 2 or 3 hours.Another consideration for underwater photography- when you turn the camera off and then turn it back on, the camera automatically defaults back to factory settings.  This means that if you have the camera set for underwater photographs and then turn the camera off, when you turn it back on you will have to go to the menu and select underwater photography and then choose either picture or video before taking pictures.  I haven't been able to figure out a way to change the default, but the quality of the photograph(s) improves when the underwater setting is used underwater (I suppose it compensates for the way water refracts light).  On a similar note, pictures that are taken within 30 to 45 minutes of getting out of the water may turn out a bit fuzzy.**On the other hand, this camera is compact, fairly easy to use and takes very clear photographs and videos both in and out of the water.  Occasionally my snorkel mask would fog up, making it difficult to see the camera display.  But in clear water on a sunny day, the pictures came out beautifully.  I (accidentally) took a couple of very short underwater videos when I couldn't clearly see the camera display to see that I selected video over picture, but those videos came out beautifully as well.The floaty armband is also handy, adjustable and serves its purpose well.I cannot comment on the Kodak Share program that comes with the camera, as I haven't had any interest in using it thus far.Anyone considering this camera that would like to see a few examples of underwater pictures can contact me at CBauman@hotmail.com.  Put Kodak Sport C123 in the subject line so I know it's not spam.  I usually check that email address about once or twice a week.

Reviews.Title: Fun concept, poor quality
Reviews.Author: L
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace an old underwater digital camera (not the same brand).  I was looking for cheap because that's what college kids do, and I found it.  Don't get me wrong, the camera does all that it says it will do, but just barely skim by.  It goes underwater, and I'm not afraid to take it on any of my outdoor adventures.  But if you decide you'd like to zoom in on anything, you'd better find a different camera.  The images are immediately pixelated when zoomed in at any magnification.  The different settings make a little bit of a difference, but nothing profound.  I was hoping for a few more capabilities (such as magnification or more manipulation with exposure), but I keep reminding myself what I payed for it and then I feel better. :)Like I said, I love taking it out in the kayak or swimming in a lake- no worries and it makes for fun memories.  I'd equate it with the film disposable camera.  But I'll probably bite the bullet and find a more quality camera for my more advanced photography needs.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare c123
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: This camera has been good so far. I thought that it is easy to use I had gotten this for a college project, but the instructions that come with the camera are very clear. The batteries died in two weeks that I HAD NO IDEA WOULD HAPPEN BUT OTHER THAN THAT GOOD.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: Gray Horse
Reviews.Content: In need of a waterproof digital camera for a planned river trip, some dreary reviews of major brands were disappointing.  Eventually, I found this Kodak, the price was right, so I ordered one. Shipping and delivery from Amazon was prompt, and I immediately took it into the shower to try it.  Interesting photos.  The camea worked fine, stayed dry inside, and functioned well.Next outside, and the viewscreen seemed pretty bright in the sun, important when on a river.All photos are well exposed and focused, and are pleasing to me.I'd suggest one pay attention to insuring the two and interconnected battery and SD card covers are properly and completely closed, and leakage should not be a problem.I'm looking forward to taking the camera down the Colorado soon.One item I'd like to see is an optical viewfinder--always nice to have to use when needed.  Lose one point for that lack of feature, as well as no owner's manual.  Going to the website and printing out separate pages for every function must use way more paper than a smaller manual would have.  No saving trees in doing that.Main points in favor:Koday name, reputation (but with Chapter 11 looming, better get one sooner rather than later).AA batteries, not a proprietary type (difficult to recharge batteries on the Colorado).SD card.Handy, pocket size.Price is way better than major bands.Incidently, skip the blue camera case offered as a package--it's too small, and can't be zipped closed with the camera inside, let alone with any room for the wrist strap and a spare SD card.

Reviews.Title: Don't think, just get it!
Reviews.Author: M. moore "M. moore"
Reviews.Content: As a photographer I need to take pictures of everything, that includes when I'm in the water. The Kodak Easy Share C123 on paper looks like a disaster when compared to the point and shoots out now.  12 megapixel, 640 x 480 video, slow as molasses.  I assure you though, you will have more fun with the camera and come hope with more fun pictures and videos than you will with any of your other cameras.First off the Kodak Easy Share C123 WILL NOT replace your DSLR or you $250 Cyber Shot. What it will do is let you capture those moments where you wouldn't dare take your other cameras.I recently went to a trip at a water park and brought my new Kodak with me to finally test it out. It's slow, you're not going to fire off pictures one after another but that's ok. About 75% of my photos were usable. It almost always wants to use the flash and when I got close enough it would do a great job of lighting the scene and in most cases the photos were sharp with almost no noise. Remember the are pictures under water and in a pool. The video was fantastic. Very well lit, the audio is very fun to listen to while underwater. The resolution isn't HD but for what it was the quality exceeded my expectations.For $90 it's a no brainier. I bought two incase I ever break this one because Kodak is not making digital consumer cameras anymore.It was in my pocket all day under water and it was fine. The battery/SD card comparent had a lock so you can't accidentally slide it open.Do yourself a favor and get it, it will be the most fun you've had with a camera in a long long time!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Sport
Reviews.Author: CCR
Reviews.Content: Arrived just in time for our Bobaire trip. Camera worked great, took many great underwater pictures and was very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Took 8 pictures - then died!!
Reviews.Author: Jeffery
Reviews.Content: Bought for upcoming cruise to Southern Caribbean.  Purchased Float wrist strap so nothing would happen.  Got in the water from stairs on boat (didn't jump in).  Floating on surface of water to watch the sea turtles, turned it on - took 8 pictures and it died. Opened battery compartment when I returned to the ship - bone dry.  Replaced with new batteries just in case but still dead.  Removed the memory card - guess I should be thankful it didn't ruin that.  Stay away from this one!!UPDATE:  I've now had it almost a year and still would rate at zero or a half star at best.  Put lithium batteries in it and it last for 12 pictures before dying.....horrible product!

Reviews.Title: Grat cam!
Reviews.Author: Anastasia Shchadrina
Reviews.Content: WE bought it for our journey where we had to go underwater and this camera made great pictures!!! ^_^Good choice, 5/5 :)

Reviews.Title: Not recommended!
Reviews.Author: Jacque D. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daughter for Christmas.  It has already quit working.  Won't recognize the batteries.  Ridiculous. It worked great at first.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Sport C123 12MP Waterproof Digital camera
Reviews.Author: cferg
Reviews.Content: Like ease of use, size, weight. Easy to operate and understand.  Wanted camera I could take fishing and canoeing without destroying. Seems to fit the bill. Great waterproof camera for the price. Little short on telephoto capability. Little short of what I expected. But photos clear and easy to transfer into computer. Will know more when I fall out of canoe and take photos. I would recommend this item to a friend if he should need an inexpensive waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: Good basic sport camera, but needs image stabilzation
Reviews.Author: C. Graham
Reviews.Content: Took this camera on vacation to the Dominican Republic.  Waterproof was not a problem, as we used it in pools and shallow surf with no problem.  The images were OK, if taken while completely still.  A sport camera really should include image stabilization.  Otherwise, we were very happy with it and hope to use it for at least a few years.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Gailvis "Gailvis"
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded my expectations.  The pictures are great whether using in or out of water.  It is very easy to use.  The pictures underwater are very colorful & clear.  I am very happy with this camera.  It was a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Exceptional quality for something so inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Djboomboom31
Reviews.Content: Like most people on here, I purchased this camera with a specific need in mind. We were going to be going on a cruise in the bahamas and wanted to get a camera we could lug around in our pocket, bring to the beach, snorkel and take some "decent" pictures with. This baby did everything I expected and a bit more.This is no DSLR camera by any stretch of the imagination, but for the purpose of a quick point and shoot, water proof, rugged type camera - this fits the bill nicely.My first pictures were taken outdoors on top of our ship in NY in Feb. So it was pretty gray with very little light.  It seemed to take "ok" pictures. It was pretty hard to tell on the display. So I was basically rolling the dice that they were good. Since I used an 8GB SD card, I made sure to take an ample amount of pictures, so I had plenty to choose from at the end of the trip.Those pictures turned out pretty decent. But the pictures that really turned out good were ones in bright sunlight and the ones I took under water. That was the purpose of us buying the camera. The underwater pictures turned out as good as I could have expected for a camera that cost me 80 bucks. If the water is clear - you will get some good footage.  In our case, there was some cloudiness to the water, so you don't have quite the range of visibility. But that was expected. It was easy to use under water for the most part.  It was kind of hard to see the display under water, but I didn't really use it anyhow. I just held it towards what I wanted to capture and that worked fine for me.After a day at the beach, I just rinsed it off with fresh water, and let it dry. No problems with leaking or such. Everything is sealed nicely. My only complaint would be that it is pretty easy to accidentally open the battery/SD card compartment. So I could see possibly doing it while snorkeling if you aren't careful.Indoor pictures turned out ok. With the flash, it took good pictures in darker settings. With out the flash, you will get alot of noise. It has a few different settings (or Scenes) you can use, but I usually just kept it on Auto, and used the flash when needed. (which you can turn on / off, pre-flash/redeye, or auto)For closeups indoor with the flash, it works good. I think you should take some practice shots before your trip to see what works best in what situations.  I just took a ton of pictures and deleted the ones that didn't look good.To sum it up, I would highly recommend this camera for the purpose of an extra vacation / beach / under water camera. It will not compete on photo quality with some of the other point and shoots out there, and it does have a decent lag after each shot,  but for a waterproof - sub 100$ camera - 12.1 MP, you just can't beat it.And if you can do some minor editing (using Iphoto or similar) you can really make the pictures look fantastic.  I will post a pic or video once I figure out how to do it on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Hobish
Reviews.Content: I researched underwater cameras prior to a trip to Tahiti to celebrate our anniversary.  After reading the reviews fairly extensively on Amazon, I chose this camera.  One reviewer stated that it looks like these work about 80% of the time and that he was okay with those odds due to it's low price (he nor I wanted to spend $300-400).The camera worked very well for us.  We took photo's in about 1 to 5 foot depths and the photo's came out well.  Photo's were better when the sun provided good light (which was most of the time in Tahiti).The one shortcoming is not being able to see the LCD image under water.  This resulted in a lot of aim and shoot attempts that were not successful all the time.  We also had to get used to the time it took this camera to write each photo to the memory stick.  It took at least 3-4 seconds per photo.  I'm not sure if this is due to the size of each image (we used the 9MP setting) or operator error (always a possibility).Overall we were pleased with the price/perrformance this camera provided.

Reviews.Title: so easy to use
Reviews.Author: photomom
Reviews.Content: We got this camera for our 5 year old son for Christmas and he loves it!  He can use it with no problems, but just know the camera color is more orange than red.  So far, the pics have turned out great, though we haven't tried it in water, yet.  He can't wait to take it to Disney this summer to take pics for a photo book.  For the price, you really can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: Recently bought this camera to bring on my trip to Mexico and Belize. It was amazing. As long as you made sure both doors were locked, it wouldn't leak at all. Took amazing photos and videos of stingrays, huge turtles, sharks, etc.  You can get this camera at Wal-mart for $69. It was such a great buy and all of my friends are impressed with the photos. No issues at all! I used it several times (always rinsing the salt water off with fresh water) and used it time and time again.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Danni
Reviews.Content: I read reviews that suggested that it was difficult to open the battery compartment.  It's not.  I only have one memory card for my two cameras and easily swapped my memory card.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: regular
Reviews.Author: raga
Reviews.Content: The camera is very nice, although the color is slightly darker than out on the page, on clear days is excellent, but at night is quite a fiasco. what is really good is that it is waterproof and is very comfortable for swimming pools and beaches and rivers ... is up to the buyer if you will use more by day than by night. (not recommended for night shots)

Reviews.Title: for the price....not bad
Reviews.Author: washington carper
Reviews.Content: Bought this more as a throw away or 'so what if it gets stolen on vacation' type purchase. Please people , this is a freakin sub $100 12 mega pixel under freakin water camera, took it on a cruise, used it, it worked, didn't leak, printed 8" x 10" photo's at costco, damn fine for for my kids to take to school for show and tell. Its now sat in the carry in for next time in its hard case with the floaty thing.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: barb
Reviews.Content: it's small, easy to shoot, and the photos are fine, not terrific, but good enough. seeing your subject underwater in the viewer is a challenge because the screen glares. so it's a point, guess and shoot.  light weight, easy to hold, and i love that you can put batteries in it when it runs out of gas.  i've only had it in the water three times, but so far it's tight.  no leaks!  unlike my fuji that's leaked three times.  for the price, i'm happy with it.Barb from hawaii

Reviews.Title: Camera leaks
Reviews.Author: E. Cheung
