Reviews.Content: Great camera to start off, works as the company states period! I managed to drop it by accident into a deep puddle which submerged the camera for a few sec, not a drop of water anywhere near the SD card slot/battery area! Camera works fast, easy to operate no gimicks here, the only downfall I think to this camera is photo quality is not up to par with some more expensive camera's but most waterproof camera's aren't anyway. If your into adventures from snow storms, snowboarding, hiking, late night bar hops in the pouring rain :->, whatever your life style is this camera will do the job and you won't have to worry about water spoiling your fun and memories!

Reviews.Title: Kodak C123 Sport Camera
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This far exceeded my expectations. I am very pleased. I purchased the camera for a summer Aquatic Ecology class and it has stood up to some vigorous use and conditions. The picture quality is good. Of course it is not excellent, but after all, it is a $70 camera. However, most of my attempted photos have been quite clear and the video quality is quite good as well. It has not leaked, though I had some minor trouble with the latch for the battery compartment. That was soon rectified after I realized what the trouble was. I have taken photos and video underwater of people swimming and have been highly satisfied with the end result. I would highly recommend this product to people looking for a budget camera for water sports. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: C. Chalfont
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for the price.  My kids (6 and 8 year old boys) have taken lots of underwater photo and videos.  We bought a floating strap for the camera and during a recent trip to a pool with a lazy river, they let the camera float next to them.  The camera does not take the best quality of photos, but it is a $65 underwater camera.  Expecting more would be unreasonable.  The camera sometimes freezes if it has been exposed to the elements for too long- we did a 3 mile mud pit run and by the 5th mud pit it would not turn on.  Once it dried out, however, it fired right back up.  For the money, you will not find a better camera that can be thrown around by boys, get wet and take decent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great pic & price point
Reviews.Author: Craig Tankersley
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera for a Florida Keys trip and it held up well with getting tossed around the boat. Nephew dove to around 15 feet + and no leaks as other reported. Would assume that you have to be careful in closing the camera to stay water tight. Pics are better then anticipated, will try surfing next.

Reviews.Title: not a water tight camera
Reviews.Author: M. Drews "M. Drews"
Reviews.Content: We have used this camera twice. It would take pictures for a little while, but then water will seep into the battery compartment, ruin the battery and shut the camera down. We have already replaced the battery twice for corrosion. I am a huge fan of Kodak and their quality cameras, but this one was a complete bust for our family. I would not buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: water proff yes good photos no
Reviews.Author: WB "Webwalker"
Reviews.Content: Took the camera to Seabase in FL both the trip and the camera were a waste of time.Above water photos were fine. I did get some good sunsets.  When the camera is turned on it defaults to auto land setting so if it turns off when you are in the water it has to be reset.  Underwater the video was better than still photos.  Stills need a lot of photo shop time to get rid of the green tint.  To be fair the vis was not good and most of the reefs we saw in the keys were dead or dying so there was not much to photograph.All in all as it is about the cost of 3 disposable cameras with development it is a good value and would make a good beach camera or for a canoe trip, etc.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: angelicaguarenas
Reviews.Content: Is an excellent camera, and beautiful too. I use the camera and can do excellents photos in color, light and contrast. The zoom is very good, too

Reviews.Title: NOT Waterproof!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amy V. Williams "mom2two"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for a special snorkeling trip.  The camera is very difficult to manage underwater, as it has to be "reset" before taking another picture.  But worst of all, it filled with water!  We got very few pictures from our trip and were very disappointed.  We ended up returning the camera and were promptly issued a refund, which we appreciated.  But the picture opportunities are lost forever!

Reviews.Title: Easy waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Knippser
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after I missed nice pictures and funny memories during a whitewater rafting tour. The low  price and some of the features eventually convinced me. After taking the camera to the beach and getting great images and snap shots, I really can recommend this camera. Don't expect high picture quality, but it is definitely better than many cell phone cameras and some of the older digicams. See some pictures and a more detailed review on my (German) bolg:

Reviews.Title: Kodak C123
Reviews.Author: Tom Case
Reviews.Content: Works great so far. I don't intend to use it underwater so the negative reviews related to that don't concern me. Very little internal memory so plan on optional SDHC card. Kodak should offer those with initial purchase with estimate on number of pics and length of videos for various capacity cards.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof is an Iffy!
Reviews.Author: C. J. Peters
Reviews.Content: Seems to take well enough photos. I purchased this because i didn't want to bring my $400 camera to the ocean (salt water and sand can do a job on a good camera) and i didn't want to have to lug it everywhere i went...so i opted for a waterproof camera. After inspecting it, i noticed that the battery/SD card compartment doesn't look quite H2O proof BUT should be perfect for the beach. Don't expect to get great indoor photos either...flash seems to white out things up close.SO...camera is good for beaches 'n such but i wouldn't take it in the water like they say. $66 is a good price for ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Missouri Teacher
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews, I decided to order this camera for our trip to Mexico this summer.  I water tested it in our sink and it took fine pictures before and after submersion.  We used this camera on land and sea and had great results.  We snorkel and it was perfect.  I can not recommend the camera bundle with strap and case enough.  Its one draw back is that it doesn't take great pics at land at night, but hey it's an underwater digital for under $70 not a Nikon cool pic.I was beyond impressed with the quality of underwater pictures it took and not once did we have a problem with water getting into the camera.  Yes, occasionally you will have to blow water out of the lens housing once returning to terra firma, but for the price, this was a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Worked fine, then breaks
Reviews.Author: MattP
Reviews.Content: Worked fine for the first couple days. Took great pictures in the water and underwater. Loved how it was looking. For some reason day three rolls around and it starts acting strange. Now I can take one picture fine, but if I try to take another picture it shows the battery exhausted symbol and shuts off. If I let it rest for a few hours, I can then take another picture, but only one. I wouldn't recommend buying this if you need it for more than two days!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Sport C123
Reviews.Author: T. Goodman "Grandma Teresa"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera (Kodak EasyShare Sport C123) for our 8 year old grandson to use on a vacation.  Well, we all used it because it is very easy to use and takes great pictures.  It also does video (when reviewing, the sound was not there, that was annoying). Our grandson loves this camera and took soooo many pictures.  We went to a cave and when the settings were set up right (by an adult), it took very good pictures.  The only complaint that I have is the need for a view finder.  It was very hard to see the subject in bright light.  A very good camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great, cheap waterproof camera!
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a snorkeling trip and was hesitant to buy a waterproof camera.  I finally decided, go with a cheap one, and if it breaks, then i'm not out much money.  I went as deep as 13 feet and took 423 pics & video's on my snorkeling trip.  Camera worked great.I then took it to a waterpark and beat it up sliding down slides, dropped it to the bottom of a pool once and the camera never missed a beat.  I think if you want to enjoy a camera and not worry about damaging it and being out a bunch of money, this camera is the way to go.It seems to take about 200 pictures before the batteries need to be replaced, but this will clearly depend upon how much time you leave it on, and review pictures.My only complaint about the camera is that it is a little slow between pictures.  It takes about 6 seconds to allow you to take your next picture, which seems like a long time when you're holding your breath looking at a fish.  But I expected this, since after all its a 60 dollar camera.

Reviews.Title: Not terrible
Reviews.Author: mgspeed
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-professional photographer, and I understand that I cannot expect the same results from this as I get from the set up I use for work. Due the high cost of most dedicated cases ($500+ for our household camera, $2000+ for one of my work SLR's), we bought this camera solely for easy snapshots while kayaking at the lake. My expectations are not high for this sort of camera, and it manages to meet those expectations most of the time.  While it's great for the scrapbook shots,and perhaps printing 4x6's, expect to work harder and pay more attention to get some of those pictures.Pros:AA batteries.  I can't tell you how helpful this is, dealing with a proprietary battery out at the lake is an incredible pain in the neck.Simple button to turn off the flash. You need it with this camera, see the cons section.Simple button to adjust the exposure compensation.Large easy to see display. Even in the sun the display is easy to see.Splash proof - NOT waterproof.  One look at this thing and it's obvious it's going to take on water, too many exposed buttons.Small and rugged.Cons:Over exposes easily.  This camera will fire off the flash even in the slightest of shadows and as a result tends to make pictures a bit whited out.No lens cover.  Truly ridiculous, the camera is advertised for the water, why isn't there at least some kind of cheap cover to keep the water and fingerprints off the lens when your carrying it around?  The recessed lens makes it very difficult to clean the lens when it gets spots on it.Review time is fixed at 5 seconds.  Which means that you either have to shoot blind or wait those 5 seconds for the review to finish.  No buttons seem to make the camera kick back into the preview screen.No viewfinder.  I know this is the trend in most cameras, and I knew it didn't have one before ordering, but it really irritates the crap out of me.Factory float strap isn't a float strap.  I ordered the combo kit because it came with a float strap from the factory.  The assumption of course was that it would actually float the camera it came with, it doesn't.  Fortunately this is something I checked in a large bucket with an equal weight before going to the lake.Overall I would like to emphasize that this isn't too bad for a sub $70 camera.  If you want something that takes good pictures most every time, has a quick speed, is easy to get along with, and is water proof you need to at least move into the $200 range.  But if you don't expect too much you'll probably be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great Water Camera
Reviews.Author: Karlaqg
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased the camera to take to Cancun in 3 weeks and decided to take to the river first to test it out. Took it to the pool at the hotel and it took great pictures & video under water. Everyone at the pool wanted to see the camera. They couldn't believe it could take pics and video under water. Heard a couple of people saying they will soon get one. Took to the river the following day and it began to rain and the camera worked like a charm. Took some great video of us inner tubing and when everyone had to put their cameras away for the rain, I had mine out taking pics of all the great times we had. I read some reviews where there were some difective cameras and thankfully, mine was not one of them. I would recommend the purchase of this camera but 1. Make sure to have extra batteries on hand in your case (had to change mine after a day but I did use all day long) 2. Recommend you purchase the floating wrist strap as the camera does not float (I will purchase one for our trip to Cancun).

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price!
Reviews.Author: kynimom
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for my 10year old daughter.  She loves it!  The first day she took close to 200 pictures most were underwater.  The picture quality is great, it shows the sunlight, the bubbles and the kids in great detail.  They were taken on a sunny day in a pool.  We have not tried it in a lake so do not know the quality there.  She also took some video and out of water photos which are also of good quality. If you forget to switch from underwater you get a yellow tint to the pictures, which she quickly figured out.  When we posted pics online for family and friends everyone was asking what kind of camera and where we got it.  As of now, I have no complaints, she has had the camera for two weeks so far.

Reviews.Title: Good for shallower waters
Reviews.Author: K. Finley "Always reading"
Reviews.Content: When you can't wear your glasses underwater, this camera does the trick for you.  It's easy to memorize where the still and video settings are so you don't have to guess what the camera is doing.  It remained waterproof, it performed well, it kept a charge for a long period of time, and it was easy to use.  It took the best pictures and videos at about 10 feet or less, and that's based on clear waters around Cayman Brac.  Anything more than 10 feet and the water's turbidity gets in the way, although I shot rays and sharks from twenty feet away and you could definitely identify them, but detail was lost.  This camera was fine for snaps on dry land, too.  I would recommend this camera for anyone who wants to capture the thrill of swimming with the fishes.  I did use Photoshop to fix the stills and take out the green tint for clearer photos.

Reviews.Title: Says 12 MP, doesn't take photos like a 12 MP camera.
Reviews.Author: Christmas shopper
Reviews.Content: At first I was concerned with buying a camera at such a low price and I should have been. I was excited to see that it was a 12 MP camera that was waterproof, took double A batteries and was at such a low price. Well at first I was impressed with the fact I could take it on the beach and not worry about it. Underwater photos is really all its good for. When trying to take nice photos of people outside or even inside the quality is crappy and blurry even when using a steady tripod.

Reviews.Title: Best Buy Ever!
Reviews.Author: Sasssywon
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic!  It takes crystal clear pictures underwater and there is no distotion in the image.  Works great out of water as well.  I am extremely satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: GREAT waterproof digital camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Nurse Ratchet
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera. GREAT purchase decision! It takes great photos and I have had no issues with it.Took it tubing on a river trip and got great photos (and with it being digital, it was nice to have the advantage of seeing the photo right away). It definitely got dunked in the river a few times, and still works perfectly. The floatie wrist band is also key, so if it gets dunked...it doesn't sink to the bottom never to be seen again.For $70 you can't beat it!-Slightly slow from shooting one photo to the next (when compared to my higher end Canon camera) but the pause is maybe 4 seconds between shots.-If the lens gets wet, just make sure to wipe it off or your photos will turn out having a smudge spot/smear on them (but luckily you can review the photos and see that right away). After wiping off the lens, it was perfect again. Happened once on my whole trip.-I didn't have a problem with it eating up the AA batteries right away, but then again I turned it off between shots.-Definitely get the wrist band if you plan on taking it IN the water just so you don't lose it to the bottom of the lake/river/ocean.I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: SandiFish
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my annual float down the river. I put 100% faith in it and hoped that the pictures would come out good, and they did! It did everything I needed it too.  I took hundreds of pictures in the water and didn't worry one bit about the camera. At one point the camera was submerged for a long period of time and the only issue was a bit on condensation in the lens, I just set the camera in the sun while enjoying my float on the river (about 10 minutes) and the condensation went away. The pictures were Awesome. Good product, great price. The only thing I would want to change is have to cameras load time between photos be quicker. It's also great for taking pictures of the fish in my pond at home.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Tracey
Reviews.Content: I bought this specifically for our trip to WDW to use at Typhoon Lagoon and the resort pool. It's a pretty neat little camera and for the most part it held up well after 2 days at Typhoon Lagoon and a week in the resort pool. The only problems I encountered were the lens getting fogged up a couple of times and having to put it in the sun to clear it before I could take more pictures and that the sound "disappeared" from videos after being submerged in a wave at Typhoon Lagoon. All the videos taken prior to the "wave" video had sound including those taken under water in the resort pools, but then the sound actually disappears midway through the wave video and won't work anymore. For $65 though, I have no real complaints since I was able to get pretty good shots in Shark Reef and around the water park/resort. The photo quality is not as good as my regular Canon Powershot (and obviously not comparable to my D90), but for what I wanted it for, I thought it was a great deal on a pretty cool little camera!

Reviews.Title: it really works!
Reviews.Author: DMum
Reviews.Content: As long as you are not expecting to review your pictures while underwater, it works wonderfully!  I wouldn't suggest trying to review pictures at all that are taken underwater until sometime after you are out-the playback is a little odd in h2o mode-color is GREAT the picture quality it GREAT, and so we think the camera was not only priced fairly, but is a great addition to our family that lives on a budget!  It's helped my young swimmers stay under water longer, and practice their breathing!  HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof! Did not survive the first time in water!
Reviews.Author: Ron "Ron"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera. On the 2nd time I ever used it, I went with it to the pool to take pictures of my son. It did not take even 2-3 minutes for the camera to fill up completely with water. It's destroyed.Also, the camera keeps the screen in full brightness for 2 seconds only and then deems it. So it's almost impossible to see anything if you take pictures outdoor in full sun light.Ron

Reviews.Title: Great for the whole family
Reviews.Author: Cindy M.
Reviews.Content: The camera is working wonderfully!! It's been through a week on a sandy beach & poolside throughout our FL vacation 2 weeks ago; then back home for two kids pool parties including some fun underwater pictures taken.Yesterday the C123 went to Six Flags. It had no problem in the rain, when the 2 yr old tossed it 3 feet on concrete, or in the water park there.I have only needed to change the 2 AA batteries twice. Once in FL and then today. We've had it a month and have taken at least a couple hundred pics set at 6MP (rather than up to 12 MP). We occasionally use the flash, and we have taken three fun 1-2 min. videos with sound. We have yet to make prints but the pictures transferred to our laptop have been fun to view. Our just-turned 6 yr old daughter is thrilled to be able to use a camera on her own without us hovering over over her. We've recommended it to family & friends. We hope to get some prints made in the next week.Def. a best buy @$64 w/ free s&h; on Amazon!The only reason I have not given it 5 stars is that my software engineer husband had difficulty the two times he transferred pics to our computer; and we have not seen any prints yet cause we've been too busy to order some.I'll update more later

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: THE_RED
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, easy to use, with all the editing options offered by the sophisticated camera, light. The only thing missing is the stabilizer of photos to catch movement, however, this was not offered in the package, so it's an excellent product in relation to the price and picture quality it offers.

Reviews.Title: Tested this camera at the Schlitterbahn
Reviews.Author: T. Pannell
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera before a trip home to Austin because it was about the same price as a few water cameras that take about 27 pictures each. This one is digital and shoots video.Even though several reviews complained about leaking issues, I decided to risk it. If it leaked, I would return it.Well, we took it to Lake LBJ in Kingsland and to the Schlitterbahn in New Braunfels. Rode bots on the lake, swam in the lake, rode lots of the crazy Schlitterbahn rides during a 107 degree heat. Needless to say, this camera was pushed to it's limits with water and heat exposure, shaking and bumping, and going under water. Very sturdy, not perfect but still worked very well, I love this thing. Even shot some cool video while on the rides.Let me point out a couple of things:1. The focus is not perfect on real close shots but I can live with that. Further shots came out really good. I always used the auto settings the camera had. Sometimes the pictures were very slightly overexposed but nothing major. Probably because we were out on such bright days. 1 minute in Photoshop and it's easily adjusted.2. The flash worked great. I took a few indoors and to enhance people in the shade and they were nice.3. The video camera worked really good. From really dark to really light, the iris takes a moment longer to adjust but it's acceptable. The audio on the camera wasn't too bad either. The only problem I had was when telling the camera to record, it was so bright outside that it was kind of hard to see the screen and make sure it was recording. That is my only issue with the camera. You just have to really make sure you see the screen and see that it's recording.4. Changing modes like camera to video or the different flash modes was pretty easy and worked well.5. I did not change batteries while in the water. I put the high end AA batteries in it and used that camera a lot to take pictures and shoot video and play them back. The batteries lasted the whole trip and are still in the camera. Maybe others had the camera leak because of where or how they changed batteries. I don't know.Overall, I recommend this camera. Inexpensive, nice pictures and videos; it worked great for me.

Reviews.Title: NICE
Reviews.Author: Veronica
Reviews.Content: Nice camera. Bought after we went to Dollywood and I spent my time protecting my Canon from getting wet on a 90+ day. Read the reviews and took the chance. Reviews stated lack of view finder make it a little tough because in the water its a little tough seeing anything in the screen, thats true, but still a good purchase,I have used in the pool and on other water rides, I will recommend this.

Reviews.Title: exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: QueenDoOver
Reviews.Content: Really fun to be able to capture useable video and  pictures underwater.  Quality of regular pics is somewhat inferior but still perfectly useful for capturing the memory.  Very useful tool to have available.

Reviews.Title: Awesom camera
Reviews.Author: Denis Langlois
Reviews.Content: Great price and good quality, an excellent alternative to all the other expensive options out there. Purchased 2 for my kids summer camp trips and haven't been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jade"
Reviews.Content: Kids tested the camera in our pool the day we got it and we are all very impressed! Underwater video and pictures are terrific. I showed the pics and videos to my brother and sister in law and they couldn't believer the quality. I couldn't ask for more in an inexpensive waterproof camera!! This is going to be used so much on our beach days and river trips!!!

Reviews.Title: This camera was everything I expected
Reviews.Author: crzydvl
Reviews.Content: Ordered this camera off Amazon and was amazed at how fast it shipped to me at an FPO address (5 days, really good!).  The camera itself performs well.  I bought this camera to take pictures in the pool.  I tested it out underwater and no issues.  It was dark so you couldn't see anything on the display until the picture was actually taken.  The photo quality is very good.  Once the flash goes off, the colors are very vibrant.  Water did not seep into the camera while I had it underwater so I was happy with that.For the price, this camera will do for any situation where you do not want to damage your regular camera.  I have a non-weatherproof point and shoot and a DSLR, and the pictures taken with this suit me fine.  Not as good as the DSLR but comparable (some pics even better) to the standard point and shoot.  I wouldn't recommend this for indoor low light, but for outdoor use, you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: Much more than I expected for the price
Reviews.Author: Jacy "J"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA, I am thrilled to bits with its quality, especially for the price.  The pictures have great color for a point and shoot.  Even if you don't have the steadiest of hands, the photo quality comes out very nicely, even on moving targets such as kids riding quads, action shots or bumpy boat rides. As long as I am not taking pictures at 55 miles an hour on the freeway, my shots are turning out great. I don't use the video functions a whole lot, but even under water the sound isn't too shabby.  The ZOOM isn't very powerful, I have attempted to shoot from across the lake and it doesn't work out too well, but what do you expect from a $65 camera? I am not a pro by any means, but I'd say if you are within about 25 feet of your object you should get pretty good results.  The BATTERIES that came with it are kodak brand, and I am not sure if they were just old or what, but I got about 50 pictures out of the camera before I had to change.  We use RECHARGABLE 2500mAh AAs and we get about 300-500 pictures from those batteries, depending on how much you have it on just scrolling through looking at your shots (wasting battery life). I'd bet if you got the rechargeables that are specifically for digital cameras you would get even more.  This camera doesn't seem to be a battery hog like some I have owned in the past.All in all, this is a great camera for family trips, pools, rivers, lakes, water parks, and a pretty good everyday camera too if you just want something small to tuck into your purse or glovebox.

Reviews.Title: Recommended for beach and poolside use
Reviews.Author: PinoyDoc
Reviews.Content: I found this camera with the following goals in mind: a sub-$100 camera with decent performance which will stand average use at the beach and pool. It met all these expectations and the pictures were pretty good. I would have preferred a brighter screen for use in bright sun, but at the same time I have used "old style" cameras in the not too distant past (with "film"--remember them?), and not having immediate feedback as the how the pictures will look was no big deal.  I am curious as to why there are some users who experienced water intrusion despite keeping the camera above the 3 meter/10 ft limit. I did not experience that problem, and was able to take satisfying pictures and video with no issues whatsoever. I wonder if some of these adverse events were due to somebody jumping into the pool while holding the camera (instead of descending via the steps or being handed the camera while already in the pool). I am inclined to believe that the "shock" can defeat the water resistant properties of the camera.  I have used Kodak digital cameras since 2002, so the Kodak Easyshare program was very easy for me to use.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Sport
Reviews.Author: William R Walb "billiam67"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. Takes great pictures.  We use it on our boat and jet skis.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Anthony L Maurer
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera about 2 weeks and have been very pleased with it. I was able to shoot 197 pictures and 7 videos with one set of batteries. I have had good luck shooting underwater pictures of my grandkid at the pool. The only negatives I have are 1) the flash is weak; if the subject is more than 5 feet away you won't get a good shot. 2) In powersave mode the LCD viewscreen is almost impossible to see in an outdoor setting.Overall this is a GREAT little camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality for a Low Price
Reviews.Author: Kara Alyce
Reviews.Content: I am incredibly happy with this product. My last camera, a Kodak EasyShare 4.0 MP was nearly five years old and desperately needed an update. Thing was, the old one must have cost three times this much and offered far fewer advantages and features! This camera is easy to use (Share Button App makes emailing a cinch), durable (I still find it incredible that it's waterproof), and attractive to boot. The low price is amazing; I definitely recommend it to my friends and family if they're looking for high quality photos from a cool camera that doesn't break the budget.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice
Reviews.Author: Bob+TN
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for a snorkel vacation in St. Croix.  I am very impressed with this camera; it did everything as advertised.  The underwater pictures of marine wildlife in brite sun were excellent.  I used the flash on a night snorkel with a waterproof flashlight and was able to get passable pictures of a spiney lobster and a white snake eel.  My 7-year old grandson took pictures with it so it is easy to use.  With the 12MP, it also takes excellent photos on dry land.  Great choice for the beach and pool.  Can't be beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: sconway0821
Reviews.Content: we bought this for our daughter's 12th birthday and it is has been perfect! she had asked for a digital camera for her birthday but i wasn't sure i wanted to buy anything fancy or expensive for her first camera. not only was the price great, but i was excited to find a camera that was her favorite color- turquoise. for an inexpensive camera, the quality of the pictures is great. we have also taken it to the pool several times, as well as to the beach, and have never had any issues after putting it completely under water. she has a blast taking underwater photos! it actually makes me wish i'd had this camera when snorkeling in hawaii a few summers ago.the only thing i was a little disappointed in was that it uses AA batteries instead of using a re-chargeable brick like most digital cameras do. at the same time, AA batteries might be better for our daughter because they can be replaced if they get lost. :)for a digital camera, of course there are better ones out there, BUT i would definitely recommend this camera for a kid/teenager's camera or for an adult who is wanting to take underwater pictures and doesn't want to use a cheap disposable underwater camera. VERY happy about this purchase.

Reviews.Title: love this camera so far
Reviews.Author: ikios
Reviews.Content: I have had mine for only about a week and loving it so far. Seems to function flawlessly. I have tested under water, taken it to the lake while kayaking, suping and tubing. Video and camera both worked well.

Reviews.Title: great pics from an inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: James Humphreys
Reviews.Content: Used the camera for snorkling pictures while we were on a cruise.  It performed well.  The missing finish in areas also demonstrated its ability to withstand some hits against the rocks as well.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with purchase
Reviews.Author: rdoss
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for our vacation.  The camera worked great.  Went snorkeling and swimming.  Used both the video and still picture under water.  Pictures turned out good.  Video was good as well.  The only down side was the batteries.  Uses AA batteries and they do not last long.

Reviews.Title: Pics good & bad, but you only know when you get home
Reviews.Author: Michael Edelstein
Reviews.Content: Worked in and above water.  Settings don't stay, so if you are doing multiple underwater shots, or video, within a short time, you will have to reset each time.  Light meter goes WAY off kilter, making some shots horrid.  Switching to underwater for above water shots stopped that, but then pics had wrong hue to them.  Really a cheapie if you don't care about your shots, can take enough to throw away about HALF, but not for whale shark trips like I used it.  Oh well.  Userful, but really poor for what is listed. Fair pics at $65-75 I could put up with.  Half being complete loss is really below Kodak expectations I had.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Seth Twery
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a few days before a sea kayaking trip.  It worked very well for the price.  Picture quality was good, flash worked well, and battery life was good, and it was a huge plus to be able to use standard AA batteries for being in the wilderness for 10 days with no electrical source.  Having no optical zoom and only 5x digital zoom makes some limitations but I understood that was part of the price point.Relative to the water-resistant claims.  I think the camera worked well.  It was never totally submerged.  However I did have it in a sea-kayak that constantly got wet from salt water and rain, took it under waterfalls and in constant mist/fog.  And through all of this the only problem I had was that a few times the lens got foggy from big temperature changes.I would strongly recommend this camera for wet use in all sorts of environments.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: ES Susan
Reviews.Content: We purchased two of these little cameras to use on a recent tropical vacation. Both of them worked wonderfully!  Water-tight, good quality photos, compact and easy to use in (or out) of the water.  The strap (made by Kodak) is amazing -- adjustable to fit my daughter or my husband's wrist. This will also be a great little camera for backpacking trips,canoeing, -- basically any water activity!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: chuck
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic and very easy to use. Prior to this we purchased a Nikon piece of junk that Nikon would not respond to. We had to return it. This camera is the best ever.

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: papa
Reviews.Content: Works fine, it's a minimum camera, no bells or whistles. Only con is it doesn't have a wider angle so you have be farther away from your subject, you get what you pay for. Hey, it's a Kodak, gotta be decent.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use water-proof digital camera
Reviews.Author: T. Fox
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to take on trips where water exposure was imminent, such as fishing, swimming, or going to the beach. We have found this camera to meet our expectations. Great pictures and very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: B. Sacra
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome for underwater pictures. It is not the best for standard pictures. We went to a water park and I did not want to take my digital camera and took the Kodak EasyShare Sport C123 camera and some of the pictures outside of the water were disappointing. The color is not as vivid. I am still very satisfied with the underwater pictures and highly recommend this camera for that.

Reviews.Title: Hmmmmmmm
Reviews.Author: muddygirl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this little point and shoot for my upcoming trip.  I decided that it would be easier to take this little guy out to a dinner I went to a couple weeks ago vs. my huge camera.  I am a little disappointed that in a dark room you can't see the LCD screen, that is the only downfall.  Unless I am a little slow and can't figure it out it was a little frustrating.  I guess this one will only work outside in daylight.

Reviews.Title: We will see!
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: I've read many reviews about this camera. So far it has worked great. I took it to the pool and used it underwater. This camera did well. I also used it in dim lighting, it did great there too. This summer I'm headed to montego bay. I plan to snorkle with it. Hopefully, it will stand up to par. I've read some do great underwater and some dont.

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love my new toy
Reviews.Author: E. Layfield "traveling mia"
Reviews.Content: I have two small kids and we love the waterproof camera.  I am fasinated that it can be dunked in the water and take clear pictures.  We used it at a Spring Swimming hole in Florida and the video is just amazing above and below water.  Little grainy if you zoom in on something but takes great regular pictures and fast pictures. At least I know this one can get wet and still work, unlike the camera I had before.  Also love the kodak brand, its always been a good brand for me to buy.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Mariahh
Reviews.Content: I got my camera today! It's awesome! Shipping wise, I ordered it Thursday night and got it the following Tuesday morning. Had no problems with going underwater. You can even take flash underwater, so if you go swimming in the dark :D Video quality is good, once you take the video, you can't listen to the sound until you upload it to your camera, but other than that, I LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Chuck McB
Reviews.Content: This is a sweet little camera. It's basic in some respects but is loaded with features that are amazing for a $70 digital waterproof camera. With 12 mega pixels the digital zoom gives great flexibility both prior and following a shot. Some have reviewers have lamented the delay between successive pictures, but hey, with 12 meg downloading what do you expect?  The shutter speed is fast...better than my Canon A520 by a long shot. It's fixed focus, but that eliminates a bunch of problems associated with the auto-focus hunting for the right setting. And, since your probably going to use it in or near the water in bright sun its no a biggie. When I finish this review I'm buying another one and tossing my Canon!!

Reviews.Title: For the price you can't bet it!
Reviews.Author: Untitled
Reviews.Content: I used this on a tubing river trip in the mountains in Virginia and while snorkeling in Hawaii. I would not at all call this a great camera or use it for anything other photographing other then when water is involved. But for less than $70 it works perfectly in those conditions that your "other" camera can not go.

Reviews.Title: Wish I Had One!!!
Reviews.Author: Julie E. Dey
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'm reviewing this for my friend, she recently bought one for our yearly trip to Vegas. She just wanted an affordable underwater camera that we could take by the pool and not worry about it getting stolen. Well this camera works so well we took it EVERYWHERE. It took better pictures then all our regular cameras. The underwater pictures looked amazing! I was really impressed. I want one for myself but I just got an underwater video camera for Christmas. AWESOME product, I'm so jealous!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the pool...
Reviews.Author: B. Gao
Reviews.Content: This is the best low cost underwater camera that I've found.  I used it for 2 days straight in the pool in Sacramento, CA and it worked great.  No problems with camera functions at all.  LCD was a little hard to see while in the water because of the glare, but it could've been the 100 degree sun too.  Overall, this is definitely a good pool use camera.  I can't comment on the use of this in the ocean as I have yet to do so.  However, this may be a probelm as a few reviews here showed.  Still, 5 stars for a great low cost pool use camera...

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Dawn B. Couch "Bluedawn"
Reviews.Content: Got this for the beach while our family was on vacation.  This is a great little camera.  We had no problems, & got great pictures that we would not have had.  I would recommend it to anyone.  My other family members are considering buying it, just so they will have a waterproof cmaera.  Great price.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: lovemymutts
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a wedding gift for a good friend having a private wedding in the Virgin Islands.  It lasted well through many snorkeling sessions, even diving deeper than recommended by the manual (3meters). Takes great pictures, especially considering how affordable this little camera was. I got the red for visibility and paired it with a yellow wrist camera floaty.

Reviews.Title: This camera was so much fun to use!
Reviews.Author: K. Stevens "music mama"
Reviews.Content: Our family purchased this camera to use on our summer vacation this year.  It was so much fun to have since we spent so much time in and on the water. Our 11 year old used it to photograph and video hundreds of fish and corals that she saw while snorkeling.  She also took pictures of her sister and Dad. We didn't use it to upload anything automatically to facebook, but transferring everything to our computer was a piece of cake.

Reviews.Title: A Great Outdoors Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: DR
Reviews.Content: A good price, very compact, and takes excellent point and shoot pictures.  Being waterproof and dustproof is a great plus.  Perfect for general outdoors use.

Reviews.Title: IT IS NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: R. Ramos
Reviews.Content: I used the camera for the first time in the pool and it completely filled up with water.  Yes I did read the instructions and yes I made sure all compartments were closed properly, the camera is not waterproof.  Do not buy this camera, thank goodness for Amazon and their easy return policy.

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money
Reviews.Author: Kh Esquire
Reviews.Content: I used this one time at the pool and it filled up with water and destroyed my memory card in the process of the camera not working! It was a complete waste of money!

Reviews.Title: Lies!
Reviews.Author: Pinky
Reviews.Content: It works really nice but not in water and it looks cute but don't b fooled I went in a pool 3ft. Didn't even go all the way down then it didn't work. The lie is 10ft.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: E. Ross "edross10"
Reviews.Content: Despite the advertising, this camera is definitely not waterproof.  On its first use underwater, water completely infiltrated the unit.  Days later, you can still see water behind the view screen.  If you're looking for a waterproof camera, do yourself a favor and find a different one.  This one was completely useless for this part of its intended purpose.

Reviews.Title: not happy
Reviews.Author: janice wagner
Reviews.Content: I can not get film  cards that fit it.  It is impossible to use.  The buyer should be told that.

Reviews.Title: No flash card
Reviews.Author: Franco978
Reviews.Content: I received my camera late in the afternoon on the day before my trip to Bermuda. When I read info about the camera late in that day I realized it hadn't flash card. Fortunately my old camera had the same card.I feel as though it should be advertised better so u can purchase card at the same time ,better yet include it with camera.

Reviews.Title: fine for a few days on dry land; dead after its first time at the beach.
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: My son took this to summer camp, and it was fine for the first few days, but the first time he took it down to the lakefront it stopped working completely.  I wish he'd been back from camp quickly enough for me to return it through Amazon (since it died in a few days), but instead the dead camera sat in his bag for the rest of his month at camp-- now I have to deal with the kodak warranty.

Reviews.Title: Bought for 6 yr old
Reviews.Author: SAHM
Reviews.Content: My 6 yr old daughter loves to take pictures. She was always taking my phone and taking photos with it.For her 6th birthday I bought her this camera. She LOVES it. It's easy for her to use. I just went over everything with her the first time and she is able to di it all on her own now. AND I don't have to worry about my phone going missing anymore. :)

Reviews.Title: Was not water proof
Reviews.Author: LalithKumar K Solai
Reviews.Content: This product takes average pictures. It takes better pictures in the water, but water got into it on the first day of use in swimming pool. Since then it has died completely. My kids were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Has NO optical zoom
Reviews.Author: Buyer
Reviews.Content: BEWARE, THERE IS NO OPTICAL ZOOM.  I just received this camera (the C135 14MP), and one of the major reasons for my purchase was that it has an advertised 5x optical zoom.  This is a lie.  It has a 5x digital zoom, and NO optical zoom (you can Google the manual to check this, like I should have done).I will likely still keep it, but wanted to make those for whom this feature may be important aware that the information in the title is misleading.

Reviews.Title: Not so WATERPROOF digital camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Samanka "tpaflchx"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera hoping the negative ratings would not pertain to me, boy was that wishful thinking. I went as far as to pull up the PDF manual for this camera online to ensure both doors were closed & the camera would work properly on my trip to the Keys. DON'T BUY IT! First time of use it stopped working. So much for meticulously following the directions, didn't stop the "waterproof" from failing, exactly what the camera is largely purchased for :(

Reviews.Title: Great pictures. Could take the realities of snorkeling
Reviews.Author: Dennis & Karen gunther
Reviews.Content: We snorkeled multiple locations in hawaii and used this camera every time.  Zoom feature is great.  Picture quality is excellent, especially for the price.  Videos are fantastic. Only issue is the shutter speed (a tad slow) but for the price we worked around it by taking more  pictures and got great shots overall.  Would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a solid, underwater camera

Reviews.Title: Worked for 5 min.
Reviews.Author: Neil Spoonhower
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for our 15 yr. old daughter.  She used it for the first time in our 8' pool today.  Worked great for about 10 min.  When it stopped working, she brought it to me thinking the batteries died.  I opened the compartment and it had water in it.  We're very disappointed because this was going to be used on our family vacation which starts in 4 days.

Reviews.Title: Cheap underwater fun
Reviews.Author: William Repetto
Reviews.Content: Wanted an inexpensive underwater camera for snorkeling in Key West. Got a couple of really cool shots with this. It comes as advertised - a step above disposable.

Reviews.Title: Is just perfect.
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: I bough this camera even reading bad feedbacks about it. I can't understand why people complain so much about it when they are excellent. I used in a pool in my brother's house visit and it did work great. Nice pictures battery last long enough to take as many pictures as we wanted. Now my wife is going to Costa Rica and she will try it in salt water.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Bullygrrl "jess"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to go on a cruise and was hoping to use it while snorkeling and also on a visit to Dunn's River Falls. My boyfriend and I were concerned when the camera came in the mail because it didn't appear to have much protection.  The battery compartment looked as if water would be able to get in very easily and we actually considered taping it up.  Ufortunately, we forgot the tape. On the first excursion, we went to Dunn's River Falls in Jamaica.  After reading many reviews, I knew that I would need a waterproof camera.  I placed the camera strap around my wrist and it occasionally went into the water as we ascended the falls.  The camera seemed to work well until we got to about half way up the falls.  At this point, I tried to turn the camera on and I would hear a beep, the screen would illuminate but it wouldn't turn on.  I tried several more times but was unable to turn the camera on for the remainder of the excursion.  When we got back on to the ship, I attempted to turn the camera on again but it wouldn't work and didn't turn on again until we returned from our trip.This camera is not waterproof as it claims to be.  It is supposed to work up to either 5 or 10 feet but it didn't hold up in less than a foot of water.  I would not recommend buying this camera.  It was a huge disappointment and I ended up without any pictures from my trip. When I returned home, I immediately returned it.

Reviews.Title: Horrible!
Reviews.Author: Meg
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for my trip to Hawaii where we did lots of swimming and snorkeling. Within 10 minutes of being in the water the thing was waterlogged and stopped working. I would obviously be sending it back but I sat the camera out to dry and ended up leaving it on the beach! Cheap, terrible shutter release time, and doesn't work underwater. Total waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Wish I would have never bought it!
Reviews.Author: Rona M. Miller
Reviews.Content: Dont waste your money! Shame on Kodak! Eats batteries like crazy!!For a 14MP pictures are not that great! Share button wont post to facebook!More frustrating than anything!

Reviews.Title: It seemed to work fine, until ALL pics and movies DELETED on its' own!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Watkins
Reviews.Content: We took this swimming and snorkeling, had some great pics and movies...then, for some reason, my wife said the camera "deleted" all pics and movies on its' own!  She was scrolling through pics, somehow ended up on a "do you want to delete all" frame, of course selected "NO" and the camera did the opposite...complete waste as we have no pics or movies from our trip, at least on that camera. Not sure what happened but there is no way she would have selected "YES" that statement.  Even so, if it was a mistake (which it definitely was not in this case), what kind of camera has an option to DELETE ALL pics and movies with the click of one "yes" without any sort of follow-up of "are you sure you want to delete "everything you have on this media card now?"  Very disappointed, very, very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures and good water resistance
Reviews.Author: Mr. J
Reviews.Content: I picked one of these up for a trip that my wife and I took to Belize.  We needed a water resistant camera to handle snorkeling, tubing, and sand; we saw that this camera good excellent reviews from people who seemed to know what they were talking about and decided to try it out.  We were very happy with the results and would purchase it againThe camera took crisp pictures, both on land and in water.  The response was quick and the camera was easy to hold.  About the only issue that we had was that the camera couldn't decide how much power was left in the batteries.  We were (ok, I was) trying to take some pictures underwater and couldn't tell if the camera was powered on and taking them, though that could have been my unfamiliarity with it.  Definitely a worthy purchase

Reviews.Title: not very impressed
Reviews.Author: Lara E. Bee
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera so I could have something that's reliable when I go on my vacation in June, 2013. I put the batteries in, the camera came on but the flash wouldn't fire when I went to take the pictures. And, I had it on the flash setting. So, this camera is being returned for a full refund since it's defective. I'm very disappointed as I have purchased numerous Kodak cameras and have never had any problems with them. I still have the 6.0 EasyShare digital camera I bought about 8 years ago. It still works great. But this Kodak Sport certainly didn't pass the test.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for 1 year & then died!
Reviews.Author: Janodd
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great for 1 year. Then while on vacation last week, I was using it in the pool like many times before & the screen turned white & the camera shut off. You can physically see water in the screen of the camera. Tried contacting Kodak about the problem & got message back that they don't help with discontinued products. For what I paid, this should have lasted more then 1 year.

Reviews.Title: Not exactly waterproof.
Reviews.Author: Kenzi Ellinwood
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a little less than a year ago& it worked awesome. The quality was good. Then i left it at my cousin's for a little while& of course she used it. Then once i got it back the quality was gross. It made me look orange. For real. Even after i fixed all the settings it kept doing it. Then i used it under water with my friend& the quality was fine.& then the lid where the batteries are held opened unexpectedly. I immediately came up from underwater.& the screen went white then slowly faded out. We put it in rice, but that was no use. Then we thought the batteries may have died. So we put brand new ones in. And what do you know it still didn't turn on. So i'm telling you if you're going to buy this camera make sure you don't let your kids play with it or just make sure they are not as stupid as me. You would think if you bought an underwater camera it would be waterproof all over. WELL IT WASN'T. DON'T LET THE LID WHERE THE BATTERIES ARE OPEN OR IT WILL BREAK. Other than that it was good. Oh and another thing, i went to go buy i new one AT THE SAME STORE I GOT IT AT BEFORE.& it wasn't there. Com'mon. Really? So now i'm off to buy a different one hoping it will be more water proof than this piece of shit was.(: Goodbye.

Reviews.Title: CAMERA BROKE ON OUR HONEYMOON!!!
Reviews.Author: Leslie Cawal
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to purchase this camera as a gift for my fiance. Although I gave it to him for x-mas, we weren't going to use it until our honeymoon in May. We brought it into the water and after the 2nd shot, the camera got water all in it and shut off.It was water drained after only being in 2 feet of water for like 2 minutes. After reading such great reviews this was a shock. When I got home I contacted the seller who basically told me because it was past 30 days he couldn't do anything about it. The camera was brand new and he should have at least asked about it...NOTHING, he didn't care.Obviously we got a faulty camera as I said it was the first time using it.Not only was the camera broken but our card that had other pictures got ruined as well.This was our honeymoon, once in a lifetime moment to capture on camera. SO.. DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER!!!!Because he has no customer service and doesn't care to back up what he is selling!!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Trigger
Reviews.Content: Nice camera. Shop before you buy. Walmart had it $40.00 cheaper for same camera. I like that the camera can be used underwater. I do some snorkeling and can't wait for our next snorkeling trip to try it then

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Camera Coffee
Reviews.Content: Nice pictures. Nice screen. I like the color of the camera. It isn't huge in size. It does not record video though.

Reviews.Title: Read the One-star reviews!!!
Reviews.Author: Lental
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera mainly because of Kodak name. Now, I know why they're bankrupt. Like the majority of 1-star reviews, the camera leaked and shut down after only a few minutes in the water while swimming to a snorkling spot in the Caribbean. The camera was only inches beneath the surface and I took a couple of shots while swimming. Those were the only shots I got. When I reached the snorkling spot the camera would not turn on though I had loaded new batteries before starting. When I got back and opened the camera I poured about 1/4 teaspoon of water out of the battery compartment. Lense was fogged and water was in the viewing screen.Tried to contact Kodak by email but each time I clicked the submit button, the form cleared and had to start over.Finally called on phone and explained problem to tech. He said I could send it in for repair only (not replacement). He also said if they found I had abused camera they would advise me of the cost of repair and if I didn't agree to pay repair charges they would charge me $35.00 for trouble analysis.Then said they would send instructions for sending camera in shortly after we terminated phone call. It's been two days and only thing I got was a survey on what kind of job the tech did. Afrter a week, I called back and they sent the return instructions.Camera has not been abused though it's got scratches on it from being in my camera case with my DSLR. It's only been used once since I received it and that was a set of test pictures to make sure it worked. Otherwise, it's never been out of the camera bag. Paint on camera is VERY thin and scratches easily. Good way for Kodak to claim abuse.After thinking about it and considering other customer service complaints here, I don't think I'm gonna throw good money after bad by paying shipping to Kodak. I certainly will not pay a $35.00 fee for trouble shooting a camera that's still under warranty if they try to claim its been abused. Think I'll just hang the camera in a prominent place as a continuous reminder of my stupidity for buying a Kodak camera.Too late between purchase and first underwater use to return to Amazon.UPDATE (November 2012) Against my better judgment, I sent the camera back to Kodak. They returned it quickly with no charge other than the $12.00 cost of shipping it to them. Took it on a Caribbean cruise over Thanksgiving with plans to use it snorkling on Half Moon Cay in the Bahamas. The returned camera appeared to be the same one I sent it...same scratches on the case. Kodak repair added a "refurbished" sticker. Shot several great pix on shore and it worked fine. But, identically to the first experience, when I attempted to shoot pix in the water, camera was dead and water appeared inside the viewing screen. Warranty expired in August so no further hope from Kodak. Obviously way too late to send back to Amazon. So, I'm out of a $100 camera I paid $69.00 for.If you can find it on Half Moon Cay, you can have it. It wasn't even worth the added weight of bringing it back home. Based on this experience it's easy to see why Kodak is going out of business.

Reviews.Title: Takes Bad Photos
Reviews.Author: Missy
Reviews.Content: This is the second kodak waterproof camera that I bought. The first one sucked and this one is horrible also. I bought it to take with me to an indoor water park. Most of my pictures came out black and blurry even though i had the flash on. I took probably 50 photos and had about 20 that you could actually make out. After a while water started getting under the lens and a lot of my photos had weird spots and glares all over them. I paid 80 dollars for this and it is going back today. A lot of people have put that it is a good camera for the price, ya i guess if you don't mind black and blurry photos .. i would just rather get my money back lol. I even put it on the h20 setting to take under water photos and they came out alright but still not very clear. Don't waste your money in my opinion i could have bought a waterproof disposable camera and the pictures would have been the same quality as this camera ..

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: AmyRae "amyrae"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use, but it is not waterproof.  We definitely sealed it properly, but both girls used the camera for the first time in their baths, and water got into both battery packs.  I do not recommend this camera if you want something to use for underwater pictures.  We are very disappointed.  That said, if you want a simple camera, it would probably be fine.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: JZ
Reviews.Content: Batteries last about 4 pictures and then die. Stay Away, do yourself a favor and look for a better product. Surprising that Kodak would produce such a piece of %#&^%#*&

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Lys (Caracas, Ven)
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted a waterproof camera for a good price, I received today (Dec 8th) in perfect conditions and I have seen is very easy to program and the pictures are of very good quality. Am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: nice small cam
Reviews.Author: Mr.Twopokey
Reviews.Content: It works and takes nice images.  I would defiantly recommend this cam. Especially for night time.A great little cheap camera.

Reviews.Title: It leaked on first use - total waste of money
Reviews.Author: knittingmami
Reviews.Content: This is the worst consumer electronic product I've ever purchased.It is supposed to be waterproof - and it leaked the first time we used it. Huge disappointment. We were on a family trip and hoped to get pictures of the kids snorkeling. First time we put it underwater - the water leaked it and it died.Also - it doesn't come with a memory card. Come on, Kodak.  What would it cost you to put in a 1 GB memory card these days? A 4 GB USB drive retails for $5, so a 1 GB card would probably cost them a quarter.  But they don't include one.I didn't realize this, because when I turned it on and took a picture, I was able to view the picture. But that is because it has an internal memory card that holds 3-4 pictures.  So while we were on the small island we had to pay an exorbitant price for a memory card (that then never got filled up, because the thing leaked.)I will be EXTREMELY UNLIKELY to ever purchase a Kodak product again after this experience.Amazon really ought to, in the title, say that memory card is not included.

Reviews.Title: Low image quality
Reviews.Author: SimpleMe
Reviews.Content: I understand that it's a low price for a camera but it's not worth it.Unless you like old school/not sharp looking images.

Reviews.Title: Devastated
Reviews.Author: JIM
Reviews.Content: We went on a lifelong dream vacation with this water camera packed expecting to enjoy beautiful pictures.  What we got was nothing!!! We put the camera in the water only a foot deep snapped the picture and nothing happened.  We took the camera back to our room and opened the battery compartment and water poured out.

Reviews.Title: Really disappointed
Reviews.Author: titafire
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews for this camera I proceeded with caution in purchasing it for our trip to Mexico last week.  It seems as though there are many lemons when it comes to this model of camera and I got one of them.  I had the water seeping in as described by other reviewers and it did continue to work properly after drying out the compartment and batteries.  However, my biggest complaint about this camera is fogging.  I missed so many amazing pictures because the lens would fog so badly.  It would normally take about ten to fifteen minutes to correct itself if it did at all.  By that point the turtles, fish and canons were long gone.  I'm so disappointed and plan to toss this in the trash and get something new.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Israel
Reviews.Content: Picked this up for my son who was partaking in a lot of water based activities at summer camp.  Primarily chose it because it is waterproof and inexpensive.  It has certainly exceeded expectations.First off, this camera is indeed waterproof and has also proven itself to be pretty rugged.  The paint is now scuffed up in various places but it still functions as it should.  It has withstood being in the water, being on camping trips, and otherwise being abused in situations where you do not want to carry the digital SLR.Photo quality is very good.  Maybe not DSLR quality but much better than many portable digital cameras.  You would not use it for portrait sittings but for point and shoot it does well.I was concerned that it would eat through AA batteries but they seem to last for a reasonable long time.  I do not like the lack of a viewfinder but this is pretty common at this price point.While this would not be my first choice as a primary camera, for something that is light, portable, rugged, and waterproof, this is a definite buy.

Reviews.Title: 1 picture
Reviews.Author: Zabes
Reviews.Content: That's all it lasted, 1 picture and then shut off, seal is not solid around battery compartment.  I would not recommend wasting your money!

Reviews.Title: Piece of Crap
Reviews.Author: Janet Behning "stand-up comedienne"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a piece of crap.  It was not watertight AT ALL and broke the first time it was used.  I do not recommend this as an underwater camera because it breaks underwater.  We have no idea how it works out of water because we didn't use it out of water.

Reviews.Title: a complete waste of money
Reviews.Author: THOMAS B HACKETT
Reviews.Content: My son took this to the Florida keys.Day 1 it worked fine.Day 2 it went kaput.It's supposed to be waterproof to 3 meters.That's I bought it.It gets a little wet and craps out.I am returning it.Very very unhappy with it.Save your money.That's my advice.

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: RPhmom
Reviews.Content: Water intrusion with first use under water (several inches). Tried to come back to Kodak... Should have gone with gut.

Reviews.Title: wish it hadn't flooded upon first use
Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera. It was attractive, easy to use, took great pictures and was compact. Unfortunately it flooding after taking about 8 photos in chest deep water at the beach. I had purchased it specifically for a trip to snorkle with whale sharks in Mexico. Good thing I tested it out the weekend before. I almost ordered a second one in case this one was just defective but decided the risk was too great for this very special experience. I really wish it was as waterproof as the manufacturer had described.

Reviews.Title: Great on my kayak.
Reviews.Author: JmG
Reviews.Content: I bought the bundle option, which came with the added floating wrist strap. The "blue" color is a little more turquoise if you ask me, but hey its cool, I'm secure in my masculinity. I don't think it matters anyway, because after a ride in the kayak on the camera's first trip, I noticed the paint was beginning to chip off of it anyway...again, it's no big deal. It's a $60 outdoor camera. The camera itself only holds about 6 pictures, so if you don't already have an SDHC card, then you definitely need one if you purchase this camera.  I did not buy this camera to take pictures under water, and therefore cannot comment on it's under water picture taking capabilities. So stop reading if that's what you want to know about, I don't want to waste your time while you are online shopping.I bought this camera because it was cheap, and if it accidently fell in the water from the kayak.....no big deal, that's what it's made for anyway right? It takes great pictures.  They are bright and colorful. I have captured birds in flight with no problems. It has a very fast shutter speed, considering it is a $60 outdoor camera.  It is a little difficult to see what is on the screen while you are outdoors, but once you view them indoors or on your computer they seem to turn out great.This camera has gone out on the kayak three times. It has gotten water dripped on to it from my paddle several times, but has never even been slightly "dunked" in the water by any stretch of the imagination. So again I am sorry I cannot comment on its water tightness. It has given me a little over a hundred beautiful pictures from up and down the river.  It has also given me several great videos.  For $60 I am satisfied, and have probably even already gotten my monies worth. Even if it does get dunked in the water and quits working, well I would be a bit surprised, but I would also gladly buy another one.Also, as usual, the camera was delivered exactly when Amazon said it would be. It was in excellent condition when I opened the box.

Reviews.Title: Kodak C123
Reviews.Author: EJSV
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a cruise. It work great for 3 days and I got some amazing pictures in both a swimming pool and while snorkeling. However, the camera eventually started getting water behind the lens and behind the LCD screen.  Then it stopped working all together. I also found it odd that the camera did not float. I wanted to like this camera and probably would have given it 4 or 5 stars if it did not leak. The battery/SD card compartment seemed to stay dry. I bought this camera at walmart.

Reviews.Title: Terrible pictures, dont waste your money.
Reviews.Author: Ally A. "Ally"
Reviews.Content: I am not a photo pro. I am a mother and I take pictures all the time. I wanted a new camera with greater megapixels so I could crop my pictures. I needed something durable and waterproof as my child is very active. this camera was so cute and it can use rechargable AA bateries so I fell for it. Wow, what aweful pictures. Indoor pictures were dark and grainy,as the flash only hit one small target and the rest was black.  Out door pictures were blurry as the subjects are moving and this sport camera does not come with image stabilization. I want a refund right away. Returned this camera.

Reviews.Title: Palm Guy
Reviews.Author: Palm Tree Guy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an alternative to disposable underwater cameras, which I originally intended to buy. I took the camera in and out of the water more than 10 times in a week in the Virgin Islands on snorkeling trips. The camera never leaked and was very easy to use. Get the bundle so you get the floating wrist strap. For the price, this camera cannot be beat, just wish it had a 3x optical zoom. Also took some photos with it when we didn't want to carry our digital SLR with us. The out of water pictures turned out good.Update 6/2/2013. Have had to return the camera 2 times under warranty for repairs due to leaking.If it leaks again, I will buy a different brand under water camera.

Reviews.Title: Lasted a day underwater.
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a trip in Grand Cayman where I was planning to do a lot of snorkeling. The first day (maybe 1-2 hours total in the water), the pictures turned out great. We loaded the pictures onto our computer and thought we had made a great purchase. The next day we took it out snorkeling again, and after taking a few pictures, it shut down and wouldn't turn back on. After taking it out of the water, I noticed that the viewfinder was filled with water. After opening up the battery compartment, water poured out and I knew it was a goner.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C123 Sport Camera - Nothing Easy About it!
Reviews.Author: Birddogthecat
Reviews.Content: I wish that I could comment about the picture quality and other features of this camera, but because the software is virtually impossible to install I cannot. After 45 minutes with Kodak software support, absolutely nothing was accomplished. I am running Windows VISTA with all the Service Packs installed. I struggled valiantly to understand the fellow assigned to help me (if he was speaking English it was a dialect of English to which I am unfamiliar), it became increasingly clear that he did not know what he was doing.Did I need to install Kodak Easyshare software? Or, did I need the Kodak App Button software? Or both? The support tech had no idea. As for following the instructions in the Extended version of the Owner's Manual (which, by the way, you must download), forget it. It is a fiction: "(1) Turn off the camera, (2) connect the camera to you computer (USB), (3) turn on the camera, (4) the appropriate software will automatically download & install. It's not going to happen.So, as we pack for a month in Belize with time running out, I will have to set another 45-60 minutes trying to understand the next "expert" that is assigned to my case: That is 46-60 minutes + the time to actually get to speak to someone.Finally, I did attempt the Chat Support option, but Kodak Chat does not support Explorer 9 - just Explorer 8 or earlier. How is that for up-to-date technology?This just in! New Kodak Tech showed me how to "go around" the awful Kodak Easyshare program. Now Windows VISTA OS takes over. This is the way to go.UPDATEWe have just returned from a month in Belize. Regarding the Kodak C123 Sport Camera, we are pleased to report that it did not leak! This is the newer edition and perhaps that is why no leaks. Now for the bad news: It is impossible to see the screen underwater! While snorkeling with the camera set to the Underwater Mode and the screen resolution to the High setting, you will see nothing. Just  point and shoot and hope that you got your photo. We managed to get about 70% of what we were aiming at.

Reviews.Title: Smile
Reviews.Author: Merchandise-Just4U "Cynthia"
Reviews.Content: This Camera is "HOT" One of my # 1 Sellers my customers love it great product. Amazing gift for anyone you will get a big Thank You if you purchase it for someone special.

Reviews.Title: never again!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is not waterproof.  The first time I used it, it became waterlogged and for the rest of my cruise vacation I was without a camera!

Reviews.Title: Camera is junk save your money the zoom is bad beyond bad.
Reviews.Author: Richard Geyer
Reviews.Content: Camera is ok if you don't use it, or the zoom everything is out of focus, I should of spent more and got a better a better camera this is not worth the money.Really this camera is one step above a piece of junk. I guess it will go into that drawer were all the junk goes. I thought buying a Kodak camera I would get a quality camera but not to be just another piece of junk made in China.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Had it closed up tight as directed. Didn't last 10 minutes in less than two feet of water. 30-day return window was closed by the time we got back from vacation. A total waste of money.

Reviews.Title: I talk to one of you guys
Reviews.Author: Alfonso Z.
Reviews.Content: I was very surprise that the camera came with out a sd card,They never told us what was included.I deleted the comments so I'm waiting for a sd card,thank you

Reviews.Title: Wow what's the deal here?  All kind of issues!
Reviews.Author: Lilian Love "Love @ Lilian"
Reviews.Content: Planning for my Hawaii trip in August, I purchased 3 brand new Kodak C123.  I deliberately ordered in 3 different colors - which happened to be shipped from 3 different marketplace sellers fulfulled eby Amazon.com.From BUY TODAY:The yellow one arrived and looks like brand new.  However, during the just-out-of-the-box smoke test, the camera auto-shuts down itself after each flash picture.  That's even before taking it anywhere near water.  My brand new AA batteries got drained 1/2 after 5 flash pictures.  THE END!From CRAWFORD'S SUPERSTORE:The blue one arrived and looks like brand new.  The test pictures actually look fine (no water contact yet).  I have to return it however, as the lens area have 3 big dings.  Seems like this one could be a refurb and somebody forgot something?From PHENOM SAVINGS:The red one here is the only one that works as expected on land.  I gonna limit test it underwater soon.But you could see, the experience is not so great already.  Probably I would use the red one for near-water, and get a much more high-end one for true underwater pictures.

Reviews.Title: Product description is incorrect
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: This camera does NOT have optical zoom.  The description of the item is incorrect.  The camera only has digital zoom, which means that the pictures get very grainy when you zoom in.

Reviews.Title: I have not used it yet...looks great so far
Reviews.Author: J R.
Reviews.Content: I needed an inexpensive waterproof camera,  Have not used it yet, but it looks great so far;  Would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for great price
Reviews.Author: Paola
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a present and I had used it on a trip to Jamaica and grand Cayman Islands, I enjoyed this little camera so much! The pictures under water came out great, the video was really good, never had problems with water going inside the camera. I would recommended if you don't want to miss great moments from your vacations!

Reviews.Title: Died on the first day
Reviews.Author: Toddler Teacher
Reviews.Content: I never got the chance to try this camera in the water. I bought it to do a color run, and thankfully bought it about a week before the race. This camera died the day I received it. Thankfully, Amazon quickly returned my money (since I explained I had two days to get the camera before doing a color run).The pictures I was able to take with it before it died, was ok for a point and shoot. However, since I replaced it with a different camera I am glad I did (the other has much better functions, and better pictures).If you aren't needing this for a specific event, I would give it a try. Just be warned it might die the day you get it.

Reviews.Title: Pictures are that great
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: The Pictures aren't that great it you are inside or under water. I brought this camera to take photos under water and all I got was fuzz. If you are outside and there is a lot of light it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: It takes underwater shots, some good some bad.  The main criticism i have is the inconsistency in the camera's ability to focus.  Some of the pictures i took while snorkeling were "dive down" pics and half of them came out as a still shot and the other half were blurry.  Not a big deal if you are going to be using it around a pool, but if you want to capture good quality pics of marine life it can be hit or miss. Make sure to double check how the picture came out before swimming off somewhere.  The camera performed reasonably for the price we paid, but if you want really nice underwater pics - don't hold your breath! Oh yeah one other thing to consider is sunlight.
